text: Kid Rock and Trump in West Palm Beach today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: AG Barr is prepping a summary of the Mueller report findings, but it will not be released tonight, @business reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, who golfed today in a foursome in West Palm, has been in a good mood all day. 

He has expressed satisfaction with how AG Barr has handed Mueller probe's ending so far, even joking about what it would’ve been like if Jeff Sessions still ran Justice Department, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Barr may reveal the top-line conclusions of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report as early as tonight, @FoxNews reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: And he has kept silent so far on his reaction to yesterday’s news. (But I have a feeling it’s predictable.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The latest from the White House is that Trump will leave in place the sanctions announced on yesterday on two shippers, but won’t impose additional penalties on North Korea. 

So...
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Special Counsel Robert Mueller will be ending his service “in the coming days,” aide says, per @cstrohm.

Small amount of staff will remain to assist in closing the operations of the office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
What we know:
—full extent of what Mueller learned hasn’t been revealed
—no further indictments, so several close to Trump, including Don Jr, avoided charges
—Mueller helped secure guilty pleas from 5 involved in campaign
—22-month probe is done.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: When the news broke, Trump was doing a 5 p.m. phone call with Germany’s Angela Merkel, two sources tell me. 

US and Germany arranged the call to talk trade, Brexit and other matters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The AG’s letter to Congress, notifying them Mueller’s investigation into Russia’s interference in the 2016 election is over. 

—Friday, March 22, 2019
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: It looks like a textbook example of political meddling with a central bank in an emerging market, except it’s happening in the U.S., @ctorresreporter and @RichMiller28 report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
News: Stephen Moore has accepted Trump’s offer for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board.

Moore tells @BloombergTV that Tump didn’t discuss Fed chair Jay Powell when he asked Moore to take the post.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: The US posted its biggest monthly budget deficit on record last month.

The giant deficit comes amid falling tax revenue and increasing federal spending.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, with several Caribbean leaders at Mar-a-Lago, says they’ll be talking about Venezuela.

“It could happen,” he says, referring to more sanctions on Venezuela. 

And, BREAKING: US just imposed more sanctions — a reaction to Maduro arresting Guaido’s chief of staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Caribbean leaders w Trump now:
—Dominican Republic’s Danilo Medina
—Haiti’s Jovenel Moïse
—Jamaica’s Andrew Holness
—St Lucia’s Allen Chastanet
—Bahamas’ Hubert Minnis. 

Big crew of nat sec aides at Maralago: Bolton, Charlie Kupperman, Sarah Tinsley, Mauricio Claver-Carone, etc.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump and Pence *both* to attend a Republican Jewish Coalition conference in Las Vegas next month.

Trump speaks to @RJC on April 6, three days before Israel’s general election on April 9.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Yes, Trump just reversed sanctions on North Korea his admin imposed last night.

“President Trump likes Chairman Kim and he doesn’t think these sanctions will be necessary,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: **Mass confusion** as Trump breaks puzzling sanctions news by tweet.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Here’s Stephen Moore’s op-ed that Kudlow showed Trump over lunch last week—and inspired Trump to name the conservative pundit to the board that conducts the nation’s monetary policy. 

Moore blames Fed for slowing the economy and champions Trump policies.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop on how this went down: At lunch last week, Kudlow showed Trump Stephen Moore’s op-ed in WSJ.

Trump said: Why didn’t we make him Fed chair. 

Kudlow said you could name him to one of open seats. 

Trump said call him. 

Later Trump called Moore, too.
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-22/trump-said-to-consider-stephen-moore-for-federal-reserve-board?srnd=premium …
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Trump says he will nominate @StephenMoore to the Federal Reserve Board.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Defense secretary Pat Shanahan, traveling aboard AF1 with Trump, briefed him that the territorial caliphate has been eliminated in Syria.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Steve Moore tells Bloomberg that Trump has “not formally offered” him the nomination to the Federal Reserve. 

But the White House is interested in him for the post, as @SalehaMohsin and I reported last night.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A bad sign: the yield curve turned negative today for the 1st time since 2007. 

Inversions are reliable indicator of recessions.

Analysts are watching this closely, and say it shows the market is worried about slowed growth. 

@notthatECB @kgreifeld
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Turmoil in very powerful sanctions office: 

Trump has nearly doubled number of people and companies under US sanctions. 

But about 20 staff have left the office in charge of handling and enforcing sanctions—heavy instability, @SalehaMohsin reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I know nothing about it,” Trump said before leaving WH today, when asked about Jared Kushner’s WhatsApp use in talking with people overseas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said he has a lot of meetings this weekend, including on trade and China (trying to claim he won’t be doing nothing but watching TV coverage on the Mueller report?). 

He didn’t answer a question about the peace process, but did again claim Democrats are anti-Israel.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, leaving for Mar-a-Lago for the weekend, makes very few remarks to press. Says again he has no idea when the Mueller report will be released.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
White House is considering 2 political figures for board that governs the independent central bank and conducts nation’s monetary policy: Steve Moore, Herman Cain. 

Concerns in the WH, though, about whether Cain could clear Senate confirmation process.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-22/trump-said-to-consider-stephen-moore-for-federal-reserve-board?srnd=politics-vp …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: White House is considering @StephenMoore for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board, sources tell @SalehaMohsin and me. 

Moore, a visiting fellow at Heritage Foundation, was founder of the conservative Club for Growth and served on editorial board of the Wall Street Journal.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: Obama in 2011 rejected request from Taiwan for US fighter jets—due to concern about antagonizing China—but Trump wants to go for it. 

White House has given initial green light to a deal for 60-some jets — and some tanks.

It’s a policy reversal likely to provoke China.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Even as universities have received billions and billions of dollars from taxpayers many have become increasingly hostile to free speech,” Trump says as he signs executive order on free speech on campuses.

"You see people being punched hard inthe face. But he didn't go down."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Justice Dept says the AG is at the WH for a regularly scheduled national security meeting; not related to the Mueller probe, @cstrohm reported earlier today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Maduro ratcheted up pressure on Juan Guaido, detaining Guaido’s chief of staff under the cover of darkness,  @DanCancel reports. 

The aide says intelligence police planted two rifles and a grenade in his home.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-21/venezuela-police-detain-guaido-s-chief-of-staff-after-home-raid …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "The biker image is what makes this work. Golfers against child abuse does not have the same feel. The pink alligator shirt and golf shoes standing in the driveway doesn't do the same thing."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump again said GM should sell Lordstown plant if not making cars there. 

GM tells @margarettalev: "We have received inquiries from interested parties related to the Lordstown Complex and the Chevrolet Cruze. 
We will consider any that are truly viable business opportunities."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: McCain died last year of brain cancer.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump: "I just got a little news. They gave it to me as I was walking up here. US forces in the last month have killed the terrorists responsible for the attack in Syria that killed 4 Americans, the Paris theater attack in 2015 & the USS Cole bombing in 2000. We killed them all."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has bashed wind turbines in the past, arguing they can be responsible for bird deaths, and that the noise can make neighbors “go crazy after a couple of years.”

Of interest in Iowa, which has more than 4,000 wind turbines.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump tells the Ohio manufacturing plant workers he's got a job "where you like getting up in the morning." 

"I do," he says, despite negative media coverage. 

"It's fake, it's corrupt, but we've got to live with it, right?"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I remember when a man named Dukakis got into a tank," Trump says at the tank plant in Ohio. "He tanked when he got into the tank. ... How would I look in a tank? OK? Yeah? ... The helmet was bigger than he was, that was not good."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump's at the Army tank plant in Lima, Ohio with acting Defense secretary Pat Shanahan, Army Secretary Mark Esper and adviser Peter Navarro.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Stocks rally on news from Federal Reserve. 

Fed made moves that'll make Trump happy--it will keep interest rates on hold for the full year. 

But it's also a signal economic growth is slowing, and risks from abroad are dimming the outlook.
@jeannasmialek
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The markets didn’t love Trump’s China trade news today.

I asked him at 12:31p if he’ll immediately lift China tariffs once he has a deal. 

Trump said no—tariffs will stay until China shows its complying with deal. 

The S&P 500 immediately took a brief hit, @SalehaMohsin notes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"He's a whack job," Trump told us, referring to George Conway.
"She's a wonderful woman," he said, referring to Kellyanne Conway.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
On the Mueller report, "let it come out. Let people see it," Trump told us outside the White House as he departed for Ohio. 

"I want to see the report."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I have no idea," Trump told us when asked when the Mueller report will be released.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "We’re taking in billions and billions of dollars right now in tariff money — and for a period of time that will stay,” Trump told me when I asked if he’ll immediately lift the tariffs if a deal is reached with Xi Jinping.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump says he won’t lift US tariffs on China goods even after he has reached a deal with Xi.

“We’re talking about leaving them,” he told me. “For a substantial period of time. Because we have to make sure that if we do the deal with China that China lives by the deal.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked about fake intern names in WH report, Kevin Hassett: "We thought just like a post credit scene in a movie that if we added something a little bit humorous at the end that everybody would read their names. And that's what we want. We want our interns to get the recognition."
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Some 2020 Democratic candidates support ditching the electoral college and using the popular vote to pick presidents, including Elizabeth Warren, Beto O’Rourke, Pete Buttigieg.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
What a tragic story. 

An off-duty pilot correctly diagnosed the problem and saved the plane.

The next day, the same jetliner suffered same problem with a different pilot. It crashed, killing all 189 aboard. 

@AlanLevin1 @HarrySuhartono
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The @WhiteHouseCEA buried an inside joke in its 705-page economic report: It lists interns named Steve Rogers (Captain America), Peter Parker (Spiderman), Kathryn Janeway (Star Trek), Bruce Wayne (Batman), etc. 

It’s meant to be a tribute to their “super hero” interns, CEA says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Leaders of Haiti, Jamaica, Saint Lucia, Bahamas, Dominican Republic will meet with Trump on Friday at Mar-a-Lago in Florida, White House says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House confirms WSJ's reporting: Trump is nominating former Delta Airlines official and pilot Steve Dickson as FAA chief.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Facebook thought Scavino was a bot.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I do believe Donald Trump is going to be reelected,” Brazil’s Bolsonaro says.

“I agree,” Trump says, with a chuckle.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Bob Lighthizer, Pat Shanahan, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Larry Kudlow in front row for Trump’s press conference here in Rose Garden with Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro, which starts soon.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump on McCain: "I'm very unhappy that he didn't repeal and replace Obamacare ... Our country would have saved a trillion dollars and we would have had great health care. ...He told us hours before that he was going to repeal and replace, and then for some reason..."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I was never a fan of John McCain and I never will be," Trump said in the Oval Office today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he's “very inclined” to make Brazil a non-NATO ally. 

"We’re going to look at that very, very strongly," he said in the Oval Office with Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro. 

per @justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tweets a Scavino-crafted tweet that the president will be "looking into" reported social media censoring of Scavino.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mueller’s investigation of Michael Cohen began as early as July 2017, when the FBI search warrant for Cohen’s gmail account.

Key takeaways from the newly released documents:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: The new Michael Cohen materials are out — the redacted search warrants and documents  connected to the FBI raid on Trump’s ex-lawyer. @business
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump admin’s “Economic Report of the President” is written.

One chapter in 705-pg report outlines costs of state control of the economy—w references to Karl Marx, Mao Zedong, Venezuela.

Argues Dems’ Medicare for All 
would lop 9% off GDP.

@RichMiller28
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Iowa Gov Kim Reynolds talked to the White House today about flooding there — including damage to grain in storage.

Farmers had big supplies of corn and soybeans in storage, partly because of ongoing trade war.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Obama's chief economist, Alan Krueger, took his own life. 

Obama in a statement didn't mention how Krueger died, but said: "He saw economic policy not as a matter of abstract theories, but as a way to make people’s lives better."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
At a dinner in DC last night with conservative thought leaders, including Steve Bannon, Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro called for an end to communism. 

@simoneiglesias
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is considering other moves to keep Huawei away from 5G in the U.S., but the White House in the conference call today said no announcement yet. 

Huawei was indicted by the Justice Department in January on charges that included industrial espionage. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-14/why-5g-phones-are-new-focus-of-freakouts-about-huawei-quicktake …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The White House, on press conference call on 5G, again raised concerns about telecoms in the US using Huawei technology for cellphone traffic -- but WH didn't name any specific company.

Just said 5G companies that have a track record of unlawful activity shouldn't be trusted.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Headquarters and other buildings at Offutt Air Force base in Nebraska flooded with up to 8 ft of water.

“It’s devastating to the 55th Wing, devastating to the installation and the facilities,” US Rep Don Bacon, R-Neb., a retired Air Force officer, told the Omaha World-Herald.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Folks, if you're not expert on this, stop weighing in like you are. We don't need to hear your opinion on every single thing...Read what the authorities are saying,” Kellyanne Conway on TV amid shooting news to push back on criticism of Trump rhetoric. She spoke to him this a.m.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
2020 politics:

Trump calls Joe Biden "low I.Q. individual." 

His strategy-minded aide, Kellyanne Conway, brought up one 2020 Dem to reporters just now: Amy Klobuchar. She criticized Klobuchar for saying Ds "have to move on" from VA Gov Ralph Northam's refusal to step down.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “No, I don't share those concerns,” Kellyanne Conway told us outside the West Wing when asked about her husband tweeting his worries about Trump’s mental health.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is still on the General Motors topic today, ahead of his Ohio trip. He tweeted that GM and the United Auto Workers should start negotiations now to open the Lordstown, Ohio plant. Open it, or sell it "to a company who will open it up fast," he wrote.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump will be in Ohio on Wednesday, speaking at the Lima Army Tank Plant in Lima, about three hours from Lordstown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
GM’s Lordstown, Ohio plant is closed and unlikely to reopen. 

Trump has taken to twitter to try to shift blame to union. 

Local UAW president David Green told @business Trump pledged to save jobs in area, but unemployment 7.7%.

@BenBrodyDC @mniquette
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Bannon to dine with Bolsonaro at the Brazilian ambassador’s residence Monday night.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Drawing wide contrast with Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: #Iowa.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump makes a very rare appearance at church for a regular Sunday worship service.

It’s a sunny, 44-degree day in March. He’s wearing a red tie on this St. Patrick’s Day morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The last time Trump went to church was for the Christmas Eve service at the National Cathedral. (He was in Washington, and not at Mar-a-Lago because of the government shutdown.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s going to church this morning.

He’s on way to St. John’s Lafayette Park, the little yellow Episcopal church near the White House. 

Very rare for him to go to Sunday worship. He does occasionally attend holiday services at Bethesda-by-the-Sea when he’s at Mar-a-Lago.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As his chief of staff is on Sunday shows trying to answer questions about why Trump doesn’t do more to address rising threat from white supremacy and islamophobia, Trump defends Fox News TV host called out for anti-Muslim rhetoric and warns against being so “politically correct.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “The conversations continue” between US and North Korea, Mick Mulvaney said on Fox News this morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Mick Mulvaney on Fox News said there’s no sign the New Zealand shooter was part of a wider plot, so no extra measures being taken to protect US mosques.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “The president is not a white supremacist. I’m not sure how many times we have to say that,” Trump chief of staff Mick Mulvaney said on Fox News when Chris Wallace asked about New Zealand mass shooting and asked why Trump doesn’t give a speech condemning anti-Muslim bigotry.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: South Korea is worried about US/North Korea relations after Trump/Kim summit crumbled and North Korea threatened to halt further negotiations with Trump, @TheJihyeLee reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Gillibrand announces her 2020 bid.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
New Zealand leader vows she will change gun laws, after attack at two mosques left 49 people dead. 

“I can tell you one thing right now, our guns laws will change,” Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said.

@tracywwithers 

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-03-15/n-z-police-respond-to-reports-of-shots-fired-in-christchurch?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: On this one, the president’s son defends the ex-president’s daughter.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump campaign schedules a Make America Great Again rally for Thursday, March 28 at 7p in Grand Rapids, Michigan. 

His last 2020 rally was a month ago in Texas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pelosi sets veto override vote for March 26.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Breaking: Mueller has asked for a 60-day postponement on filing report on Rick Gates, @business reports. 

Mueller says Gates continues to cooperate with the probe.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has peppered aides on more than one occasion for updates on how Biden is faring in early Dem primary polls — a sign of how seriously Trump takes Biden’s potential candidacy, per @GabbyOrr.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A plane device called a jackscrew found in wreckage of the Boeing 737 Max 8 in Ethiopia was configured to force the jet to dive, investigators have found, per @AlanLevin1. 

Similarities to the Indonesia crash helped persuade regulators to ground the 737s.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kim Jong Un and Trump, however, are still getting along well, North Korea’s Choe Son Hui told reporters and diplomats, per @AP.

“...the chemistry is mysteriously wonderful,” she said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Russian news agency Tass reported that a top North Korean official, Choe Son Hui, at news conference said Pompeo and Bolton "created the atmosphere of hostility and mistrust” and obstructed “negotiations between the supreme leaders” of North Korea and US.
http://tass.com/world/1048754/amp?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
North Korea says Kim Jong Un will soon decide if he’ll halt nuclear talks— latest sign of fallout from failed Trump summit.

“We have neither the intention to compromise with the US...nor much less the desire or plan to conduct this kind of negotiation.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders says US “strongly condemns” the “vicious act of hate” after 49 shot dead at two mosques in Christchurch. 

“Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims and their families. We stand in solidarity with the people of New Zealand.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s likely pick for ambassador to Mexico is Christopher Landau, a Spain-born DC appellate lawyer, per @EMPosts.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Heather Nauert earned a salary of $485,000 at Fox News.

Scaramucci earned $88,461 as a Fox Business Network contributor.

John Bolton made $596,000 as a Fox contributor. 

Bill Shine earned a salary of $1.46M as co-president of Fox News.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump tells pool reporters at WH he doesn’t know when Mueller report is coming. 

There was no collusion, he says. 
“It was all a hoax. It was all a big hoax.”

He says he campaigned in WI, MI, PA, FL.

“You don’t call Russia when you go to Florida.” 

per @jeneps
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I feel very badly for Paul Manafort,” Trump says. “I think it’s a sad situation.”

But he says he hasn’t given the pardon decision a thought yet.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Boeing shares tumble.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Boeing 737 Max 8 and 9 planes grounded in US.

“The safety of the American people and all people is our paramount concern,” Trump says. “Hopefully they will very quickly come up with the answer but until they do the planes are grounded.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: FAA to ground Boeing 737 Max aircraft. All airlines notified.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about Boeing 737 Max aircraft after two crashes, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, on Fox News again today, again offered sympathy to families. 

“Certainly this is very early in the process,” she said, on FAA not grounding planes. “Have to review and see what actually took place.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
And now Cy Vance and state prosecutors in NY are going after Manafort for residential mortgage fraud and falsifying business records, @gregfarrel reports. 

Trump wouldn’t be able to pardon Manafort, if convicted on these charges.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Rudy Giuliani’s bitter divorce may be heading for a long and “unpleasant” trial, judge says, as the ex NYC New mayor bickers with his soon-to-be ex-wife over issues including how to share their house on Long Island this summer, @eelarson reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Breaking: MANAFORT sentenced to serve 43 more months in prison *on top of* the 47 months from his other sentence. 

Total of 7 1/2 years in prison for felonies uncovered as part of Mueller’s investigation into Russian election interference, per @business.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump pick for World Bank, David Malpass, is on track to be next president after no other countries submitted candidates to challenge his choice, sources tell @amayeda, @margarettalev, me.

Countries have til 9a ET Thurs to nominate candidates to lead the development lender.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Judge says Manafort offered “spin” from beginning to end, trying to manipulate the court proceedings.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Judge says there’s no good explanation for the leniency Manafort requested, and he’s not “being straight with me now.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Manafort just asked the judge not to give him any more time in prison.

“I am remorseful,” he says.

And his wife needs him, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: PELOSI: “The House will not take up this legislation to give President Trump a pass.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Verizon names 2 cities—Chicago and Minneapolis—for its initial launch of mobile 5G. 

Plans to be in 30 markets by year-end.

Verizon looking to beat Sprint, which said it would start 5G in May in Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas and Kansas City.

@MoritzDispatch
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Top US universities shunning research money from Huawei amid pressure from Trump admin to limit dealings with Chinese telecom over national security concerns.

Huawei has given $10M.

Princeton, Stanford, Berkeley etc cut or reduced ties, @business reports
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“What we’re looking at here is almost a rebellion against the FAA. It’s the first time I’ve ever seen this happen.”

The world has followed US’s lead on aviation safety since shortly after dawn of jet age. 

Now nations are rejecting reassurances from Federal Aviation Admin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pilot of Ethiopian Airlines jet that crashed Sunday reported he was having flight-control problems and wanted to return to Addis Ababa airport, airline CEO told @MatinaStevis.

Pilot cited no external problems with jet or flight, like bird collision.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Senate Rs are showing more willingness to challenge Trump on foreign policy by voting to publicly contradict him — after they have failed to sway him privately.

@daniel_flatley
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Then-White House counsel Don McGahn apparently sent a letter to the wrong White House printer — the letter, from Trump, firing Comey, ended up in the hands of a Gary Cohn aide, Vicky Ward writes in the book “Kushner, Inc.” out Tuesday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if she thinks her bravery will affect Trump’s re-election, Stormy Daniels at The Wing in DC says yes, but adds: “It’s not my bravery, it’s his dishonesty that’s going to cost him.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Yes,” Stormy Daniels says when asked if she and her new attorney are planning new legal action.

To an audience of women at The Wing in DC, she says her ex lawyer, Michael Avenatti, pulled the old “you can’t fire me, I quit” trick.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Boeing shares posted the biggest two-day drop in almost a decade.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Mar-a-Lago Act.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dick’s Sporting Goods will stop selling firearms at 125 of its stores, @SarahNassauer reports. 

Dick's, which stopped selling guns to buyers under age 21, has been testing a new gun-free model in 10 stores in recent months, @SarahNassauer reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
EPA today released a rule that would allow for E15 gas to be sold year-round. 

It's just the 1st step in fulfilling Trump's promise and delivering a symbolic victory to corn farmers in the Midwest, @jendlouhyhc notes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has flipped a federal appeals court previously dominated by Dem presidents' nominees into a court with a majority of nominees by GOP presidents.

The flip happened today when the Senate, on a party-line vote, confirmed Paul Matey to US Court of Appeals for 3rd Circuit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kim Jong Un "said he would denuclearize. He’s told me that face-to-face, personally, no less than half a dozen times," Pompeo says. 

"What we’ll need to see is action, and that’s what we’re counting on."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Airplanes are becoming far too complex to fly.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The New York AG’s office has issued subpoenas to Deutsche Bank and Investors Bank for records relating to the financing of 4 major Trump Organization projects and a failed effort to buy the Buffalo Bills, @dannyhakim and @WRashbaum report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Trump specifically cited one candidate whom he mockingly said he would not name (he later whispered ‘Hickenlooper’) for dodging a question on capitalism.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"The president's the most accessible in modern history," Sarah Huckabee Sanders said, asked if she will do more press briefings.

Briefing today—March 11, 2019—was about half an hour long, with Russ Vought talking budget, then the press sec taking questions for about 15 minutes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “He likes him,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says of Pat Shanahan, but she declines to say if Trump intends to move him from acting defense secretary to a formal nomination.

text:

Trump today: “Making Daylight Saving Time permanent is O.K. with me!”

text:
Trump’s frustration with negative news wasn’t confined exclusively to Bill Shine. Trump had words with other communications staff, including Sarah Huckabee Sanders and Hogan Gidley, when he was displeased.

But Shine, the ex Fox News guy, was often a target of his disappointment.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Bill Shine offered his resignation to the President yesterday evening, and the President accepted. Bill continues to support President Trump and his agenda and will serve as Senior Advisor to the 2020 re-election campaign,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in statement.

text:

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has championed this troop-billing idea for months, including when McMaster was nat’l security adviser, but it met resistance within admin. 

Aides ignored him. 

Trump’s insistence on it almost derailed recent talks with South Korea over status of 28,000 US troops there.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s “cost plus 50” plan for demanding host nations pay for US troops has sent shock waves through Defense and State depts, where officials fear it will be a big affront to stalwart allies in Asia and Europe already questioning the depth of Trump’s commitment to them.

text:
Manafort, his fortune depleted and his health deteriorating, appeared in court today in a wheelchair.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s national security adviser John Bolton has canceled his trip to South Korea ahead of next week’s summit between Trump and Kim Jong Un, Yonhap reports, citing a diplomatic official in Seoul.

text:
Trump met with Kelly Craft today in Oval Office, I'm told. Pompeo and Bolton were there, too. 

Trump chose Craft after considering Dina Powell, Ric Grenell, and John James. Top White House aides had also discussed Ivanka Trump as possible choice.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kelly Craft, the U.S. ambassador to Canada, is Trump’s second nominee to replace Nikki Haley. Craft was deeply involved in Trump’s renegotiation of Nafta.

text:
Asked about the domestic terrorist who plotted to hurt Dem politicians and TV personalities, Trump said it was a “very sad thing,” he said.

But “no I don’t” bear any responsibility due to his inflammatory comments. “I think my language is very nice.”

text:
Trump was asked, with former Iowa Gov Terry Branstad sitting across from him, if he thinks Iowa US Rep Steve King should run for re-election again.

Trump didn’t commit.

“I haven’t spoken to him in a long time,” Trump said. “We’ll have to take a look.”

text:

-confirmed Bloomberg News’ report that China's Lui He is staying in DC longer to continue trade talks. China delegation will be here Saturday and Sunday now. 
-he's willing to extend March 1 deadline, maybe another month
-he's discussing meeting Xi at Mar-a-Lago.

text:

TRUMP in Oval: “I think he has to learn New York City before he starts running the country because he hasn't done a very good job. Including, by the way, with Amazon."

text:
PRESS: Will you veto the resolution introduced today that would block your national emergency if it passes? 

TRUMP IN OVAL: "On the wall? Will I veto it? 100 percent. 100 percent. 

"And I don't think it survives the veto.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
THEATER when I asked Trump if MOUs in China trade talks will be *long term.*

Lighthizer interrupted to say MOUs are contracts. 

Trump said he disagrees, and doesn’t like MOUs—a bit of conflict with his trade rep that made China’s vice premier LOL.

Trump’s meeting this afternoon with NuScale Power, Westinghouse, General Electric etc.

Also on table: Agreements to share US nuclear tech with Mid East nations, including Saudi Arabia—post-Khashoggi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Scoop: Trump is meeting today with nuclear power industry representatives who are seeking to build more atomic power plants worldwide, sources tell @jendlouhyhc, @AriNatter and me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: Trump is open to some wiggle room on the March 1 deadline to raise US tariffs on Chinese products. 

“I could see myself letting that slide” for a while if American and Chinese officials are close to a deal, Trump told press at Cabinet mtg.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: No plans at the moment for a Trump-Xi meeting at the end of March, Trump tells reporters at White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump shakes the hand of his acting AG, Matt Whitaker.

Whitaker has taken tremendous abuse, Trump says, four days after House Judiciary hearing.

Ivanka, Jared, Kellyanne Conway, Larry Kudlow, Kevin Hassett, Stephen Miller, John Bolton also in room for this Cabinet meeting.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP, discussing border deal meant to avert another closure of the federal govt:

“I don’t think you’re going to see a shutdown.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“It’s not doing the trick,” Trump says of the compromise deal congressional Ds and Rs have tentatively reached.

Trump says he has to study it.

And can add to it, he says in Cabinet meeting.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: “I can’t say I’m happy” with the border security compromise.

Tells reporters in Cabinet Room he’s not thrilled, and Democrats are being obstructionist. But wall is being built anyway, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he’s thinking about doing a Fourth of July parade or other gathering at the Lincoln Memorial.

It would be a ”salute to America,” he tells his Cabinet, with reporters watching.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We don’t know what’s in the document,” Hogan Gidley says, referring to compromise border security deal.

Gidley says he hasn’t talked to Trump yet today after president’s 2:30a arrival back at White House after Texas rally, but Mulvaney told staff: need to hear nuances of deal.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A body double of US Senate hopeful Mark Kelly will be in political Iowa next week giving a speech.

(His twin brother Scott.) 

https://www.engineering.iastate.edu/events/university-sustainability-symposium-keynote-the-sky-is-not-the-limit-capt-scott-kelly/ …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Retired astronaut Mark Kelly, husband of Gabby Giffords, announces run for US Senate seat in Arizona McCain held. 

Kelly tells his emotional bio in a video, with images of his wife after she was shot, and his identical twin, who also became astronaut.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-12/retired-astronaut-kelly-giffords-husband-to-run-for-senate …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Russia says U.S. troop withdrawal from Afghanistan won’t create a power vacuum and the Taliban can be a potential ally in the fight against Islamic State there.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Eye witnesses say a Trump rallygoer shoved and swore at BBC's Ron Skeans, pushed other reporters. 

BBC: “A campaign official for Mr Trump afterwards suggested the attacker was drunk.”

https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-47208909 …

Trump noticed. Paused, asked if everyone OK.
https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/man-attacks-reporters-knocks-over-cameras-during-trump-rally-in-el-paso …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This deal, which would avert another shutdown, awaits Trump sign off.

He’ll be more fully briefed on details today (via staff and TV).

Mark Meadows: "...kicks the can down the road yet again..." "failing to address..." 

Hannity: “...garbage.”

Laura Ingraham: “Pathetic.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ds and Rs in Congress salvaged a deal on border security that depends on Trump accepting less than the $5.7B he’s been demanding for wall.

—$1.375B for 55 new miles of border fencing. 
—Dems dropped cap on number of immigrant detentions. 

@StevenTDennis
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The White House pool reporters who travel with POTUS to events can’t go outside and look for ourselves to assess crowd size (we’re required to stay within the Secret Service security bubble) so we rely on footage like this to see if Trump’s right or wrong about overflow crowds.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump wasn’t entirely wrong when he said there were people outside his El Paso rally who couldn’t get in. 

Hard to tell if it was “tens of thousands” but it was quite a few.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: 6,500 inside Trump rally, around 4,000 outside, per local reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “As I was walking up to the stage, they said that progress is being made with this committee,” Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump weighs in to reporters on AF1 on Ilhan Omar’s apology:

“I think she should be ashamed of herself. I think it was a terrible statement. And I don’t think her apology was adequate.” 

per @justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Public power company is considering closing the last coal-fired unit at its Paradise plant in Kentucky, eliminating another tie to coal.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tells reporters that 75,000 people signed up for his campaign rally tonight in El Paso but the arena holds only 8,000.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “At the same time, I reaffirm...”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Wall Street has a very nervous eye on the March 1 debt limit deadline—and the threat of economic disaster if Ds and Rs unable to compromise, 
@mccormickliz reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A new design for packaged military food — Meal, Ready-to-Eat — has people seeing Trump and @kanyewest in the silhouettes, @simkinsjourno reports.

https://www.militarytimes.com/off-duty/military-culture/2019/02/10/meal-ready-to-trump-mre-package-bears-striking-resemblance-to-president-and-kanye/?utm_source=Sailthru&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ebb+09.02.19&utm_term=Editorial+-+Military+-+Early+Bird+Brief#.XGF_ymmi_6s.twitter …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
White House says Trump will sign an executive order today meant to encourage development of artificial intelligence. 

The action occurs amid aggressive moves by China, where companies are deploying systems to identify faces in crowds, control drones, etc., @BenBrodyDC reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, and Fox News, off to Texas for a campaign rally tonight at 9p eastern.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Negotiators may decide a stopgap funding extension past Friday is necessary to avoid new shutdown, @elwasson reports.

Negotiations broke down Saturday between Rs and Ds, but could still get back on track today.

Bipartisan mtg set for 3:30p today between 4 top approps lawmakers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Last week, predictions a deal could be struck today on border security funding; unlikely now. 

Just one of the sticking pts: Ds want to eliminate previously funded fencing in a butterfly conservation area on Texas border. They allowed fences there last yr; changed their minds.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dems are also demanding language in border security deal aimed at blocking Trump from shifting money to build wall, per @elwasson.

This language could possibly stymie Trump from executive actions meant to tap other accounts to pay for wall. 

Trump: “They want a new subject!”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dems want to cap the number of detention beds available, in order to force Trump admin to prioritize detaining violent criminals rather than ordinary undocumented immigrants. 

GOP says violent criminals in US illegally—convicted murderers, rapists—shouldn’t count toward cap.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Impasse Ds and Rs hit last night was over detaining convicted felons.

GOP said in talks Saturday can we at least agree that convicted violent felons shouldn’t count against the cap on the number detained.

Ds didn’t agree, sources told 
@elwasson and me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Ray Washburne plans to leave after successfully revamping OPIC, which is seen as part of Trump trade war on China. 

Washburne’s leaving before Senate confirmation begins for person who will lead the super-sized overseas economic development agency.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: News: As another shutdown looms, Ds and Rs are at deadlocked again, @elwasson reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The timing of Washburne’s resignation is connected to Trump admin’s restructuring OPIC, I’m told.

Washburne took an agency that was on chopping block and super sized it to help US compete with China.

OPIC will soon become U.S. International Development Finance Corp.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump considered Ray Washburne, a longtime GOP fundraiser, as his nominee to lead the World Bank, but instead chose David Malpass.

Washburne’s name has also been (and still is) in the mix as a possible future Commerce secretary were Wilbur Ross to leave that post someday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Ray Washburne, an admin official close to Trump, plans to notify his staff on Wednesday he’s resigning.

Washburne, head of OPIC, plans to step down March 1, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Hanoi! Instead of Danang. Which means no urge to mention “Danang Dick!” every time he hears Danang.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Prosecutors are reviewing whether National Enquirer’s messages to Jeff Bezos about his affair violated tabloid’s deal to avoid prosecution over hush-money payments to women who claimed relationships with Trump.

If tabloid committed any crime in 3-yr window, no immunity.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Immunity deal says if National Enquirer’s publisher commits any crime in 3-year window, it can be prosecuted for crimes it was granted immunity against (perjury, obstruction of justice).

Bezos says he was blackmailed. SDNY looking whether crime committed.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Lighthizer and Mnuchin will travel to Beijing for principal-level meetings Feb. 14-15, White House says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Any room for a political event can be “packed” if the campaign ensures it’s small enough. 

Reports of about 125 people for Cory Booker’s first campaign event — which is not bad!
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Your failure to respond fully to our questions here today in no way limits the ability of this committee to get the answers in the long run—even if you are a private citizen when we finally learn the truth,” House Judiciary chair Jerrold Nadler said, referring to Whitaker.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We're on the verge of a government shutdown again,” Trump spokesman Hogan Gidley told reporters this morning.

“Because Democrats won't come to the table and have a conversation about securing the country.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I have not interfered in any way with the special counsel’s investigation,” acting AG Matt Whitaker says, in testimony.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: So Jeff Bezos’s girlfriend Lauren Sanchez’s brother Michael Sanchez has circulated the idea that it was the government that was behind obtaining the “intimate” texts and photos that the National Enquirer now has.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Roger Stone, on the leaked Bezos texts, tells me: 

“I know nothing whatsoever about the case other than the fact that Michael Sanchez asked me if I thought it was likely that President Trump and the NSA obtained Bezos text messages and I said that that idea was ludicrous.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
House Dems want to know whether Whitaker is interfering with Mueller’s investigation.

Whitaker: “There has been no change in the overall management of the special counsel investigation”—still consistent with “governing regulations.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Looks like Monday is the day a border deal may be formalized.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Chances of another shutdown are “next to nil,” US Rep Chuck Fleischmann tells @BloombergTV.

The Republican, who is on the panel working on a border deal, says he’s hopeful a "grand compromise" will be reached soon.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Whitaker has warned lawmakers he can’t reveal his discussions with POTUS.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
On this cloudy February Friday, Trump heads at noon to Walter Reed for 4 hrs for health physical.

His acting AG, Matt Whitaker, appears at 9:30a before House Judiciary Committee. After a dispute with the panel over its desire to subpoena him, DOJ says he’ll be there voluntarily.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: U.S. govt has booked several hundreds of beachfront hotel rooms in Danang, a prime candidate location for the 2nd summit between Trump and Kim Jong Un, @business reports, citing Japanese broadcaster FNN.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Jeff Bezos, CEO of http://Amazon.com  and owner of the Washington Post, is accusing the National Enquirer and its owner David Pecker of extortion and blackmail in connection with an expose of Bezos’s relationship with TV personality Lauren Sanchez.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BEZOS says the National Enquirer tried to “blackmail” him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: There is no intent by Adam Schiff to try to obtain backdoor information about Trump via the new hires who have experience in the Trump White House, a House Intel official told us.

But Trump aides don’t believe that.

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-02-07/trump-fears-schiff-is-recruiting-white-house-employees-for-probe?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Adam Schiff's hiring of people with WH experience has led to speculation by Trump and his advisers that @AdamSchiff is looking for insider info as he probes whether business dealings of the president and his family have made them vulnerable to espionage.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-07/trump-fears-schiff-is-recruiting-white-house-employees-for-probe …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump thinks Adam Schiff is brazenly hiring former WH staff in order to gain an edge in his investigations.

Indeed, Schiff hired an ex-NSC aide, Abigail Grace, and another is thinking of joining the Dem’s team, sources tell me, @HouseInSession and @margarettalev.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
News that Trump isn't planning on meeting with China's Xi intensified fears that the U.S. and China won’t strike a deal during the 90-day truce. 

Trump is headed to Asia to meet Kim Jong Un Feb. 27 and 28, but he won't meet with Xi to settle trade deal.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q Could you accept a compromise from the congressional cmte? 

TRUMP: “There could be. I hear they're working on something. We'll see what happens. But I certainly hear that they're working on something and both sides are moving along. We'll see what happens.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q Should Matt Whitaker testify tomorrow?

"I think he's an outstanding person,” Trump told us in Oval Office. “I would say if he did testify he'd do very well. He's an outstanding person. Very very fine man."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
I asked Trump if he’s meeting with China’s Xi in the next month or so. 

"Not yet,” he said. “Maybe.”

I asked if they’ll meet before the March 1 tariff deadline.

"No,” he told me and he shook his head no.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The White House currently is interviewing candidates, including women, to fill two open seats on the Federal Reserve Board but there’s no hurry to make a nomination, Larry Kudlow told @justinsink.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, at the National Prayer Breakfast, is talking about the synagogue shooting. “Horrible, horrible event.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Secretary Nielsen’s doing a great job,” Hannity said tonight, three months after Trump was hashing over who he could choose to replace his Homeland Security chief.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Hannity says he’s heard the admin has found $9 trillion that could be spent on border security, then corrects that he meant $9 billion. 

“We have legal access to substantially more than $5.7 billion,” Trump’s chief of staff, Mick Mulvaney, says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: If Congress won’t authorize spending $5.7 billion for border security, White House will “find the money we can spend with the lowest threat of litigation” then move to next pot of money “that maybe brings a little bit more threat of litigation,” Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump admin ticked off at Germany about this terrorist, Adem Yilmaz.

Acting AG Whitaker to @nwadhams:

“The German govt deliberately helped Yilmaz escape justice by placing him on a plane to Turkey.

Germany “flouted their treaty obligations and has undermined the rule of law.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: The latest conflict between the Trump admin and Angela Merkel’s government:

German officials thwarted U.S. officials’ attempt to extradite a terrorism suspect connected to the killings of two American service members.

@nwadhams 

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-02-06/u-s-erupts-in-fury-as-germany-extradites-terrorist-to-turkey?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Several Iowa Dems who simply want the best candidate to beat Trump have made similar arguments this week.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump announces a Feb. 11 campaign rally in El Paso the morning after he said in his SOTU speech:

“El Paso, Texas used to have extremely high rates of violent crime. ... Now, immediately upon its building, with a powerful barrier in place, El Paso is one of the safest cities...”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Three-week delay for Michael Cohen’s closed-door House Intel appearance.

He already postponed a public appearance before House Oversight due to “threats against his family from President Trump and Mr. Giuliani.” 

He reports to prison for a three-year sentence on March 6.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pelosi gently motioned for her Dems to be polite when Trump said:

1. “If there is going to be peace and legislation, there cannot be war and investigations.”

2. “Mexican cities, in order to remove the illegal immigrants from their communities, are getting trucks and buses...”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
PENCE says 5-week shutdown wasn't a mistake, and can't guarantee there won't be another. 

“I never think it’s a mistake to stand up for what you believe in,” Pence told @jeffglor. 

MNUCHIN to press gaggle: “I don’t think it’s the president’s objective to have a shutdown” again.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Nancy Pelosi orchestrated her own show as she sat behind Trump—she stood for long spells viewing her flock, flipped through transcript pages, smiled, and twice applied the brakes to Dem grumbles with a subtle raise of her hand.
@HouseInSession @annaedge4
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump called for bipartisanship—meaning, work with him on his priorities, on his terms.

Cheaper drugs, end HIV, paid family leave, stop late-term abortion, build wall.

It was his 1st big campaign speech of 2019—in a setting no Dem challenger can match.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Minnesota Dem Amy Klobuchar to announce 2020 bid Sunday.

She has made so many trips to Iowa over the years to fundraise and speak some Ds think of @amyklobuchar as their 3rd US senator. 

An ex-prosecutor, she’s popular in MN; won landslide reelection.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: One of the last ones out of motorcade and into White House residence after State of the Union speech: Tiffany Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said today is the 81st birthday of Holocaust and synagogue shooting survivor Judah Samet.

Chamber spontaneously burst into “birthday” song. 

Trump waved fingers like an orchestra conductor. 

“They wouldn’t do that for me, Judah.”

Samet seemed to say: “What did he say?”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
One of best moments.

“All Americans can be proud that we have more women in the workforce than ever...”

Dem women in chamber looked at each other, cheering. 

Trump: “Don’t sit yet, you’re going to like this.

“We also have more women serving in the Congress than ever before.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and Kim Jong Un will have 2nd summit on Feb. 27 and 28 in Vietnam.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Cupcakes waiting for us at Capitol —the White House press pool is watching the State of the Union from the usual back hallway.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s at US Capitol for the State of the Union. Rick Perry is designated survivor.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Particularly long motorcade tonight to take the president to the Capitol for the State of the Union speech — more than 20 cars.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Great nations do not fight endless wars,” Trump will say at his State of the Union speech. 

and:

“We will not avert our eyes from a regime that chants ‘death to America’ and threatens genocide against the Jewish people.”

per excerpts released by White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Trump will announce his nominee for the next World Bank president at 1:30p tomorrow, per WH.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: At TV anchors' lunch, Trump dismissed potential Dem presidential candidate Joe Biden as “dumb,” called Chuck Schumer a “nasty son of a bitch” and mocked Ralph Northam for “choking like a dog” at the Virginia gov's news conference on the blackface photo.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"On the line for 'race,' Warren neatly printed, 'American Indian,'" the WaPo reports. 

"The Texas bar registration card is significant, among other reasons, because it removes any doubt that Warren directly claimed the identity."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump delegation's trip to China will be early next week, per @jendeben. 

(Unless there’s an agreement by March 1st, the 10 percent U.S. tariffs on certain Chinese imports will rise to 25 percent.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The name of the “designated survivor” will be released in about the next hour, Sarah says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

Words/topics we'll hear from Trump tonight: 
-5G wireless networks
