author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The 11 words the White House wants Americans to hear after Donald Trump’s State of the Union address tonight, via @AriNatter:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Eric and Lara Trump have arrived at the White House, several hours before the State of the Union night.

@LaraLeaTrump is a campaign adviser and occasional spokeswoman for him on TV.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mulvaney did a Camp David weekend with GOP senators on Jan. 26, too. 

Lankford, Perdue, Portman, Kramer and others went. 

Ds invited but none accepted that weekend.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: GOP-controlled Senate rebukes Trump on Syria policy, hours before the State of the Union speech.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Cost for 4 Mar-a-Lago trips was actually more than $13.6 million (which was for airfare, equipment, meals, hotel rooms for personnel who protect president). 

Travel costs for White House staff not included; WH didn’t comply with GAO request for the info.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: GAO estimates that the travel costs are about $1 million a day for Mar-a-Lago trips.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We're giving Congress one more shot at fixing this problem,” Trump spokeswoman Mercedes Schlapp said, referring to border security.

Asked about the national emergency declaration, she said “we're waiting” for now for Congress to solve the situation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Latest: Trump, as of this afternoon, isn’t planning to make the national emergency declaration during the televised speech tonight, sources tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Federal government costs included $60,000 paid directly to Trump’s Mar-a-Lago club, the GAO says in its report, which examined Trump’s visits over four weeks in early 2017.
And the GAO didn’t include salaries or benefits of Secret Service and Defense Dept personnel, per @jeneps.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The White House served chicken for the TV anchors lunch, plus vegetable terrine for the two who are plant-based eaters, I’m told. 

(There are indeed vegans among the White House press corps and the TV anchors.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump didn’t put anything on record during his lunch with the TV anchors, who just left the White House. All off record. (Until it leaks.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: During his State of the Union address tonight, Trump isn’t planning to declare a national emergency on the U.S. border with Mexico.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Breaking: Just four of Trump’s trips to Mar-a-Lago — the four he took in February/March 2017 — cost $13.6 million, the US Government Accountability Office says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TV anchors lunching with Trump ahead of State of the Union speech tonight include: 
ABC's @GStephanopoulos and @DavidMuir
NBC's @SavannahGuthrie and @LesterHoltNBC 
CBS's @margbrennan 
CNN's @andersoncooper and @wolfblitzer 
C-SPAN's @SteveScully 
Fox's Chris Wallace
and others.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ivanka’s response to an art exhibit that lets people throw crumbs at an Ivanka lookalike who then smilingly vacuums them up.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Hours before Trump’s State of the Union, the top US general for the Syria region endorses Trump’s decision to withdraw US troops from Syria, *but* warns ISIS may try to reassert control.

@ACapaccio
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “If he chooses” David Malpass as his World Bank nomination, it would be “a great choice,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in a driveway gaggle.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Gingrich’s defense of Trump’s “executive time”: 

“Churchill slept late, worked late, took a nap every afternoon ( getting into his pajamas).”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump looked at others for World Bank chief, including Heidi Cruz, but, as we reported last week, he wanted  David Malpass, who has a reputation for being tough on China.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Next Interior sec named
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“See you in Florida,” Trump tells us and leaves with Melania, Barron and Amalija Knav and Viktor Knav. 

No remarks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Frozen pool. Waiting for Trump to exit White House for his weekend in Florida. 

Grounds crew did sweep the snow off the lawn so it wouldn’t blow on us when chopper lands and takes off.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: WH briefer wouldn't tell us which countries Trump will mention in his foreign policy remarks in SOTU (Syria? Afghanistan?), or whether a national emergency declaration will come up, or shutdown, or how much infrastructure spending Trump wants, or who is helping write the speech.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In SOTU, Trump will ask Congress to pass US Reciprocal Trade Act (as @jendeben and I reported in early January). 

Will also call for passing new NAFTA, cutting the cost of prescription drugs, and an infrastructure package, a senior admin official told us in the press briefing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump will ask Congress to approve the US Reciprocal Trade Act (as @jendeben and I reported in early January). 

Also will ask Congress to work on cutting cost of prescription drugs, pass new NAFTA and an infrastructure package, a senior admin official told us in press briefing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"CHOOSING GREATNESS" is theme of Trump's State of the Union speech, White House says. 
He'll say: "Together we can break decades of political stalemate, we can bridge old divisions, heal old wounds, build new coalitions, forge new solutions and unlock the extraordinary promise."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “The chant now should be finish the wall as opposed to build the wall,” Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, in Cabinet Room with Ivanka, bashes Pelosi and argues human trafficking is reason to build wall. 

“People have no idea how bad its become,” he says, as Homeland Security officials cite kidnappings, rapes. 

Kirstjen Nielsen says they continually see girls used as pawns.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Russia will respond if US pulls out of INF, the Cold War disarmament treaty, Russian officials say. 

“US is pulling out in order to legitimize putting its missiles in Europe. Well, we have what we need to re-target, such as sea-based missiles,” Frants Klintsevich told @business.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I’ve always liked him,” Trump said of Roger Stone, to NYT. 

“He’s a character, and I’ll tell you what people respect what he said. Bearing false witness, etc. But yeah, people do respect what he said.”

Trump said he didn’t directly or indirectly ask Stone to talk to Wikileaks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
U.S. hiring:  topping all forecasts, 
with 304,000 new jobs—the most in almost a year

Wage gains: cooled. Up 0.1 percent from the prior month.

Unemployment rate:  due to government shutdown.

@ShoChandra 

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-02-01/u-s-payrolls-rise-304-000-while-wage-gains-cool-amid-shutdown?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House confirms reporting by @margarettalev and @nwadhams: US is suspending its obligations under the INF treaty and will withdraw in 6 months “unless Russia comes back into compliance by destroying all of its violating missiles, launchers, and associated equipment.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Abortion opponents may be about to collect their 1st dividends from appointment of Kavanaugh.

US Supreme Court will decide in next few days whether to temporarily block a law that requires abortion doctors to get admitting privileges at a local hospital.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s set to end 3 decades of efforts with Russia to cut nuclear arsenals.

Bolton thinks INF treaty is outdated—it doesn’t address China, which isn’t a signatory.

This will leave New START treaty as only accord between world’s 2 largest nuclear powers—and it expires in 2021.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: New Jersey Dem Cory Booker declares his 2020 presidential bid.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: National security news of the day: Trump is going to suspend US obligations under the INF, a 1987 pact with the ex Soviet Union that became a pillar of international arms control, as US prepares to pull out entirely, @nwadhams and @margarettalev report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Chris Christie says he called the White House about Trump’s “I’m in the White House, & they’re not!” tweet and was told it wasn’t about him.

It wasn’t aimed at me, Christie told @costareports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: If someone in the FBI tipped off @CNN to be at Roger Stone’s house before his arrest, they have an obligation not to out their source, Chris Christie says. It’s part of the First Amendment, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “There might be a second book,” Chris Christie says (jokingly?) to @costareports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Reporter tricks in the Oval. 

@JessicaStoneTV
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s campaign in an arbitration claim says former WH aide Cliff Sims violated a non-disclosure agreement by publishing his tell-all book.

It’s not clear that the campaign’s NDAs are enforceable for the period after its employees joined federal govt.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I think we made progress. We have much work to do,” Lighthizer said in Oval after two days of trade talks with Chinese officials. “But we made substantial progress.

But no deal yet.

Trump said he thinks when he and Xi meet, “everything will be agreed to.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s trade rep Bob Lighthizer and Treasury sec Steve Mnuchin will travel to China for more trade talks in early February.

They have “a tentative date” selected but need to confirm it in the next couple days, Mnuchin told me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: An interesting power dynamic: Trump sat behind the Resolute desk with Chinese Vice Premier seated in a chair facing him — Trump didn’t ask Lui He to join him on the couches (or sit side by side in chairs like is done with heads of state). Pence to Trump’s left.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Former Herman Cain spokeswoman Ellen Carmichael with her argument on Cain's qualifications to be Trump's nominee for one of the Federal Reserve seats.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
”I love the rust belt,” Trump told us in Oval Office during a presentation to the press (with Peter Navarro and Mick Mulvaney) about manufacturing jobs. 

“And the rust belt is no longer the rust belt as far as I’m concerned,” he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Without a wall it doesn't work. We have caravans right now coming up from Honduras, who we give a lot of money to, which is stopping by the way, but we pay 100s of millions to Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. And then they have caravans leaving their country coming up here."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump on California:

“Some people have suggested let me take the wall along California. Let's move it to Arizona. Let's move it to Texas. It'd be a very interesting statement.

“You will have so many people coming into our country that Nancy Pelosi will be begging for a wall.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We’re going to go into everything. ... This isn't going to be a small deal with China. This is either going to be a very big deal or it's going to be a deal that we'll just postpone for a little while,” Trump told us in Oval after an EO signing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: For 2nd Kim Jong Un summit, “we’re going to a certain location. I think most of you know the location is, I don't think it's any great secret. But we'll be announcing the location and the exact date it’ll be at the end of February,” Trump told us in Oval.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I’ve seen it. Last night. I think that’s horrible. Doesn't get worse, as far as I'm concerned," Trump told reporters in Oval Office, referring to Jussie Smollett incident.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: Trump is considering naming HERMAN CAIN to the Federal Reserve Board. 

Cain had a long corporate career and knows the Fed system. He was on board of Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City from 1992 to 1996.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Herman Cain was at the White House yesterday to talk about this, I'm told.

Nominating Cain for the Fed board raises the prospect of a US Senate confirmation hearing that resurfaces the sexual harassment allegations that emerged during Cain's presidential campaign.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: SCOOP: Trump is considering Herman Cain, the former pizza company CEO who ran for president in 2012, for a seat on the Federal Reserve board, five sources told me.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump on book writers: “I’m in the White House, & they’re not!”

Chris Christie’s book “Let Me Finish” follows “Team of Vipers,” a tell-all book by ex-Trump aide Cliff Sims.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Never-Trumpers back in.

Pompeo checked directly with Trump on several hires, even overcoming White House objections on Mary Kissel, a former WSJ editorial writer whom Trump once derided as a “major loser.”

Story by me and @wadhams.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Cynthia Lummis, who has emerged as one of top contenders to lead Interior, is fond of telling colleagues to “cowboy up.”

Conservative Rs in House Freedom Caucus support Lummis, who was a champion of oil, gas and coal development in 4 terms in US House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEWS: The White House is seriously considering Cynthia Lummis, former cattle rancher and Wyoming congresswoman, as Trump’s next Interior secretary, sources told me, @jendlouhyhc and @HouseInSession.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump told @esaagar that he wishes Ruth Bader Ginsburg good health — and that it’s likely the person he nominates to fill the next vacancy on the US Supreme Court will come from his previously released list.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump interviewed Heidi Cruz for the job of World Bank president but 
Treasury’s David Malpass remains the clear frontrunner for the job, sources told me, @amayeda and @SalehaMohsin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump interviewed Heidi Cruz for a job this week.

Cruz, wife of Ted Cruz, met in Oval with Trump about the World Bank post. 

Trump is picking someone else, though.

Cruz formerly worked for the National Security Council, Treasury Department, Goldman Sachs.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if the Fed caved to Trump’s earlier criticism about the pace of rate hikes, Fed chair Jerome Powell says Fed doesn’t take political considerations into account.

“Doing our job for the American people and using our tools appropriately. That’s very strongly our culture."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: 17th Street near the White House shut down after a traffic incident near EEOB and USTR as China trade officials visit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Harley-Davidson stock plunged 33% last year.

And barely broke even in the last quarter of 2018, @gablova reports.

The Wisconsin-based motorcycle company got caught up in Trump’s trade wars.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump scheduled to meet again with Chinese vice premier Liu He — they’ll see each other on Friday this week.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Carlos Vecchio @carlosvecchio says he told @VP that since Jan. 22 Maduro regime "killed 35 people and has arrested more than 800 people...And today they filed a criminal petition against the interim president of Venezuela, Juan Guaido, and could be arrested in the hours to come."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "We had a great meeting with Vice President Pence" and his team that lasted almost an hour, Venezuela's Carlos Alfredo Vecchio, a representative of Juan Guaido's government, tells us outside the White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Malpass, a frontrunner for new World Bank president, runs the Treasury division that controls the U.S. nomination for the World Bank president. 

But Trump's search task force is being led by Mnuchin and Ivanka Trump, aides say. Malpass isn't involved.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: A Trump loyalist, David Malpass, is a finalist to be the president’s choice to lead World Bank, sources tell me and @SalehaMohsin. Trump is still interviewing candidates. But unless Trump changes course, it won't be Ray Washburne, Mark Green, Robert Kimmitt, or Indra Nooyi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mitch McConnell makes a rare break with Trump. 

McConnell proposes a measure urging the U.S. to continue fight against ISIS and al-Qaeda in Syria and Afghanistan and avoid any “precipitous withdrawal," @StevenTDennis reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Russia vows to “do everything” to protect Venezuela’s Maduro against Trump administration efforts to oust him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The military is weeks away from liberating 100% of the remaining territory held by ISIS in Syria, acting Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan says, per @ACapaccio.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: And an early stumble by lawyers in Roger Stone case, per @AndyNewsNowInDC
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Issues in the Manafort case.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Arizona’s Jeff Flake says he won’t run against Trump in 2020. 

“I have always said that I do hope that there is a Republican who challenges the president in the primary,” said Flake, now a CBS analyst.

“I still hope that somebody does. But that somebody won’t be me.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Yes,” Sen. John Kennedy said this morning when Fox News asked him if Bill Barr will be confirmed as AG.

Kennedy said he knows a lot of Dems will vote against Barr, but if you gave them truth serum they’d admit Barr is “exceptionally qualified” to be attorney general.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Tax refunds will be paid out “as normal,” Treasury’s Steven Mnuchin said on Fox Business this a.m., per @SalehaMohsin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The White House will send to a budget proposal to Congress later this year with “very tough” spending cuts, Trump’s economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Fox Business today.

“A very tough spending budget, with reductions of at least 5% across the board in non-defense accounts.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As Cliff Sims talks about his memories as White House aide, Trump tweeted that Sims “pretended” to be insider.

CNN read it out loud. Sims said his faith is more important to him than Trump — he knows what Jesus says he is and it doesn’t matter what Donald Trump says about him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We’ll see you next time,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says at the close of her first press briefing in 41 days.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if Trump has ruled out a pardon for Roger Stone, “I’m not aware of that” — no conversations with Trump on that, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says at Jan. 28 press briefing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Not aware of any statement like that that Stephen Miller “has ever made,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders says if Trump has to take execution action on border/immigration, Democrats will get “nothing” — none of their priorities such as protection for Dreamers. 

Better for Dems if they do a deal, she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “There is a process. We’ll see if it works,” Larry Kudlow says when asked if he’ll counsel Trump not to shut down the government again.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Missed you guys,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says as she starts press briefing.

She’s with sanctions maestro Steve Mnuchin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Marco Rubio says Trump admin will place sanctions on Venezuela's state-run oil company.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Sifting through rolodex for friends in Council Bluffs, Atlantic, Winterset, Indianola, Centerville, Fairfield, Burlington and Keokuk.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s bad day: Roger Stone’s arrest, airport chaos, shutdown surrender.

by @justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
British newspaper The Telegraph agrees to pay Melania Trump “substantial damages.”

Says it erroneously claimed she cried the night Trump elected, falsely described her father, wrongly reported the reason she left a university program, and other errors.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump: “If we don't get a fair deal from Congress the government will either shut down on Feb. 15 again or I will use the powers afforded to me under the laws and the Constitution of the United States to address this emergency.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “In a short while I will sign a bill to open our government for 3 weeks until Feb. 15,” Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Roger Stone, who appeared in court in handcuffs, told the judge he has no valid passport, Bloomberg News reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Breaking: Bail set for Roger Stone at $250,000, and his travel is limited to DC, NY, Virginia and Florida, per @business.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump likely to use his (eventual) State of the Union to tout efforts to accelerate construction of oil and gas pipelines. 

Admin is considering steps to limit states’ ability to block interstate gas pipelines and other energy projects, per @AriNatter @jendlouhyhc.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump press sec Sarah Huckabee Sanders tries to distance Trump from Roger Stone, who worked diligently to crush Hillary Clinton’s campaign. 

She says Stone indictment has nothing to do with president, and Stone is somebody who has been a consultant for dozens of GOP candidates.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
According to the indictment, by June or July 2016 Roger Stone told “senior Trump campaign officials’’ that he knew that WikiLeaks had damaging information about the Clinton campaign. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-01-25/roger-stone-arrested-in-florida-special-counsel-says-jrbymo5f?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
No wall funding, Schumer aide tells @StevenTDennis. 

“Schumer and Senate Democrats have made clear to Leader McConnell and Republicans that they will not support funding for the wall, prorated or otherwise.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Another day in paradise, right?” Trump told the press earlier today in Cabinet Room. 

And: 

“French fries—one of our favorite meals.”

“You're such a good-looking guy. He's a handsome man.” (Referring to @Robert_Aderholt.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says Pelosi was “reasonable” to say no State of the Union address til after govt reopens. 

“It’s really her choice,” he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, in Cabinet Room, tells reporters there are many ways to fund border wall — including without Congress.

per @justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After shutdown votes failed, Trump called reporters in to talk about a different topic: the US Reciprocal Trade Act.

@jendeben and I wrote about it:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump claims victory in Senate vote on GOP shutdown proposal, saying 
“we won 50-47.”

Then he notes: but 60 votes needed.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump would consider a CR only if it includes a “down payment” on the wall, Sarah Huckabee Sanders say.

White House just called pool reporters to an unscheduled audience with POTUS.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: It’s obviously too late, but the two affidavits Joni and Gail Ernst filed in October detailing very personal details in their divorce dispute have now been sealed by the court.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Image Joni Ernst has tried to portray is of riding motorcycles, castrating pigs, serving in combat. Talking about 2 most painful incidents—rape at 19, violence from a military man 16 yrs her senior who she married at 22—she said: “I’m afraid people will look at me differently."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Gail Ernst hasn't commented on ex-wife Joni's recollections of night he gripped her by the neck and banged her head on staircase.

“Out of respect for his family, Gail is declining to make any statements at this point,” his attorney, Ivan Miller, says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Wilbur Ross on shutdown loans: "Obligations that they would undertake, say borrowing from a bank or a credit union are in effect federally guaranteed. So the 30 days of pay that some people will be out, there's no real reason why they shouldn't be able to get a loan against it."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: After divorce records meant to be sealed went public, a US senator shares her personal story of rape in college, and later abuse. 

“He turned around at the landing, and he grabbed me by the throat with his hands and threw me on the landing floor...”

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-24/republican-senator-joni-ernst-says-she-was-raped-in-college …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q COHEN SAYS BEEN THREATENED BY YOU & GIULIANI

TRUMP: "I would say he's been threatened by the truth...he doesn't want to do that—probably for me or other of his clients. He has other clients also, I assume, and he doesn't want to tell the truth for me, or other of his clients."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q: PELOSI BLOCKED YOUR SOTU.

TRUMP: “I'm not surprised. It's really a shame, what's happening with the Democrats—they've become radicalized. They don't want to see crime stopped, which we could very easily do on the southern border. ... 

“This will go on for a while.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pelosi says the House will not entertain Trump for the State of the Union on Jan. 29 — or until the govt is reopened.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Exactly. Both stood up to Trump, and Trump has badmouthed both of them, and both are dealing with that.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Meanwhile, Stormy Daniels’s lawsuit over Trump’s “hush” money hangs by a thread. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2019-01-23/stormy-daniels-suit-over-trump-hush-payment-hangs-by-a-thread?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pete Buttigieg, a 37-year-old Indiana mayor and Afghanistan war veteran, kicks of presidential exploratory committee.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I’ve been here 2 weeks,” new US senator @SenRickScott said after meeting with Trump with @marcorubio, @GovRonDeSantis and @MarioDB at WH. “I can’t imagine why this government is shut down.”

Then he said “it’s Nancy Pelosi” when asked why shutdown not resolved.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I think the president is considering every appropriate option,” Marco Rubio said at White House after Oval mtg, when asked if Trump is considering giving Venezuela state-sponsored terror designation.

Florida delegation urged Trump to recognize Juan Guaido as rightful president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Can I just, can I just — please,” Trump economic adviser Larry Kudlow said when his CNBC interview from briefing room ended and reporters lobbed questions. 

He took his mic off and predicted an “immediate snapback” in the economy after shutdown ends.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Don’t think this is true. As of right now, they have not been invited, I’m told. 

The Covington students aren’t coming to the WH tomorrow, or this week.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The White House sent an email requesting access to House chamber for State of the Union prep. House officials waiting for Speaker Pelosi's office's guidance on how to proceed, sources told me and @HouseInSession
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Hola, I’m Mike Pence,” the @VP says in this new video. It concludes with “Vayan con Dios!” or “Go with God.”

The US wants Venezuelans to rally around opposition leader Juan Guaido.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: On the eve of protests in Venezula aimed at overthrowing the Maduro regime, Pence is urging the Venezuelan people to “make your voices heard” against President Nicolas Maduro, @margarettalev reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
US Supreme Court allows an anonymous company to file a redacted appeal in case believed to be tied to Mueller probe.

The unidentified company is appealing a ruling requiring it to provide info to grand jury or pay daily fines of $50,000, per @GregStohr.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“The last thing you would expect to hear sitting in a restaurant in Paris is another American who I didn't recognize saying 'Do you want to speak to the president,’” reporter Dan Balz said. 

Trump called @JoeSquawk and ended up with @danbalz, thinking he was a random supporter.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump left the White House for 16 minutes this morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kamala Harris on MLK Day says she’s running for president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kamala Harris announces her presidential bid on MLK Day.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
SHUTDOWN DEAL: It would fund the government through Oct. 1, enact Trump’s compromise immigration offer, and provide $12 billion in disaster aid, @elwasson reports. 

Senate plans a vote as early as Tuesday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: The next Trump/Kim Jong Un summit will be in VIETNAM, sources tell me and @nwadhams. 

High-level talks have focused on Hanoi, Danang, Ho Chi Minh City.

Things could change, of course. But the Trump admin plan right now is for Vietnam.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s going to Dover Air Force Base in Delaware to receive the remains of the Americans who were killed in a suicide bombing in Syria earlier this week, per @margarettalev.

“ISIS remains a threat,” Pentagon spokesman says.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-19/trump-to-be-at-dover-afb-for-remains-of-troops-killed-in-syria …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
At Culver funeral: @JoeBiden, @SenChrisDodd, @VickiKennedyMA, ex-Sen Dick Clark, rep from VP Henry Wallace family, full church at St John Lafayette Square. 

@ChetCulver said his dad was once asked “about his slight temper.” What sets it off? “I handle it on a case by case basis”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Kushner Cos. has begun evicting its 2nd-largest tenant in a Times Square property, @CalebMelby reports. 

Lenders approved the lease termination after tenant, Gulliver’s Gate, which exhibits miniature models of Manhattan as a tourist attraction, hadn’t paid rent since Nov.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Unbecoming of the speaker to make that type of accusation,” Sarah Sanders told WH gaggle, referring to accusation admin leaked news of Pelosi’s commercial flight to war zone.

“Outrageous that she would accuse the president of the United States of putting any life in jeopardy.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The 2nd Trump-Kim Jong Un summit will be “near the end February,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says after Trump and Kim Yong Chol met for 90 minutes in Oval Office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Senate Rs are pushing for Michael Cohen to testify *privately* to Senate Intel Cmte in early February, per ⁦@HouseInSession⁩.

“If there is audio (of Trump and Cohen), we'll find out soon enough,” said Dem Michael Quigley of House Intel Cmte.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump and Kim Yong Chol “will discuss relations between the two countries and continued progress on North Korea’s final, fully verified denuclearization,” @presssec says.

(Likely also a possible second summit between Kim Jong Un and Trump.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Confirming Bloomberg News’ scoop from Wednesday, Trump will meet with North Korea’s Kim Yong Chol today, WH confirms.

Meeting is at 12:15p in the Oval Office, per Sarah Huckabee Sanders.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kim Yong Chol’s meeting with Pompeo in Dupont Circle just finished up.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A person familiar with the congressional delegation’s plans told Bloomberg News early today that Pelosi planned to fly commercial to Afghanistan. 

Bloomberg didn’t publish a report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Shutdown has “SIGNIFICANT EFFECT” on economy, says John Williams of @NewYorkFed.

“It is going to be a drag on consumer spending and the economy in the 1st quarter directly, enough to pull growth down by up to a 1/2 percentage, or maybe even a percentage point, if it continues.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pelosi delegation had planned to fly commercial to Afghanistan, per aide @Drew_Hammill, but it was scrapped due to increased danger to the delegation. 

“This morning, we learned that the Administration had leaked the commercial travel plans as well."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
No Davos for the Trump delegation after an afternoon of scrutiny on the topic.

“President Trump has canceled his delegation’s trip,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Not everyone dismayed Trump grounded Pelosi, on day 27 of shutdown.

Senate GOPer says: “We were clapping here!”

And a Wall Street source says: “This was awesome ... Made the trading floor’s day.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pelosi aide @Drew_Hammill says lawmakers were traveling to Afghanistan to thank servicemembers and for “intelligence briefings from those on the front lines.”

And to meet with NATO commanders in Brussels during a required pilot resting stop. No Egypt leg as Trump said in letter.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House is claiming Trump’s decision to yank Pelosi’s access to a government airplane to visit US troops and allies overseas wasn’t a response Pelosi’s request to postpone Trump’s State of the Union — it was to keep the House speaker here to negotiate on shutdown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
GOP’s Lindsey Graham: “Speaker Pelosi’s threat to cancel the State of the Union is very irresponsible and blatantly political. 

“President Trump denying Speaker Pelosi military travel to visit our troops in Afghanistan, our allies in Egypt and NATO is also inappropriate.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “It demeans the office of the presidency because it is so petty,” House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer says of Trump’s move to block Pelosi from leaving town during shutdown, per @elwasson.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pelosi was supposed to leave in a government plane this afternoon, source confirms.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Trump admin is weighing whether or not to renominate Marvin Goodfriend to join the Federal Reserve Board as the president’s scrutiny of the central bank intensifies and support for the economist fades.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tells Pelosi her overseas trips have to be postponed due to shutdown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: More than $13 billion in duties imposed by the Trump admin have been assessed on imported goods.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We have some very bad players out there.

“And we’re a good player.

“But we can be far worse than anybody, if need be,” Trump says at the Pentagon, a day after Pence named Iran, North Korea, Venezuela, Cuba, Nicaragua as the “Wolf Pack of Rogue States.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
At Pentagon, Trump brings up SPACE FORCE and says a space-based missile defense layer is needed.

And the US will recognize space as a new war-fighting domain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
At Pentagon, Trump offers “my deepest condolence” to the families of the 4 Americans killed in Syria attack Wednesday.

“We will never forget their noble and immortal sacrifice.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Giuliani trying to clean up his comment that “I never said there was no collusion” between Trump camp and Russians. 

“I have no knowledge of any collusion by any of the thousands of people who worked on the campaign,” he says in a statement to @spettypi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The US House Dems talked in their caucus meeting this morning about new polling out today that shows the president’s approval rating is suffering because of the shutdown, @elwasson reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: If the Trump admin was waiting to announce Trump’s meeting with Kim Yong Chol until they saw if he actually got on an airplane for the US, @YonhapNews reports the North Korean official left for DC from Beijing on United Airlines flight UA808.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
WH views space as key next step in missile defense.

Report says China likely developing space-based system for responding to nuke attack.

Placing weapons in space long considered a controversial line for any nation to cross. But Trump wants Space Force.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump today will make the case for expanding the US missile defense arsenal.

Missile defense spending was already boosted 25% this year to $9.9 billion amid concerns over North Korea’s ballistic missile and nuclear programs. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-17/trump-said-to-prepare-case-for-funding-new-missile-defense-plan?utm_source=RC+Defense+Morning+Recon&utm_campaign=0b4121fdf3-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_01_16_08_12&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_694f73a8dc-0b4121fdf3-81810953 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence has updated and expanded the “Axis of Evil.” 

The moniker for US's biggest adversaries is now the “Wolf Pack of Rogue States.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: A top North Korean official, Kim Yong Chol, is set to meet with Trump and Secretary of State Pompeo in DC later this week, sources told me and @nwadhams, signaling that a 2nd summit between the two countries’ leaders could happen soon.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As shutdown drags on, federal workers are tapping their retirement funds.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Press Secretary Sarah Sanders in statement confirms U.S. troops killed in Syria attack, but doesn't say how many. "Our deepest sympathies and love go out to the families of the brave American heroes who were killed today in Syria."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The missile review outlines the admin’s vision for upgrading defenses that have historically focused on threats of missiles from rogue nations such as North Korea and Iran.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump will visit the Pentagon tomorrow. 

He'll announce the findings of a missile defense review, @ACapaccio reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Rand Paul is coming to the White House today to urge Trump not to waver on his plan to pull 2,000 U.S. troops from Syria, @StevenTDennis reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
GOP blocked Dems' bid to keep sanctions on 3 Russian companies linked to oligarch Oleg Deripaska. 

Mnuchin intends to keep the sanctions against Deripaska himself, and has said Deripaska, not the 3 companies, was the intended target. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-16/democrats-lose-bid-to-keep-sanctions-on-deripaska-related-firms …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: U.S. forces in Syria sustained what may be their deadliest attack yet — just a month after Trump claimed victory over ISIS terrorists in the country and ordered a pullout of American military.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Doesn’t sound like the White House is jumping to move the speech date from Jan. 29.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A suicide attack — ISIS is claiming responsibility — in the Syrian town of Manbij has reportedly injured American soldiers.

INITIAL report: Four U.S. dead, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has been briefed, and the White House is getting initial reports on American injuries.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump admin orders thousands of furloughed employees back to work without pay.

They’ll inspect planes, issue tax refunds, monitor food safety and facilitate the sale of offshore oil drilling rights, etc, per @jendlouhyhc.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-15/trump-s-selective-recalls-curb-unpopular-disruptions-tests-law?srnd=premium …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Catching up on headlines after week out of country:
—Trump *still* struggling to end painful govt shutdown after many stunts (live TV address, meeting walk-out, border trip)
—FBI wanted to know whether or not Trump’s a Russian agent
—Silver trays of greasy fast food served at WH.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Typo fix:  US Customs and Border Protection.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Officer Floyd at US Customs & Border Patrol at @CBP Charlotte saw I’m from DC and asked what I do. 

“Reporter.” 

Shutdown ongoing, he said. Not paid since 12/21.

“Tell Trump I said ‘Don’t give in,’” he said. Floyd says he has savings.

But not all his coworkers feel same.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: US Rep. Steve King with a strong GOP challenger in Iowa 4th.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ivanka Trump, Jared Kushner, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Kellyanne Conway, Bill Shine and Stephen Miller were in the Oval Office during the speech, which ran about nine minutes. 

Trump didn't offer any new ideas for resolving impasse that’s led to govt shutdown, now in 18th day.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump's 1st Oval Office national address ends with no mention of calling for a national emergency to bypass Congress to fund his wall.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Schumer, a day before meeting with Trump again, has this to say about the shutdown:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump is expected to urge Congress in his *State of the Union* address this month to pass new legislation to give the president broad authority fight what he sees as unfair trade barriers. 

Story by me and @jendeben
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Trump is increasingly eager to strike a deal with China soon in an effort to perk up financial markets that have slumped on concerns over the trade war.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump budget director told House Rs food stamps will go out during shutdown, Bloomberg News confirms.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pelosi and Schumer to head to White House tomorrow for Trump meeting on shutdown, @elwasson reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Business lobby calls for end of shutdown.

Chamber of Commerce says:
—businesses are unable to receive assistance from Small Business Administration
—companies can’t raise capital or go public
—travelers are delayed
—mortgage approvals delayed
—etc.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Alternative to watching TV at 9p tonight when Trump’s on.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
It’s unlikely Trump declares in speech tonight that he’ll use powers to divert money to wall—and Rs have mixed feelings about doing it at all. 

Trump ally Mark Meadows: “A national emergency declaration is an option but it should be the last option used.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
These White House talking points give a pretty good foreshadow of Trump’s message in his 1st Oval Office address.

“...border is overwhelmed with illegal immigration, gang violence, crime, drugs, and human trafficking...”

“Crisis” used, “terrorism” isn’t.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The plan as of now, I’m told, is that Trump will NOT declare an emergency powers order in speech tonight, I’m told. 

But some of his conservative allies — those who truly want a wall and not just a face-saving exit from shutdown impasse — are urging him to do so.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence told us he was struck that the Dem staff on Sunday “actually used the phrase that they did not dispute our facts about the border.“

Actually: Dem staff just didn't contradict VP. Because Pelosi/Schumer already made clear they  disputed some of a similar WH presentation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The law also allows the Defense secretary to terminate or defer construction of Army civil works projects during a national emergency.

That again risks a political backlash because the $7B Congress has devoted is mostly for important commercial routes and flood risk management.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
If Trump diverts any of the $10.3 billion in military construction funding, it would mean sidelining projects for military families, @justinsink notes. 

$1.6B of that budget is slated for family housing, $352M for medical facilities, and $267M on educational facilities.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump wants to use emergency powers to build wall, a legally questionable move.

One provision allows DOD to shift military construction funds during crisis, @justinsink reports.

Or “immigration emergency” gives new powers if there’s an influx of aliens.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Erdogan snubbed Bolton. But politely. 

Bolton (and Dunford and Syria aide James Jeffrey, an ex US ambassador to Turkey), met with Erdogan’s spokesman, Ibrahim Kalin.

Erdogan called Kalin during mtg to convey he couldn't join them but sends his regards, @margarettalev reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Erdogan, frustrated by evolving US conditions for a withdrawal from Syria, refused to meet with Trump adviser John Bolton, per @TurkWonk and @margarettalev.

Erdogan ripped into US proposals that a US-backed Kurdish group play key role in Syria after US troops leave.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pelosi and Schumer in statement: “Now that the television networks have decided to air the president’s address, which if his past statements are any indication will be full of malice and misinformation, Democrats must immediately be given equal airtime.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kim Jong Un is visiting China, per China state media.

It’s his 4th trip there, and a sign that the North Korean leader may be consulting Chinese leader Xi Jinping ahead of a possible 2nd summit with Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: LATEST: The networks are carrying Trump’s Oval Office prime time speech Tuesday night: CBS, NBC, ABC, CNN, Fox.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: So far, CBS, CNN, Fox News, Fox Business planning to run Trump's prime time Oval Office speech.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump's budget chief told reporters that despite shutdown:
-trash will be collected and restrooms cleaned in national parks as of this weekend
-fish and wildlife refugees will be kept open for next 30 days
-Coast Guard will get paid
-new flood insurance policies "will be done."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Deleted a tweet. To clarify: SOME networks have agreed to air Trump's prime time Oval Office address.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has "made no decision on that,” Pence tells us when asked if Trump will pursue a national emergency declaration. "What I'm aware of is that they're looking at it and that the president is considering it." Says he wouldn't want to go beyond what Trump has said on the topic.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pence told reporters the Trump administration wants statutory change to allow children to apply for asylum at embassies in other countries, which would require personnel changes at State Dept.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The reason Trump is asking for more money now for the border than in his proposed budget is because "things have gotten a lot worse," Pence says. Even the @washingtonpost reported over the weekend there's a "bonafide" crisis, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pence, in a briefing with reporters, says he's hopeful the shutdown can be resolved, but Democratic leaders need to accept Trump's invitation to come back to the WH this week "and start negotiating."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEWS: The Trump admin has worked a fix so that tax refunds will be issued during the shutdown, OMB head Russ Vought tells us.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Budget chief Russ Vought just told reporters TAX REFUNDS WILL GO OUT despite the shutdown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: KJU headed to China in middle of the night to meet with Xi? Lots of speculation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Trump travel to the border on Thursday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Still at a shutdown impasse. Neither side budged in Pence’s meeting with Dems, aides say.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is edging closer toward a radical move to fund border wall 
—by declaring a national emergency—after the prospect of a deal with Dems to re-open government dimmed today.

White House lawyers and budget staff have been looking into idea for a while.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said he’d rather wait to deal with Dreamers after SCOTUS decides whether to intervene on future of Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals.

“I would consider DACA but I think it's complicated. I'd rather have the Supreme Court rule and then work with the Democrats on DACA.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, returning from Camp David, says he informed his aides to say build a steel barrier.

We’re going to be doing a steel barrier and that will give us great strength, Trump said, per @justinsink.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mulvaney: “We give the president—the chief executive officer of the country—a great deal of latitude over how the government is run.” 

“Presidents have authority to defend the nation.” 

BUT ADDS that they’re asking agencies to find money “we can legally use” to guard border.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, before leaving for Camp David, again said he might try to use a national emergency declaration to skirt Congress and divert funds from military budget to pay for a wall. 

“I may declare a national emergency dependent on what's going to happen over the next few days.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “But I sort of like actings. It gives me more flexibility, do you understand that? I like actings. ... We have a great, great Cabinet.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After Army probes, Golsteyn was charged with the murder of an Afghan man during his 2010 deployment to Afghanistan.

Golsteyn on Fox News in 2016 admitted he had killed the man,  suspected of being a Taliban bomb maker.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After midterm elections and halfway through 1st term, Trump continues to do some house cleaning—Jeff Sessions, John Kelly, Ryan Zinke. He has discussed DHS chief replacements and mused about whether Wilbur Ross is ready to go (he’s not).
