text: One person not in contention for Trump’s chief of staff: Jared Kushner.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Sarah Huckabee Sanders to gaggle at WH: “On the inaugural committee: that doesn't have anything to do with the president or 1st lady. ... The president was focused on the transition during that time and not on any of the planning for the inaugural.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: As Trump hunts for a new chief of staff, John James, the Republican Michigan businessman who unsuccessfully ran for the U.S. Senate this year, was at the White House earlier this week and met with Trump and Pence, I'm told. Unlikely that he's a frontrunner for chief, though.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he is considering “five” candidates for chief of staff. 

NEW: One, David Bossie, was just spotted entering the West Wing. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-12-13/trump-says-he-is-considering-five-candidates-for-chief-of-staff …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump will spend 16 days at Mar-a-Lago over the Christmas and New Year’s holidays, according to an alert issued by the FAA today, @StapletonPBPost reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I never directed Michael Cohen to break the law.” — Trump, one day after his most rabidly loyal business associate was sentenced to three years in prison.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Bolton will accuse Russia and China of “predatory practices” in Africa in a speech today, @margarettalev reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Hannity: “What’s been the hardest thing that you have to deal with?”

First Lady Melania Trump: “I would say the opportunists who are using my name or my family name to advance themselves—from comedians, to journalists, to performers, book writers.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Mr. Trump and the White House knew that Michael Cohen would be testifying falsely to Congress and did not tell him not to,” Cohen’s lawyer told Bloomberg News.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Michael Cohen shared false testimony with the White House before he submitted it to Congress —so it’s possible Trump was aware that Cohen would make false statements, Cohen’s lawyer says on @BloombergRadio.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “President told him we need him in Congress so he can continue the great work he is doing there,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says, confirming Mark Meadows won’t be Trump’s chief of staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump exits without commenting about Michael Cohen, despite our shouted questions.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump about to sign an executive order meant to spur development in economically stressed areas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Wilbur Ross noted Trump lifted a crippling ban on U.S. business dealings by Chinese telecom maker ZTE after a personal appeal from Xi Jinping, but said that doesn’t mean Trump would intervene again.

Last time it was “personal favor” to Xi, Ross told us.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump hasn’t decided if he will intervene in U.S. efforts to extradite Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou, Wilbur Ross tells us outside the White House. 

“Let’s see what he actually decides.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: In a heads up to @realdonaldtrump and Congress committees, Cohen lawyer Lanny Davis says after Mueller probe is final, Cohen will "state publicly all he knows about Mr. Trump." 

"Mr. Trump’s repeated lies cannot contradict stubborn facts."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
COHEN SENTENCED TO THREE YEARS IN PRISON. 

Also hit with forfeiture of $500,000, restitution of $1.4 million and a fine of $50,000.

As judge read sentence, Cohen closed his eyes and shook his head slightly as if in disbelief, Bloomberg News reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The judge says Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to a "veritable smorgasbord of fraudulent conduct" motivated by "personal greed and ambition." 

MORE:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
COHEN, audibly emotional, says to people of US: "You deserve to know the truth and lying to you was unjust.”

Trump "publicly mocks me, calling me a rat and a liar.''

Cohen says wants to ensure that when history of Trump is written Cohen not recorded as "villain of his story."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: MICHAEL COHEN in court: "I take full responsibility for each act."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "After cheating the IRS for years, lying to banks and to Congress, and seeking to criminally influence the presidential election, Cohen’s decision to plead guilty--rather than seek a pardon for his manifold crimes--does not make him a hero," NY prosecutors said in court papers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Cohen has said publicly his wife Laura, son Jake and daughter Samantha "have my first loyalty and always will.” 

Just one minor example of that: in meetings at Trump Tower over the years if one of them rung his cellphone, he'd interrupt to take their call.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has framed Michael Cohen as a liar, weak and "not very bright."

His lawyer says: “Mr. Cohen’s cooperation promotes respect for law and the courage of the individual to stand up to power and influence." 

Cohen in court with his family, including daughter Samantha.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Michael Cohen's lawyers at his sentencing are urging the judge to consider Cohen's "life of good works."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump's friend Sean Hannity interviewing First Lady Melania Trump for his 9p show tonight. 

And Trump is doing an interview with Fox News's Harris Faulkner that will air at 1p Thursday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump signs EO today on opportunity zones meant to spur investment in low-income areas. 

But some of these areas aren’t exactly struggling, as Bloomberg News' @CalebMelby and @davidkski reported last week. 

For example: a Kushner Cos beachfront strip.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The first lady is at Joint Base Langley-Eustis in Virginia this morning for a merry Christmas visit. @FLOTUS
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Report says China plans to give foreign companies greater access to its economy, in response to Trump's tariffs pressure.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump got a briefing on the shooting at the Christmas market in France this a.m., White House spokesman Hogan Gidley told reporters in a gaggle outside the WH. But Gidley declined to say whether it's a confirmed act of terrorism or not. Referred us back to Trump's comments.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump cites Mark Meadows and Dave Bossie when asked in Reuters interview about his chief of staff search.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Justice Department is set to indict a number of alleged hackers it believes work for Chinese intelligence.

Part of Trump admin plan to take several actions aimed at calling out China.

Story with @cstrohm
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Lindsey Graham on Trump chief of staff: "I like Chris Christie, I like Meadows, those are the 2 names that really jump out at me. I think the next person needs to have some political acumen there."

Meadows understands House, Christie battle-tested, he said, per @StevenTDennis.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In Oval just now for bill signing, Mark Meadows, a chief of staff candidate. 

Also John Kelly, John Bolton, Jim Carroll, Dan Scavino, Mercedes Schlapp.

And Callista Gingrich, Sam Brownback, Tony Perkins, Anna Eshoo, Mike McCaul and others.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: ====> “Believe it or not, I think it was a very friendly meeting,” Trump just told us in his second Oval Office comment la of the day, referring to Pelosi and Schumer meeting.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “In another 30 days there won’t be any of them left," Trump said of ISIS as he signed the “Iraq and Syria Genocide Relief and Accountability Act of 2018.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I don't mind. I could've debated Chuck Schumer for a longer time. Because he was saying, 'It's yours, it's yours.' 

“I don't mind. I don't know, what do you guys think?" Trump said, turning to the lawmakers in the room, including House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: “Chuck's problem is that when we last closed down that was his idea. And honestly he got killed. He doesn't want to own it. So I said rather than us debating who's owning, I'll take it." 
"We're closing it down for border security and I think I win that every single time."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
SARAH SANDERS: Trump had "a constructive dialogue" Schumer and Pelosi.

They "agreed to support the passage of historic Criminal Justice Reform, and discussed significant progress with the Farm Bill. 

"Major disagreement remains on the issue of border security and transparency."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q Did you expect the reality TV atmosphere in Trump's Oval Office?

“No, I did not," Schumer just told reporters at the US Capitol, per @elwasson.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I asked him to pray over it,” Pelosi tells us outside White House after meeting with Trump about preventing a shutdown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Schumer and Pelosi, speaking to reporters outside White House after their Oval Office meeting, made it clear this would be Trump's shutdown. 

But Schumer added: If Trump sticks to his $5 billion demand "he WILL GET a shutdown."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Happy Christmas if I don’t see you,” Chief of Staff John Kelly told reporters as they left the Oval Office, per @justinsink.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: SCHUMER: “This temper tantrum that he seems to throw will not get him his wall.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says a lot of "friends of mine" want the chief of staff job.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Schumer: "It doesn't solve the problem." 
Trump: "It totally solves the problem." 
Schumer: "Let's debate in private." 
Pence: (silence.) 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-12-11/trump-says-i-will-be-the-one-to-shut-down-government-over-wall …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, on his chief of staff search, says “we’re in no rush” but in a week or two or maybe less will make an announcement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
WILD OVAL SCENE
PELOSI: He doesn’t have the votes in House for wall. 
TRUMP: "Nancy, I do.” Adds we need border security.
PELOSI: Of course we do. 
SCHUMER: WaPo gave you Pinocchios about how much of wall's built. You want to shut govt down. 
TRUMP: If don’t get what we want yes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: PELOSI: “I don’t think you should have a debate in front of the press."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, in Oval with Pelosi and Schumer, says they may not have an agreement today on southern border wall funding. "We probably won’t”

Pelosi: "The American people recognize we must keep government open.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump in Oval Office says criminal justice bill “looks like it’s going to be passing hopefully--famous last words.”

"I think it’s going to get a very good vote."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump calls the White House pool reporters into the Oval Office for unscheduled comments as he meets with Dem leaders. Chief of Staff John Kelly is in room.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: White House is already declaring victory. Trump believes criminal justice overhaul bill will pass Senate and he intends to sign it, I'm told. 

Under pressure from Trump, McConnell announced floor vote. Jared Kushner is notifying supporters whip counts shows enough votes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: John Kelly will "stay on through Jan. 2 at least," Kellyanne Conway said on Fox News this morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Who ever it is I will support him," @KellyannePolls, at gaggle. 

I asked if women are on list for chief. She signals Trump's chance to outdo Obama.

"Always women on every Trump list. I know that President Obama didn't have a female press secretary or a female chief of staff."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kellyanne Conway, very much in front of cameras as Trump mulls next chief of staff: "Somebody who will have the trust and confidence of the president, who understands the principal, who also can interface with the Cabinet and can manage a very large and ever-changing staff here."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if she's interested in being chief of staff, @KellyannePolls in a WH gaggle answered: "Are we moving on to trade and tariffs?" She said it looks like China is moving toward reducing its auto tariff from 40% to 15% and autos stocks rose a little bit "so that's great news."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Scoop by Bloomberg News: China is likely going to cut its trade-war tariffs on imported U.S.-made cars.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and Putin were finalists for Time person of year, but magazine instead chose journalists as collective winner, including Khashoggi, a Philippine reporter targeted by Duterte, staff of Maryland newspaper targeted by a shooter, Reuters reporters imprisoned in Myanmar.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ex-Trump campaign aide Dave Bossie has lunch w Trump Friday, but says on Fox he doesn’t foresee being offered chief of staff job at that time. 

Bossie, an investigator for a House oversight committee in 90s, says Trump needs chief who can handle "subpoena cannon"  from House Ds.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: S&P 500 E-Mini futures are reducing losses and China stocks are turning positive as investors react to a report that China's vice premier held a phone call with Mnuchin and Lighthizer, @business reports. They exchanged views on timetable and road map for trade talks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
—Mnuchin in Oval told Trump he’d like to stay at Treasury.
—Lighthizer had mtg with Ayers. 
—Meadows interested. Allies suggest he and Bossie go in as a team, chief/deputy. But Meadows hasn’t spoken to Trump since before Ayers plan fell apart.
—Mulvaney *truly* not interested.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: As criticism of Trump’s UN ambassador pick Heather Nauert mounts as she goes under confirmation microscope, one influential voice on Israel is vouching for her: @USAmbIsrael David Friedman. 

Meanwhile, some have doubts, including @marcorubio.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Meadows’ office confirms the congressman says serving as Trump’s chief would be “an incredible honor.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump delivered the news to John Kelly on Friday prior to senior staff dinner.

Trump met with Kelly alone first; then Pence and Nick Ayers joined.

So Ayers was part of team that broke it to Kelly.

And Trump let Kelly go on **Dec. 7. (Then told press on Dec. 8 on south lawn.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s not actively considering Mnuchin as chief of staff, I’m told. Staying at Treasury.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump admin is considering tapping VP Pence’s chief economist to run Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac’s regulator, a position that has major implications for the $10 trillion U.S. mortgage market.

⁦@EDexheimer⁩ ⁦@justinsink⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ayers built a reputation in White House for being quite the operator — which some aides admired and some found irritating.

He’s come along to Pence’s lunches with POTUS since he came on board.

Ayers is known for agreeing with Trump’s more controversial rhetoric, ginning him up.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “These companies sell, use or analyze the data to cater to advertisers, retail outlets and even hedge funds seeking insights into consumer behavior.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
New: Chief of Staff John Kelly is at WH this a.m., doing the job.

The US Marine general has experienced plenty of exasperation in recent months. 

Kelly, asked by Trump in summer to stay on til 2020 but told this past weekend time to go, greeted staff with a smile, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Some people Trump’s considering for chief of staff would come at a cost. Lighthizer leading trade negotiations w China. Mulvaney trying to prevent budget fights. Whitaker oversees Mueller probe.

Trump wants a chief with political acumen. Christie fits...
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump in October said his proposed defense budget for 2020 would be $700 billion—a 5% cut.

Last week he called $716 billion in defense spending "crazy.”

But after mtg with Mattis and Armed Services chairs, Trump’s now ok with $750 billion. 

@ACapaccio 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-12-09/trump-is-said-to-signal-750-billion-national-security-request …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Theresa May is calling off a crucial vote in Parliament on whether to approve her Brexit deal — there isn’t sufficient support for it to pass, @TimRoss_1 reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Only event on Trump’s public sched tomorrow is lunch with VP.

The unnamed guest for these lunches over the months? Pence’s chief of staff, Nick Ayers. 

Accompanying Pence to Oval and to lunches is how Ayers got face time with Trump and jumped onto the president’s radar.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Two other possible chief of staff options being mentioned by advisers close to Trump are ex New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie and David Bossie, Trump’s 2016 deputy campaign manager.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Was never finalized, but it was Ayers’s job if he wanted to take it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Among those Trump is weighing for chief of staff, or has at least mentioned as a possibility, are acting AG Matt Whitaker, U.S. trade rep Bob Lighthizer, budget director Mick Mulvaney and Rep. Mark Meadows, I’m told. 

Treasury Sec Mnuchin not being considered at moment.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ayers plans to follow through on his plan to move his family to Georgia, and will help oversee politics for Trump’s re-election bid from there.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Nick Ayers is NOT going to be Trump's next chief of staff -- not even on an interim basis.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Since it's winter, a little sprinkling of evergreen,” @RosKrasny says, circulating the “3 chief of staffs” tweet people have been pointing out since the news broke that Trump is replacing Chief of Staff John Kelly.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump didn’t really react to any plays of the game that we could see.

Maybe trying not to show favoritism? 
#ArmyNavy
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and Nick Ayers have been in discussions for months about the 36-year-old taking over as WH chief of staff. Trump wants a two-year commitment but Ayers has not agreed to that — 3 kids under age of 6 at home and a long-planned move back to Georgia.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Good game,” Trump tells me.

#armynavygame
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump was looking forward to this Army-Navy game, and the audience has showered him with the cheers and applause he loves. 

He was scheduled to interact with some Gold Star families, I’m told. 

#ArmyNavyGame
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
WITH TRUMP at Army-Navy game:
Pompeo, Mattis, Zinke.

Also Gen. Joseph Dunford of Joint Chiefs of Staff and Gen. Mark Milley, who will replace Dunford.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
WH aides say they think Nick Ayers likely to be acting chief.

Trump’s been talking with Ayers for weeks about it, since midterm elections. 

But Ayers offered to serve for 3 or 4 months in transitional role and Trump wants a longer commitment, sources tell me and @margarettalev.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and AF1 flew by — but not over — the football stadium where Army-Navy fans are gathered in Philly.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After announcing John Kelly’s departure, Trump’s on way to Army-Navy with aides Jordan Karem, Derek Lyons, Dan Scavino and Hogan Gidley on board AF1 with him.

Mike Pompeo will be at football game with him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he will be announcing a replacement for chief of staff but didn’t give any names.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says Kelly, answering a question from a reporter on south lawn at departure, will be leaving his position as chief of staff toward the end of the year, per @ToluseO.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: John Kelly will leave at the end of the year, Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump plans to do part of the Army-Navy game in the box of West Point grad David Urban, one of his 2016 campaign aides. 

He will switch sides at halftime, as is tradition for the commander in chief.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s leaving WH soon for Philadelphia for his 1st Army-Navy game as POTUS.

(He was president-elect for last one, in Baltimore in 2016, when he was accompanied by Mike Flynn, Bannon, Priebus, Keith Schiller.)

Sec of State Pompeo will hang out w/ him at today game, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mueller says Michael Cohen spoke with a Russian national in 2015 who repeatedly proposed a meeting between Trump and Putin early in Trump’s presidential bid, and offered “political synergy” for the campaign.

Cohen never followed up on the invitation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Despite Trump’s interest in moving on, key figures in inner circle don’t wish to see Kelly go.

And replacement candidates have said don’t want role in forcing him out. 

Trump, not known for patience, 
seems to be sticking w/ advice to let Kelly exit gracefully, at his choosing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As I’ve asked WH Hanukkah or Cmas partygoers for details on what happened, most frequent answer has been about seeing Melania’s lampooned red trees. 

“I said, ‘That’s so Dolce,’” said Devorah Halberstam @VictimOfTerror. She wore @dolcegabbana to the party as a salute.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
New: John Kelly during senior staff dinner did not make an announcement about his plans for staying on or leaving post as chief of staff, despite storm of news coverage and whispering in West Wing. 

Trump made gracious comments about Kelly in remarks to gathered aides, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Chief of Staff John Kelly did come to the senior staff dinner at the White House tonight, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mueller says Michael Cohen doesn’t merit special leniency in his sentencing — recommends a term of 42 months and a $100,000 fine, @gregfarrel reports. 

Mueller calls Cohen’s lies to Congress and the people “serious” while saying he has provided credible info for Russia probe.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
No announcement yet to aides back at the White House today about any staff changes.

The fact that John Kelly hasn’t been seen there at all today is stirring speculation within. 

Chief of staff’s office is totally closed, I’m told. 

Trump’s wheels up from KC to DC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Tillerson!
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Heather Nauert will NOT be in the cabinet, I’m told. New UN ambassador post being downgraded to non-cabinet-level.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
John Kelly took part in at least four Oval Office meetings with Trump yesterday—intel briefing, and mtgs on trade, legal matters and legislation—and Kelly was fully engaged, I’m told. 

But it’s true there is little chemistry remaining between the two men.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has made it known for a while now that he will not force Chief Kelly out but is prepared to let him leave in his own time.

Nick Ayers, 36, is considered more politically attuned than Kelly, 68—and Trump is girding for Dem-led House, and bruising 2020 re-election campaign.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Several White House advisers say they believe that chief of staff John Kelly could depart at any moment and that Trump is likely to replace him with the vice president’s top aide, Nick Ayers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Acting AG Matt Whitaker @MattWhitaker46 and Jared Kushner accompanying Trump to Kansas City for DOJ conference.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump confirms he will nominate Heather Nauert for UN ambassador.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Breaking: TRUMP names William Barr as his new AG.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Not unusual. Senior staff meetings regularly cancelled when Trump and senior staff have a travel day.

AF1 flying to Missouri this morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As @maggieNYT reported in October.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump could announce his UN pick as soon as Friday, I’m told.

Unclear if this UN ambassador job will remain a cabinet-level post, or if Trump’s cabinet, already short on women, will lose another female member with Nikki Haley’s departure.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, after considering John James, Ric Grenell, Kelly Craft and others for UN ambassador, decided Heather Nauert best. 

Aides say her key assets include strong communications skills, fluency in understanding Trump WH, the trust of the president and secretary of state.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Scoop: Trump has decided to pick Heather Nauert, the State Dept spokeswoman, as the next U.S. ambassador to the UN, sources tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Elliott Abrams, a foreign policy adviser in Reagan admin, chats with Jason Greenblatt @jdgreenblatt45,
Trump's chief envoy for Middle East peace process.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says “it’s a solemn duty to confront antisemitism anywhere it occurs.”

Calls the eight Holocaust survivors here up to the front.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos speaks with Rabbi David Katz of the Rabbinical Alliance of America @igudof at the WH Hanukkah party.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Dolly Rabinowitz, 91, and her sisters were liberated from Auschwitz concentration camp. Rabinowitz now takes care of her 101-year-old sister, per her friends here at the White House Hanukkah celebration.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Several Holocaust survivors here at White House Hanukkah celebration, including David Einhorn, 92, who was sent to Auschwitz at age 
15. 

Einhorn (seated) lost his parents and seven siblings.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: White House says Trump didn’t know about the extradition request for the Huawei CFO before Trump’s dinner with Xi.

Both the Xi dinner and Meng’s arrest happened on Dec. 1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump confidant Lindsey Graham on William Barr: “He’d be an outstanding choice. ... I think he could get confirmed very easily.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Some Rs praising idea of William Barr as AG: 

John Cornyn, No. 2 GOP leader: "I know Mr. Barr, and I think he might be a very good choice." 
Roy Blunt: "I thought he did job as attorney general the last time...should be well prepared." 

per @LauraLitvan
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-12-06/william-barr-said-to-be-trump-s-top-choice-for-attorney-general …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Saudi Arabia is saying Trump and Crown Prince MBS met at G20, but White House says Trump merely exchanged pleasantries at a leaders’ session, as he did with nearly every leader there.

“We might but we had none,” Trump told reporters of an MBS meeting, per @jeneps.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
”It’s hard for him to think straight from the bottom of the bottle.”

That’s Zinke’s response to Grijalva, the Dem who will likely chair committee that oversees Interior Dept, after Grijalva called for the cabinet secretary to resign. 

Tune Inn is a Capitol Hill watering hole.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Manafort, who Mueller says breached a plea agreement through unspecified crimes and lies, is tentatively set to be sentenced on March 5 on two conspiracy charges, per @davidvoreacos and @AndyNewsNowInDC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: France’s Macron sought out Saudi crown prince MBS at the G20 summit to talk to him about the murder of columnist Jamal Khashoggi and the crisis in Yemen, per @HeleneFouquet.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The latest on Trump “fuming” and “screaming.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Merkel was speaking with reporters about the latest tensions between Russia and the Ukraine when the door opened and a crew member asked her to come out.

“Why now?” Merkel asked.

“It’s urgent,” the crew member said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump still hasn’t removed US tariffs on Canadian and Mexican steel and aluminum imports—despite frustration, especially from Trudeau.

Negotiations with Canada on the tariffs will continue next week, Trade Rep Lighthizer told gaggle of reporters in Buenos Aires, per @nwadhams.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said Mexico’s Pena Nieto and Canada’s Justin Trudeau each became “a great friend.”

Been a battle, but battle makes great friendship, he said just before the 3 leaders signed new Nafta trade deal. 

Trump: “We've taken a lot of barbs, and a little abuse, and we got there.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
With Trump in front row, Jared Kushner says his talks with the Mexicans brought “a lot of progress” on drugs, immigration.

“If you just read the press” you wouldn’t expect the results that have been achievable, he said, per @jeneps.

Thanked Ivanka — “Obviously I love you.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s calling the new NAFTA agreement USMCA for United States Mexico Canada Agreement.

Canada is not calling it that.

They’re calling it CUSMA, putting Canada first in the lineup, @josh_wingrove reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
News reports about Trump’s Russia ties have hounded him on all his foreign trips as president. 

This a.m., Michael Cohen confirmed Trump pursued business deal there even after becoming presumptive GOP nominee in 2016. 

Minutes later, Trump canceled mtg this weekend with Putin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: China hawk Peter Navarro, budget director Mick Mulvaney, economic adviser Larry Kudlow, trade rep Bob Lighthizer, and sec of State Mike Pompeo also in Buenos Aires with Trump for G20 summit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Reporters on Air Force One don't have access to wifi like the White House staff, so if news breaks during a flight, the wire services -- Bloomberg News, the Associated Press and Reuters -- use an AF1 phone to make a "wire call" to their news desks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders said she wasn't aware of any Trump-Putin phone call recently, but the two governments have been in communication. 

Trump's meetings with South Korea’s Moon Jae-In and Turkey’s Recep Tayyip Erdogan will be pull-asides at the G20 summit, she said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEWS: Sarah Huckabee Sanders told reporters on AF1 that Trump decided to cancel a planned meeting with Putin after reviewing a report that detailed Russia’s recent actions in Crimea related to Ukraine, per @SalehaMohsin, who is on this 10-hour flight to Buenos Aires.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump cancels his meeting with Putin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Giuliani: "Hardly coincidental that the Special Counsel once again files a charge just as the President is leaving for a meeting with world leaders at the G20 Summit in Argentina. Special Counsel did the very same thing as the President was leaving for a world summit in Helsinki"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW - Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani in statement: "It's no surprise that Cohen lied to Congress. He's a proven liar who is doing everything he can to get out of a long-term prison sentence for serious crimes of bank and tax fraud that had nothing to do with the Trump Organization."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Among those going to Argentina with Trump: Melania, Ivanka, Jared Kushner, John Kelly.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q: PARDON FOR PAUL MANAFORT? 

Trump told us it was "very sad what’s happened to Paul." 

He explained he told New York Post no, he has not offered Manafort a pardon, but said he's not taking anything off the table. 

Manafort treated very badly, Trump said on south lawn.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: On a government shutdown, Trump said: "If we don't get the wall money, a very possible shutdown."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q: IS COHEN'S TESTIMONY A THREAT TO YOU? 

"I'm not at all worried about him," Trump told us.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q: IF COHEN WAS SUCH A BUM WHY DID YOU HIRE HIM?

"Because a long time ago he did me a favor," Trump told us.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "It just wasn't set up," Trump said when asked about meeting at G20 with Saudi Arabia's crown prince MBS, who the CIA says likely directed the Khashoggi murder. "I would've met with him. We just didn't have time."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I probably will be meeting with President Putin," Trump told us. "I think it's a very good time to have the meeting." 

But he will be getting "a full report" on the Russia-Ukraine situation on AF1 on his way to Argentina, and that will determine whether he meets with Putin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP before leaving White House for Argentina: 

"We're very close to doing something with China but I don't know if I want to do it. ... I think China wants to make a deal ... I like the deal we have right now."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"When I run for president, that doesn't mean I'm not allowed to do business," Trump told us on south lawn. "I often joked about the fact I was the only person who campaigned and simultaneously ran a business." 

He says he wasn't focused on the Moscow deal, just winning WH.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP tells us that Michael Cohen is "a weak person and what he's trying to do is get a reduced sentence -- so he's lying about a project that everybody knew about." 

Trump says he was open about the Moscow tower project, never hid it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s now 20 minutes late for his departure. Special prosecutor just released the Cohen plea agreement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I knew at the time in that I asserted that all efforts had ceased in January 2016, when in fact they continued until June 2016," Cohen said today, referring to Trump Tower in Moscow. 

In fact had “more extensive communications."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The new plea concerns Michael Cohen’s statements to Congress about Trump’s business dealings in Moscow before Trump ran for president, @ChrisDolmetsch reports. 
Cohen has been cooperating with federal prosecutors, including Mueller, as well as state investigators in New York.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Michael Cohen has reached a plea deal with Mueller for lying to the Senate Intelligence Committee in August 2017, Bloomberg News reports.

Cohen is entering the new guilty plea in a New York courtroom today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Despite Trump's congratulatory tweet on BMW, the car company has not yet committed to building a new plant in the U.S. 

CEO Harald Krueger said Tuesday that a second site in the U.S. is just a maybe. No firm plan, @ElisBehrmann reports. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-29/president-trump-jumps-gun-on-bmw-s-idea-for-a-new-plant-in-u-s …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump was boarding Air Force One in August, too, when the news broke that Michael Cohen was pleading guilty. Today, the news hit as Trump's preparing to leave the White House for Argentina for the G20 summit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Michael Cohen, Trump's former long-time lawyer and one of Trump's closest allies for years, is admitting he made false statements to Congress.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Democrats with an eye on the Oval Office use Mueller probe to raise money, including Kamala Harris, Elizabeth Warren, Corey Booker, Tom Steyer, @JoshuaGreen reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The cost of the “witch hunt” — Mueller investigation — has apparently jumped $10 million since yesterday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

Trump raises the prospect of a 25% tariff on imported cars to boost domestic auto assembly.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
I think the limited-press arrangement was Apple’s requirement, not White House’s? @tim_cook 

But it meant that the only footage obtained by reporters stuck outside was of a quick glimpse of Ivanka—and plenty of images of protesters nearby.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump feels no urgency to nominate new AG and is content with Matt Whitaker as acting head of DOJ, several sources told me and @spettypi.

He isn’t concerned about demands from @ChuckGrassley, @LindseyGrahamSC to move fast to replace Sessions.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Saudi crown prince MBS has faced a global backlash since Khashoggi's murder.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In WaPo interview, Trump: 
-“I’m not even a little bit happy with my selection" of Jay Powell at Fed. 
-“Maybe I won’t have the meeting" with Putin. 
-“No intention” of stopping Mueller. 
-“At the right time I will" visit war-zone.
@PhilipRucker @jdawsey1
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: John James was at the White House last week talking about a possible administration post with top officials, including Trump, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and Vice President Mike Pence, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Jordan Karem was on campaign trail with Trump the day before the midterm elections this month when he got the news that his father had died, aides told me.

Michael Karem was an advance staffer who worked for 4 GOP presidents—Nixon, Reagan, both Bushes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: John James, the Michigan businessman who ran for U.S. Senate this year, is one of the people that Trump is considering as a replacement for UN Ambassador Nikki Haley. 

@JohnJamesMI lost his challenge against Democratic Sen. Debbie Stabenow.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Karem was chief of staff to an Arizona utility company CEO, Pinnacle West’s Don Brandt, before he joined Trump’s campaign in July 2015.

He plans to stay in DC, I’m told. (Not returning to Arizona.) 

He has told colleagues he doesn’t intend to write a book.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Unsurprisingly, the role of body guy isn’t a typical one in this White House. Trump leaned on Jordan Karem for many tasks, including weighing in on matters on Trump’s mind—policy, staffing, politics, etc—and relaying messages to contacts inside and outside WH.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Jordan Karem gained a reputation for being forthright with Trump, sometimes brutally honest. (One of the few willing to do that.)

He’s 1st aide to see Trump in a.m. and last aide to see him at night—greeted Trump outside his room and walked him from Oval back to the residence.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEWS: Jordan Karem is leaving post as Trump’s body man and director of Oval Office operations. He ascended in the White House ranks from a rank-and-file advance aide to one of Trump’s confidants.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump will chat via teleconference with members of the military tomorrow, on Thanksgiving, White House says. 

George W. Bush paid surprise Thanksgiving visit to troops in Iraq in 2003. His father visited Desert Shield military for Thanksgiving in 1990.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Defense Sec Mattis has advised Trump to stay away from certain overseas locations—for his security and the troops’—even as the president’s criticized for not visiting the troops, @rtiron reports.

The holidays were a preferred time for past presidents to go to combat zones.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has nominated Oracle CEO Safra Catz to the President’s Intelligence Advisory Board, a group that gives advice on the conduct and adequacy of the U.S. intelligence community. 

Also named to board: Saxby Chambliss, James Donovan,
Kevin E. Hulbert, David Robertson, WH says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Quite the fawning fans. That must’ve perked him up.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: “We are with Saudi Arabia."

He says the CIA has looked at the killing of Jamal Khashoggi and studied it a lot but have “nothing definitive."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says his written answers for Mueller "are finished” and the "lawyers have them."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, asked about Ivanka's use of a personal email account as White House official, says Ivanka wasn’t doing anything to hide her emails. They’re all in the presidential record -- she didn't delete anything like Hillary Clinton, he says as he leaves for Thanksgiving in Florida.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, on his statement on Saudi Arabia, says we'll see how that works. 

It's a "complicated situation” and it “is what it is," he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP, leaving for Mar-a-Lago for Thanksgiving, tells press on the south lawn he's going to the Southern White House and will be doing a lot of work while in Florida.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Peas and carrots, peas and carrots” is what actors say (or mouth) when they need to imitate human speech — but without saying anything meaningful.

The White House named this year’s two Thanksgiving turkey finalists Peas and Carrots.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP statement on Khashoggi: "Our intelligence agencies continue to assess all information, but it could very well be that the Crown Prince had knowledge of this tragic event – maybe he did and maybe he didn’t!"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Unclear if this is Peas or Carrots.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “My personal view, our administration's view, is the recession is so far in the distance you can’t see it,” Trump’s economic adviser Larry Kudlow told reporters at the White House today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Some of my best friends are Democrats,” Trump economic adviser Larry Kudlow told us.

Asked about tax cuts passing during lame duck: “None of this stuff, I don't think, will happen in the lame duck. I don't see it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump can be delicate sometimes in his public criticism, especially when it comes to his own aides—in this case, a four-star general who some key members of his inner circle like and respect very much and want to see stay on as chief of staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s not so subtle on 2 aides’ futures: 

JOHN KELLY: “John, at some point, is going to want to move on. John will move on.”
KIRSTJEN NIELSEN: “That’s what happens in government—you leave. You make a name, you go. The people that have left have done very well.”

@FoxNewsSunday
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump on “Fox News Sunday” confirms he’ll find new post for the embattled Mira Ricardel. 

“I met with Mira 2 days ago....we’re going to move her around because she’s got certain talents. But, frankly, she is not—she’ll never be put in the United Nations, let me put it that way.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We’re in solidarity, sir.” — Fox News’s Chris Wallace on journalists standing together as Trump says some reporters are the “enemy of the people” and others aren’t.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he had “a very beautiful moment” just now with 2 families of people killed on Nov. 7 at Borderline Bar and Grill in Thousand Oaks. 

“It’s been a tough day—you look at all the death,” he said. 

But says he thought this trip was something had to do, “glad we did it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q CIA ASSESS MBS BEHIND Khashoggi’s killing? 

TRUMP in Malibu: “They haven’t assessed anything yet. It’s too early. That was a very premature report.”

“We’ll be having a very full report over next two days, probably Monday or Tuesday,” he said, “and it will be very complete.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“There’s no politics being played here,” California Gov.-elect Gavin Newsom says, and shakes Trump’s hand.

Newsom says he’s “grateful” Trump and the federal govt will “be here” to help Malibu and Ventura County and rest of California hurt by wildfires.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: A front door to no where in a cliffside  neighborhood near the ocean, in Malibu.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is on the Pacific Coast Highway, viewing damage in Malibu from the Woolsey fire.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Wildfire can go “a football field a second. So if you’re sitting in your home and you hear, well, it’s fairly close by, maybe I’ll watch the end of this program. ... The end of CNN.”

(Grinned at TV pooler, from CNN.)

“5 minutes and that’s the difference between life and death.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: “Yes,” Gov. Jerry Brown said on AF1 when asked if he thinks climate change played a role in wildfires.

Trump: “We’re maybe not as different, maybe not as different as people think. Things are happening. Things are changing.
 
“Most importantly we’re doing things about it.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Right now we want to take care of the people that are so badly hurt,” Trump said as he stood near the scorched ruins of homes in Paradise, the California town that was almost entirely incinerated in the wildfires.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Did they get caught? ... Some of them got out of their cars and a lot of them just ran?” Trump said when an official at a wildfire emergency command center in Chico told him some fleeing Paradise got out of cars.

“I don’t know what was going through their mind,” official said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Gavin is going to—we’re going to be looking at it together,” Trump on wildfire prevention. 

“We’re putting about $500 million in the farm bill for management and maintenance of the forests.

“We just put it in. Farm bill’s moving along pretty rapidly. We’ve got great farmers.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “No, no,” Trump said in Chico when asked if wildfires’ devastation changed his opinion on climate change. “I have a strong opinion. I want great climate. We’re going to have that. And we’re going to have forests that are very safe. Because we can’t go through this every year.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We’ve got to take care of the floors. The floors of the forest,” Trump said in Paradise, CA. 

Other countries do it differently—president of Finland said they spend a lot of time “on raking and cleaning. They don’t have any problem and when it is, it’s a very small problem.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We do have to do management, maintenance. We’ll be working also with environmental groups,” Trump said in Paradise when asked how to prevent wildfires. 

“I think everybody’s seen the light. 

“And I don’t think we’ll have this again to this extent.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is in Paradise, CA, walking a neighborhood incinerated by wildfires. Trees with alligator skin from burn marks. Only a few metal items recognizable in rubble - crumpled Dish TV satellites and washers, steel beams. 

He’s listening to Mayor Judy Jones and FEMA’s Brock Long.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: STATE DEPARTMENT: “Recent reports indicating that the U.S. government has made a final conclusion are inaccurate. There remain numerous unanswered questions with respect to the murder of Mr. Khashoggi.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump campaign today announced two MAGA rallies in Mississippi on Nov. 26, ahead of the US Senate runoff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s helicopter traveled through thick smoke to get to Chico, California where he will visit an operations center and motorcade to nearby areas to tour devastation from the Camp fire. 

Air is heavy with smell of the blaze.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
MNUCHIN will join Trump for part of his tour California wildfires devastation, Sarah Huckabee Sanders told us on AF1 on the way to Beale Air Force Base. 

Chief Kelly, Doug Fears, Jared Kushner and Bill McGinley on trip from DC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump spoke with both Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and CIA chief Gina Haspel via phone as he traveled to California to meet with people affected by the deadly wildfires. 

State Department will do a statement shortly, Sarah Huckabee Sanders told reporters on AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s wheels up for California with Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Dan Scavino, and other staff on board.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said he will hand in Mueller questions next week, and has not decided whether to sit down for a Mueller interview for the Russia probe.

per @TammyThueringer
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As he leaves White House for California, Trump tells reporters the House Democrats who oppose Nancy Pelosi as speaker are wasting their time. 

He will give Pelosi the votes she needs—whatever number she needs, he says.

per @TammyThueringer
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, as he’s leaving White House, says he’s close on picking a UN ambassador, and says his acting AG, Matt Whitaker, is doing a great job. 

He said he could go through the entire cabinet, but we can probably figure out which ones he’s unhappy with. 

per @TammyThueringer
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he’ll be talking with the CIA and Sec of State Pompeo while he’s on plane to California today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, leaving White House, says Pence is loyal and the NYT made up the story. He says the NYT didn’t call him for a quote, and if they’d called he would have told them it wasn’t true. 

per @TammyThueringer
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, as he leaves White House, says he’s going to two places in California to survey damage from the wildfires, which have killed 71 people.

Another 1,011 people are unaccounted for, local officials say.

AF1 arrives at Beale Air Force Base, at 12:45p eastern, 9:45a pacific.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I never talk about my conversations with the president. Let’s just leave it that we had a good laugh and, you know, the president said to me, ‘There are no anonymous sources that would say what that article said,’” Pence told reporters traveling with him in Asia, per @ToluseO.
author: JenniferJJacobs

"We are going to follow the facts,” Pence said, per @ToluseO.

Serious political instability in Estonia, per @ottummelas.

Trump pressured Pfizer, the country’s biggest drugmaker, not to raise its prices, but it is doing just that on about 10 percent of its pharmaceutical products next year.

text:
Trump says CNN’s Jim Acosta treated rest of reporters at Trump’s news conference “very unfairly.”

“Because you had somebody interrupting you,” he said (at bill signing in Oval today). “You can't take three questions and four questions. You can't stand up and not sit down."

@spettypi

text:

It’s unclear if the White House plans to offer her any other position.

Ricardel clashed with East Wing aides to 1st lady Melania Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
SCOOP: After 1st lady Melania Trump forced the deputy national security adviser out of the White House, the Trump admin offered Mira Ricardel a different job:

The ambassador to Estonia.

She turned it down, I’m told. 

Story out soon.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Trump may visit Paradise, the California town ravaged by the wildfires, two sources tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Saudi officials we are sanctioning were involved in the abhorrent killing of Jamal Khashoggi,” Treasury's Steven Mnuchin. “These individuals who targeted and brutally killed a journalist who resided and worked in the United States must face consequences."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: At the Marine Barracks in Washington, Trump and the first lady appeared to be saying thank you to each Marine whose hands they shook. President made no remarks while the reporters were in the room, per @asebenius.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: The U.S. Treasury Department just sanctioned 17 Saudi Arabian officials amid controversy over the kingdom’s role in the killing of columnist Jamal Khashoggi, @SalehaMohsin reports.

text:
“Prosecutor would like to note that it has submitted formal requests to brotherly authorities in Turkey ... to provide evidence and information, including any audio recordings in the possession of the Turkish authorities related to the (Khashoggi) case.”
https://www.spa.gov.sa/viewfullstory.php?lang=en&newsid=1841684#1841684 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Plan was to bring Khashoggi back to Saudi Arabia, but it went wrong — although Crown Prince MBS, who runs country’s day-to-day affairs, had no knowledge of mission, Saudi prosecutor says. 

Saudi narrative still contradicts Turkey's claim it was premeditated, @alaashahine notes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
11 people are charged over Khashoggi’s murder at the Saudi consulate in Istanbul on Oct. 2,  Saudi Arabia’s deputy AG said in a televised news conference.

A Saudi royal adviser and a senior intelligence official played key role, @viviannereim reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Unlike earlier claims from Saudi Arabia that Jamal Khashoggi died in a fist fight in an abduction gone awry, Saudi Arabia public prosecutor now says the journalist was drugged with a sedative and dismembered — as @martinchulov reported last month.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: VP Pence and Putin had a 15-20 minute chat in between other meetings at ASEAN in Singapore.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “There is no comparison whatsoever between a disagreement over decorum at the White House and the imprisonment of reporters in Myanmar,” Pence told @ToluseO when asked about VP’s concerns about freedom of the press in Myanmar in light of White House’s own behavior with reporters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
One interesting fact: FLOTUS and Mira Ricardel never met each other. 

(The spat was between Ricardel and East Wing staff.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mira Ricardel out as deputy national security adviser. 

She will depart “the White House to transition to a new role within the Administration. The President is grateful for Ms. Ricardel’s continued service to the American people...” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: It's now on the White House schedule for 4:30p today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“It’s good to be home,” acting AG Matt Whitaker, a conservative ex-University of Iowa football star, says during a speech in Iowa — a refuge from the uproar in Washington over his appointment.

@McCormickJohn
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mira Ricardel is still working at White House. She hasn’t been fired, aides told @justinsink.

One person tells me her car is still here at WH.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
First lady’s office sets up showdown over national security deputy Mira Ricardel, who is ... less than popular in Trump admin.

Trump’s nat sec agenda could benefit from some clean procedures, but Ricardel takes process rules way too far, aides told me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mira Ricardel got into a spat recently with the East Wing, I’m told. 

Ricardel was upset the first lady’s team didn’t have room for her on the plane for Africa trip, and tried to block NSC resources for the trip.

Chief John Kelly intervened on 1st lady’s behalf.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: 1st lady’s spokeswoman on Deputy National Security adviser Mira Ricardel: “It is the position of the Office of the First Lady that she no longer deserves the honor of serving in this White House.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Meanwhile...
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, three days after the left, across Europe and US, ridiculed him for missing one of his two cemetery visits in France, responds:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "White House cannot run an orderly and fair press conference when a reporter acts this way, which is neither appropriate nor professional. The 1st Amendment is not served when a single reporter, of more than 150 present, attempts to monopolize the floor." -Sarah Huckabee Sanders
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Just more grandstanding from CNN, and we will vigorously defend against this lawsuit," @PressSec says. "CNN, who has nearly 50 additional hard pass holders, and Mr. Acosta is no more or less special than any other media outlet or reporter with respect to the 1st Amendment."
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about news report Trump may want to swap him out for Linda McMahon or another Commerce secretary, Wilbur Ross tells @YahooFinance:

"I'll serve as long as the president wants and I have no indication to the contrary."

Ross says he spoke to Trump yesterday — about trade.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump’s scheduled to meet with senior members of his trade team today to discuss how to proceed on potential autos tariffs.

Likely aimed at Europe, Japan, South Korea.

(Both Canada and Mexico have negotiated side letters in the new NAFTA to exempt them from tariffs.)

Iowa’s first openly gay legislator, state Senator Matt McCoy, writes about FBI’s extortion investigation against him in 2006.

@mccoyforiowa.

Swift not-guilty verdict.

Trump told some WWII veterans sitting under a tent as it rains at Suresnes: "You look so comfortable up there under shelter as we’re getting drenched. You’re very smart people."

per @nwadhams at the scene

text: House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy started his comments on Fox News by recognizing the California firefighters and saying he wants to reassure them they’ll get the resources they need.

text:

Macron used 100th anniversary of end of WWI to champion international institutions such as EU and UN.

@gviscusi @HeleneFouquet

text:

Reporters can check with Secret Service sources on security reasons one of Trump’s 2 visits to U.S. graves was canceled, but world will still go nuts calling it international embarrassment.

text: Weather canceled the trip. The presidential helicopter can’t fly in poor conditions. And Belleau Wood is about 55 miles from downtown Paris; driving there would have been logistically challenging for the large presidential motorcade.

ELVIS PRESLEY will get a Presidential Medal of Freedom from Trump Friday.

Rain nixed Trump’s visit today to American cemetery near the World War I battle site of Belleau Wood. 

Chief Kelly, a retired 4-star general, and Joe Dunford, chairman of Joint Chiefs, still went. 

Tomorrow, Trump will visit American graves at Suresnes, and will give remarks.

Trump took offense at Macron’s proposal for Europe to create its own continental military force; Macron today tried to smooth over ruffled relations.

At the Élysée Palace, Macron keeps up the fierce moves from the alpha playbook.  

France’s president likes to leave white blanch marks on Trump’s skin.

text:

TRUMP: "I did not speak to Chris Christie. I heard he was in the White House. He’s a friend of mine. He’s a good man. When he got out of the presidential race, he supported me. I like Chris Christie, but I have not talked to him about it.”

text:

text:
