TRUMP: "What a stupid question."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump took our questions for 25 minutes in a cold windy drizzle. Got annoyed with us on questions about whether he wants to rein Mueller. Snapped his coat lapels, walked toward helicopter and realized he’d forgotten wife, under a White House door canopy. Came back to get her.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tells us he’s issuing proclamation suspending the entry of immigrants who cross the border unlawfully, barring them from eligibility for asylum. Any inadmissible immigrants to ports of entry, where they will be processed “in a lawful manner,” staff said yesterday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump names two ex aides to federal councils:
-Joe Hagin, an ex-deputy chief of staff, to National Commission on Military Aviation Safety
-Don McGahn, ex-WH counsel, to Council of the Administrative Conference to the United States, which tries to improve administrative procedures
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Some Rs are pressing for Alex Acosta, viewing him as more easily confirmed and as a conservative with a compelling life story—son of Cuban refugees, Harvard grad, one-time Supreme Court clerk.

Plus, Trump likes him quite a bit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The “save Mueller” activists are still outside the White House (about 100 right now), chanting “impeach 45” and “no one’s above the law” to the accompaniment of musicians and whistles. 

The riot gear that’s been near one WH entrance since early afternoon has gone untouched.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Among those White House and outside advisers are considering to replace Sessions as AG:

1. Labor Sec Alex Acosta
2. ex-NJ Gov. Chris Christie
3. U.S. Appeals Court’s Edith Jones
4. ex-AG William Barr 

A couple others floated, too, sources tell me and @StevenTDennis.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: A dispatch from Michigan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
White House continues to litigate the dust-up at press conference, arguing CNN's Jim Acosta placed hands on the intern. 

"The question is: did the reporter make contact or not? The video is clear, he 
did. We stand by our statement.” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in new statement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Two others in the chambers for Brett Kavanaugh's ceremonial investiture: Judge Merrick Garland, who was nominated by Obama to the Supreme Court, only to be blocked in Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell. 

Also in the room today: Mitch McConnell.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As the White House press corps was escorted out via a hallway behind the Supreme Court chambers, a clerk called out: "You've got justices on your left," and Neil Gorsuch, Samuel Alito and others walked past us. Clarence Thomas was to our right, adjusting his street clothes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Among those in the very full room for Kavanaugh's investiture ceremony: retired Justice Anthony, Trump's first White House counsel, Don McGahn, U.S. House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham, Sarah Huckabee Sanders.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Justice Brett Kavanaugh's voice was strong and carried throughout the chamber.

Chief Justice Roberts extended a "very warm welcome" to Kavanaugh and wished him "a long and happy career."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Thank you, Mr. Attorney General," Roberts told Whitaker. 

Roberts then administered the judicial oath. 

Kavanaugh: “I, Brett M. Kavanaugh, do solemnly swear that I will administer justice without respect to persons, and do equal right to the poor and to the rich..."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Chief Justice John Roberts said: "We are pleased to have with us today the president of the United States." 

Whitaker stood and said, "If it may please the court..." and moved that the commission, signed by then-AG Jeff Sessions, be made part of permanent record of the court.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
DETAILS from investiture ceremony: Brett Kavanaugh sat in same chair used by each member of court since 1972 -- the chair of Chief Justice John Marshall from 1819 to 1835. 
After Kavanaugh entered at 10:01a, there was a short pause, then audience asked to stand as Trump entered.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Inside Supreme Court chamber, acting AG Matt Whitaker moved that Brett Kavanaugh’s commission be read.

Trump sat nearby, hands clasped, leaning slightly forward, watching.

Sen. Lindsey Graham accompanied Trump in the motorcade and entered Oval with president after the ceremony.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump and 1st lady arrive at US Supreme Court for investiture ceremony for 102nd associate justice, Brett M. Kavanaugh.

Kavanaugh won’t do iconic walk down the courthouse steps that usually follows ceremony — “out of an abundance of caution” due to security concern, per court.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Fox News asked Kellyanne Conway about CNN’s Jim Acosta’s refusal to relinquish the mic and the WH’s decision to suspend his WH hard pass before they asked her about Trump’s decision to fire AG Jeff Sessions yesterday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As Trump prepares to leave WH for the Supreme Court for the investiture of his second justice, news breaks that Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 85, has been hospitalized.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Some journalists are here at the White House to get the story, Kellyanne Conway says on Fox News. 

“Others try to get the president,” she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: I sat next to Acosta at the press conference today. The White House intern came to take the microphone to the next reporter called on for a question, and Acosta, right or wrong, refused to give it to her when she reached out to grab it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
White House will “never tolerate a reporter placing his hands on a young woman just trying to do her job as a White House intern. This conduct is absolutely unacceptable,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.

It’s a reference to intern who was in charge of passing mic between reporters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“As a result of today’s incident, the White House is suspending the hard pass of the reporter involved until further notice,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says. 

This will deny unescorted entry to the WH grounds for @Acosta.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: New acting AG Matt Whitaker pledges to lead "a fair department with the highest ethical standards,  that upholds the rule of law, and seeks justice for all Americans."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Listen to the extended applause for Jeff Sessions from his now former staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A GOP operative told me halfway through the returns: “I want Trump to be repudiated, but the Rs that lose are the good guys and it’s the Trumpkins that will remain. ... Every sane Republican will have lost.”

He cited last night some of same middle-of-road Rs Trump just blasted.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump said he’s forming a “very strong opinion” on the Khashoggi killing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he’s open to raising some tax rates to help pay for a bigger tax break for middle-class Americans.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I could fire everyone right now, but I don’t want to stop it,” Trump said of Mueller probe.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump mocks — by name — several Republicans who lost in midterm races, saying they refused to “embrace” him in their campaigns.

Mike Coffman, Mia Love, Barbara Comstock, Carlos Curbelo, Peter Roskam, Erik Paulsen, John Faso, Bob Hugin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump warns of a “war-like posture” if Dems use their newly won control of the House to launch investigations into his admin, even as he praises Pelosi, an opposition party leader he has repeatedly attacked on the campaign trail.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“That’s a racist question,” Trump tells @Yamiche when asked about nationalism being equated with white nationalism.

There are globalists and nationalists, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “There was nothing sarcastic about it,” Trump says of this tweet. Pelosi does deserve to be speaker, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “They had a lot of suppression polls,” Trump says of midterms polling.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“People leave,” Trump says when asked about staff turnover. “No, I haven’t heard about John Kelly. ... It’s a very exhausting job. Although I love doing it.”
“Nothing monumental” expected for staff change, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I haven’t asked him but I hope so. Mike, will you be my running mate? Raise your right hand,” Trump tells Pence, in front row, when told 2020 presidential candidates are going to Iowa and asked whether he’ll lock in a running mate.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “You are the enemy of the people,” Trump says as a CNN reporter argues for more time questioning him about the caravan “invasion.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
They’re complex and people wouldn’t understand them, Trump says when asked if he’ll fight the House if it tries to get his tax returns.

If I were finished with the audit, “I would certainly have an open mind to it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump gives a shout out to “Nancy,” saying “she used the word ‘uniting.’”

“I give her a great deal of credit for what she's done and what she's accomplished,” he says of Pelosi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: So I was watching the returns last night “with some very successful people...” Trump says at press conference.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Dems’ failure to win Senate majority is voters’ rebuke of Dems’ treatment of Kavanaugh, Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “...like Oprah Winfrey, who I like...”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Only four midterm elections since 1934 in which a president's party has picked up single US Senate seat, Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Other aides here for Trump’s press conference in East Room: 
Bill Shine
John Kelly
John DeStefano
Kellyanne Conway
Mercedes Schlapp
Jared Kushner.

Also RNC’s Ronna McDaniel.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Two minutes til Trump’s press conference.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Staff in room for Trump’s post-midterms press conference: Chris Liddell, Lindsay Walters, Jessica Ditto, Ninio Fetalvo, Hogan Gidley, Raj Shah, Alex Latcham.

A dozen or so empty front row seats, so likely some top staff coming in with the president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about Trump switching up Cabinet members, Mitch McConnell says the Senate will have more time for confirmations due to less legislative agreement. 

Trump has "signaled that there's likely to be a number of changes and we'll process them," McConnell says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Three women win historic elections in Iowa:

—first female governor 
—first female members of U.S. House. 

(Iowa’s first female U.S. senator was elected in 2014.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
By 11 p.m., with Melania, Pences, Melania, Jared, Ivanka, Don Jr, Kimberly Guilfoyle gathered around him, the results were clear: the House was lost.

It soon became clear that Trump was ready to wrap up the gathering. 

He got on phone to reach out to winners, including Pelosi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
More guests at Trump’s midterms watch party: Harold Hamm, Michael Milken, Howard Lorber, Cleveland Cavaliers’ Dan Gilbert, Franklin Graham, Charlie Kirk, John Kelly, Dave Bossie, Brad Parscale, Corey Lewandowski.

Elegant serving dishes offered mini hotdogs, hamburgers, fries.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump was all business, solemn, watching election returns, I’m told. 

He gave no speech but expressed satisfaction at GOP wins, including Indiana’s Mike Braun and Florida’s Ron DeSantis.

Guests included donors Sheldon Adelson, Ron Cameron, Steve Schwarzman, and Cabinet members.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: MIDTERMS WATCH PARTY at WH had feel of a social gathering until Trump arrived and greeted guests, then moved to another room to watch two TVs — one with Fox News’ volume up and another with four channels on a split screen (Fox, Fox Business, CNN and MSNBC), I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump called Mitch McConnell to congratulate him on retaining Senate and also spoke with Democratic leaders Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Democrats Cindy Axne and Abby Finkenauer, who is projected to take out incumbent in Iowa 1st, are making history.

Iowa has never sent a woman to the U.S. House, ever.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: WHO-TV projects GOP U.S. Rep. David Young loses his Iowa 3rd seat to Democratic challenger Cindy Axne.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Democrats clinch the U.S. House majority, according to projections from NBC and FOX. 

This halts Republicans’ eight-year reign and will be viewed as a rebuke to President Trump. 

But Republicans will keep control of the Senate.
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-07/democrats-take-control-of-house-as-they-aim-to-thwart-trump …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dems are picking up House seats, but not at a rate that suggests a wave. Race for control remains close, with projection models still predicting a flip to Dems, @justinsink notes. 

Path to Senate control looks almost non-existent for Dems, though.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Maybe you get a ripple but I certainly don’t think there’s a blue wave,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says at White House. 

Fox News at same time was calling the House for the Democrats. 

“The president’s going to work with who ever comes into office,” Sanders said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Fox News projects Democrats will win majority in US House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump advisers didn’t expect Manchin to lose, but this will likely be a sore spot for Trump, who carried West Virginia by over 40 pts in 2016 and campaigned there multiple times as president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Republican challenger Mike Braun takes call from Indiana Dem Sen. Joe Donnelly, who telephoned to concede, according to Braun campaign.

Trump campaigned for Braun yesterday. 

Photo from @braun4indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Big win for GOP.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Would’ve been a bad portent for Dems to lose this seat.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Failed scanners in NY, voters locked out in AZ, tech problems in GA, a *fake* video on twitter.

The latest news on election integrity from America’s more than 170,000 polling places, updated throughout the day:

https://www.bloomberg.com/amp/news/articles/2018-11-06/silicon-valley-and-the-feds-on-alert-election-integrity-update?__twitter_impression=true …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Nate Silver gives Dems an 86% chance of taking majority in the U.S. House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This was pretty misleading. Trump hinted that Christine Blasey Ford recanted.
“The accuser of Brett Kavanaugh. ... the accuser admitted she never met him, she never saw him, he never touched her, talked to her, he had nothing to do with her, she made up the story, it was false.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
How Trump’s spending election day: 

He will make phone calls, monitor U.S. House, Senate and gubernatorial races and meet with political team for real-time updates, @PressSec says. 

Tonight, he invited family and friends to watch the returns with him and Melania at residence.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Lawyer A.B. Culvahouse Jr., who vetted Trump’s potential running mates, named ambassador to Australia.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In Missouri, Rush Limbaugh is the big warm-up act at Trump’s finale rally before the midterm elections. 

The caravan issue isn’t about racism, Limbaugh says, “it’s an issue of law.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump brought 3 of the top women in his admin for his 2nd to last rally before 2018 election.

He claims inviting Kellyanne Conway and Sarah Huckabee Sanders on stage in Indiana was an impromptu idea. 

“I just saw them standing there" so I said let's get them up here, he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Illegal immigration costs the country more than $100 billion every year, Trump says in Indiana. 

And that’s a low number, he says, because “if I’m off 15 cents on the high side" they'll say I exaggerated, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Hi, Indiana," Ivanka Trump said with a happy laugh, on the eve of the midterm elections, giving a rare speech at a MAGA rally. "It’s never been a better time to be an American worker. And that can’t stop. 

“And thank you for your love. We return it."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We all love her,” Kellyanne Conway says after Sarah Huckabee Sanders gives a short speech in Indiana. 

Conway says the crowds at Trump’s events are starting to look an awful lot like his winning 2016 crowds. “This place is filled to the rafters.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says these midterm races actually hinge on how good the candidates are. 

“It's really about the candidate, but if they want to give me the credit or the liability, I'll be willing to take it,” he told us on the tarmac in Indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In Indiana, Trump tells press gaggle that polls just came out and US Senate Mike Braun “is actually leading a little bit but I don’t want to tell Mike that.”

(Braun was standing next to him.)

Trump says he won Indiana by a lot in 2016 “and Mike is going to have a big victory.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if he’s concerned Democrats will go after his tax returns if they win House, Trump told us: “No, I don’t care.”

“They can do whatever they want. And I can do whatever I want,” he told us on tarmac in Indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s on AF1 departing Ohio for rally number two for today: in Fort Wayne, Indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump mispronounced Lima again.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "There are a couple of honest polls that are showing some very, very good promise tomorrow," Trump says of GOP candidates in midterm elections.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I will never call a woman beautiful again,” Trump says, saying that’s “politically incorrect.”

He brings Ivanka up on stage at Cleveland, Ohio rally even as he claims “they’ll say this is nepotism.”

He says she’s “smart” and beautiful.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
On AF1 for this three-state pre-midterm election rallyorama with Trump: 
-Ivanka Trump
-Jared Kushner
-Bill Shine
-Kellyanne Conway
-Stephen Miller
-Johnny DeStefano
-Sarah Huckabee Sanders
-Derek Lyons
-Dan Scavino 
-Stephanie Grisham (no FLOTUS, though).
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if he’s troubled by Zinke’s problems, “I'll take a look,” Trump said.
He's done a good job; but I wouldn't be happy with any negative things, Trump said before leaving for rallyorama.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I will announce before the end of the week,” Trump tells me when I asked how his UN ambassador search is going.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: I asked Trump what he’s planning to discuss with Putin this weekend and Paris and he said might not have meeting. “Probably not.” But will meet him at G20.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Brad Parscale, Trump’s campaign manager, on the town hall phone call said: “This president has done more than any president, midterms, ever. By announcing his campaign early; by spending over $20 million in rallies and TV commercials; this president is all in.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, ever huge consumer of news, says he’s been reading all the newspapers and “many of them think it's a referendum on what we've done. So, I don't know about that, but that's the way they're going to play it.”

“Even though I'm not on the ballot, in a certain way I am.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, on his town hall meeting by conference call this morning, started off his pitch for GOP votes by citing the economy.

Then:
—NAFTA is “a great deal”
—US is “winning” battle with China over trade.

But “it’s all fragile,” he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: China’s Xi Jinping hits back against Trump’s policies with some of his most pointed language yet, denouncing “law of the jungle” and “beggar-thy-neighbor” trade practices.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The legality of the Trump admin asking “Is this person a citizen of the United States?” on the next U.S. census goes to court today, the day before midterm elections.

@eelarson
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump said they’ve been working on a 10 percent middle class tax cut with Kevin Brady, but it might not happen if GOP loses the House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump at White House departure tells reporters his primary focus has been on the US Senate — and he thinks he’s made a difference in the races for 5 to 7 GOP Senate candidates.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Rush Limbaugh, who was born in Cape Girardeau, is one of Trump’s special guests at the rally in Missouri on Monday at 10p eastern.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: President’s home safely after rallies in Montana and Florida. Tomorrow he’s off to Georgia and Tennessee.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump mentioned the barbed wire in 
campaign speeches in Montana and Florida today.

"I looked at the way they worked and I watched the barbed wire being put down. Barbed wire. You got to come in legally folks,” he said at the rally in Pensacola tonight.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ex-Florida State football coach Bobby Bowden, in surprise appearance at Trump rally in Florida, delivered this line: “Trump plus God is a majority."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The guy in the video Trump had pinned to his Twitter page, Luis Bracamontes, is in the campaign’s new national TV ad. 

CNN rejected airing it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
White House confirms Trump has canceled his trip to Colombia because his “schedule will not allow“ it. 

But “Colombia is one of our closest partners in Latin America and the two countries cooperate on counternarcotics, regional security, and mutual economic prosperity.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Only half joking.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s plan to dispatch 15,000 troops could run to at least $6.1 million a day in personnel costs, @rtiron estimates.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I wish him luck,” Trump said when a reporter asked him about Alec Baldwin’s arrest just before Trump left the White House for rallies in West Virginia and Indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump said today that soldiers sent to fortify the U.S.-Mexico border won’t shoot migrants if they throw rocks at Americans, a reversal from remarks he made a day earlier.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I think we'll make a deal with China and I think it will be a fair deal for everybody,” Trump says as he leaves WH for more campaigning. 

“President Xi and I have agreed to meet at the G20. We’ll be having dinner. We'll be discussing it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NRCC’s Matt Gorman says Trump has "absolutely not" given up on GOP keeping control of the House. 

Trump and Pence "have been nothing but helpful" with rallies, robo calls, tweets, fundraising, Gorman says on Bloomberg TV.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Delta Air Lines pilot Steve Dickson is currently the top pick for Federal Aviation Administration chief, per WSJ.

https://www.wsj.com/articles/former-delta-air-lines-executive-and-pilot-is-top-pick-to-head-faa-1541175751 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
One Trump official who is opposed to some of this: Trade Rep Bob Lighthizer. 

He didn’t like the idea of pursuing a trade agreement with China at the G-20—and made his feelings known to others in the administration.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kudlow downplays this, saying admin isn’t doing any unusual prep for a deal at G20. 

“We’re doing a normal, routine run-through of things we already put together and normal preparation. There’s no mass movement, there’s no huge thing, we’re not on the cusp of a deal.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ivanka hasn’t done much midterms campaigning but she arrived in Iowa last night to stump for GOP Gov. Kim Reynolds today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pompeo announces US plans to give waivers to 8 jurisdictions and let them keep buying limited amounts of Iranian crude oil. 

Confirms scoop by @nwadhams. 

China—leading importer of Iranian oil—is still in discussions with US on terms, but is among the 8.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Minutes later, Turkey removed sanctions on two U.S. officials—Homeland Security’s Kirstjen Nielsen and AG Jeff Sessions.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: U.S. lifts some sanctions on Turkey following a court’s decision on Oct. 12 to free American pastor Andrew Brunson. 

The sanctions change comes a day after Trump spoke by phone with Erdogan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: KREMLIN: Trump and Putin will have a lengthy meeting during the G20 summit in Argentina at the end of this month.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Wow! 250,000 headline number. That's going to play into the Trump administration's hands nicely right ahead of the midterm elections,” economy reporter @jeannasmialek says.

Big hiring, but a modest wage gain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
FOX: Mercdes Schlapp is the WH director of strategic communications and Mercedes a lot of strategic communicating going on right now.
...
SCHLAPP: 1,000 to 2,000 illegal aliens crossing our border daily...Then you have the larger caravan where they documented about 270 criminals.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Bolton, in swing state of Florida, announced sanctions on officials in Venezuela, Cuba and Nicaragua, branding them a “troika of tyranny.”

US is taking action “to defend the rule of law, liberty and basic human decency in our region,” he said.
@justinsink
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-01/trump-orders-sanctions-on-venezuela-gold-to-pressure-maduro …
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump admin has agreed to let 8 countries keep buying Iranian oil despite sanctions on Iran. 
 
U.S.’s goal remains to choke off revenue to Iran’s economy—but to avoid politically damaging spike in fuel prices, ⁦⁦@nwadhams⁩  reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "They want to throw rocks at our military? Our military fights back. I told them, 'Consider it a rifle,'" Trump said during his immigration speech at the White House, five days before the midterms.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
I asked Trump what will happened to the children once he ends “catch and release.”

Families will be held, he said.

“President Obama separated the children,” he said. “And nobody complained. When we continued the exact same law, the country went crazy.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“My administration is finalizing a plan to end the rampant abuse of our asylum system,” Trump told us. 

If migrants seeking asylum don’t go to port of entry—if they cross border illegally—“we will hold them.”

"We will end catch and release. We're not releasing them any longer.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump said officials are making sure the election will be "perfect and safe.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I hope not,” Trump told me when I asked if the military at the southern border might fire upon anyone from the migrant caravans.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: I asked Trump if he envisions the military firing upon any immigrants at the border. He said if they throw rocks or stones, the military "will consider that a firearm" and will deal with it as such.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “She's under very serious consideration,” Trump tells us, when asked if Heather Nauert will be UN ambassador. “We’ll probably make a decision next week.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump wants to appoint State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert, a former ABC and Fox News journalist, as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, and she’s considered frontrunner to replace Nikki Haley. 

Bloomberg broke the news that Trump met with her Oct. 29 in the Oval.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and Turkey's Erdogan spoke this morning about "a desire to work together, particularly on their coordination in Syria," Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump will deliver remarks on immigration around 4p today in the Roosevelt Room, @ToluseO reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Jon Huntsman has cancer.

“It’s just stage 1,” Huntsman, the U.S. ambassador to Russia, told @jessehyde7. “So we’ll probably get it taken care of, and we’ll be fine.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
West Virginia was most pro-Trump state in 2016--he won by 42 pts--but Dem Sen. Manchin has double-digit lead in polls.

Trump advisers have known for a while Manchin will win, but president is still trying: Trump, Pence, Don Jr. campaigning there.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Activists who trained their fire on Trump’s first EPA chief, Scott Pruitt, now are working on a new target: Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke.

@jendlouhyhc
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tells @jonkarl in interview that migrant caravan is bigger than is being reported, “which he says he knows because of his own estimates.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
DeSantis goes hard negative on his opponent: "This is a guy that took bribes from an undercover FBI agent. ... Maybe we should impeach him" as mayor of Tallahassee. 

Trump then calls Tallahassee one of the most corrupt cities in the U.S.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump isn't mentioning this point - that Rick Scott distanced himself from him until now. Scott is locked in a very tight race for US Senate with incumbent Bill Nelson.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Who voted?" Trump asks Florida rally.
"Everybody voted already??"
(Cheers.)
"Then what the hell am I doing here tonight? What am I doing??"
(Loudest cheers of night so far, louder than "build the wall" or "CNN sucks.")
"It's like 100 percent of the people in this room voted."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "They've got a lot of rough people in those caravans. They are not angels," Trump, in Florida, says of the migrants in the caravans. "I tell them turn back. And they're not going to be released." He says he's taking the word release out of "catch and release."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump, at Florida rally, starts off with teleprompter speech on vile antisemitism, then expresses grievance that when he came home from Pittsburgh synagogue, the news media wasn't praising him, it was showing protesters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Old campaign warning about protesters is playing.

New version is a recording of Lara Trump asking protesters to stay in “safe” area outside.

For Trump fans: "Do not in any way touch or harm the protester." Just hold a rally sign over your head and shout "Trump Trump Trump."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Gov. Rick Scott and Ron DeSantis and wife, Casey, greet Trump in Fort Myers.

Scott's trying to unseat Dem Bill Nelson in very competitive US Senate race.

DeSantis and Dem Andrew Gillum vying to replace Scott as gov. 

DeSantis race is one of Trump team‘s most-wanted victories.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s off to Florida to stump for the midterms, with:
-Ronna McDaniel
-Kevin Hassett
-Bill Shine
-Dan Scavino
-Stephen Miller
-Johnny DeStefano
on board AF1 with him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Breaking: Trump, talking to reporters before leaving WH for Florida, says troop deployment to border may go up to 10,000 to 15,000 on top of border patrol officers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Oprah, and President Obama, will stump in Georgia just before Trump hits the campaign trail there Sunday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Nobody’s ever heard of you,” Trump teases a hospital employee who called out “I love you, Ivanka!”

Jared Kushner: “Good choice.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says “many more troops coming.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Criticism of the mass troop deployment on the southern border from a John Kelly ally—former Homeland Security press secretary David Lapan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mexico has been helpful in breaking up the migrant caravan, although it could do more, Sarah Huckabee Sanders said on Fox News this morning. 

And she said “a number of legal scholars” think a president has the power to end birthright citizenship through an executive order.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
U.S. embassy in Beijing is airing Trump admin’s criticism of China on its home turf.

Diplomats have so far avoided tight internet censorship to post Chinese translations of pointed comments from Pence and Pompeo.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
So much for the “Kavanaugh Bump.” 

Republicans now fear some of their voters are losing enthusiasm a week away from midterm elections that will determine control of Congress.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Not a word to the press upon his return to White House after trip to mourn with Pittsburgh after synagogue shooting. Eight political tweets earlier in the day, otherwise he stayed quiet.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked why Trump disregarded requests by Pittsburgh mayor and residents who said he shouldn’t visit so soon after attack, Sanders said: “He was also asked to come by some." He "wanted to show his respect on behalf of the entire country and to represent the country in this moment."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Sarah Huckabee Sanders told press on AF1 the reason Trump gave no remarks on anti-Semitism today, or combating hate, was because "he wanted today to be about showing respect for the families and the friends of the victims as well as for Jewish Americans.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump boards Air Force One after his Pittsburgh trip without talking to reporters. He's following the White House plan - letting this visit, to mourn for those killed at the synagogue, speak for itself.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump's visiting Pittsburgh police officers who confronted the synagogue shooter, including Tim Matson, who is in the ICU, Anthony Burke, Tyler Pashel and Daniel Mead.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has been mentioning Kanye West to leverage votes. 

"Kanye West, was he great? He did me a big favor," he said to applause in Indiana on Saturday. "Kanye! People like him."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Three weeks after Kanye West's visit to the Oval Office, he says he realizes he has been "used." Doesn't mention Trump specifically.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump placed stones on the 11 memorials for the people killed on Saturday at the synagogue in Pittsburgh. Putting rocks on gravestones is traditional sign of respect.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and the first lady were holding  hands as they strolled to the presidential helicopter on the White House south lawn.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump leaves White House for Pittsburgh without comment to reporters. 

Melania Trump, Chief of Staff John Kelly, Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner accompanying him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Paul Ryan: "Well you obviously cannot do that. You cannot end birthright citizenship with an executive order. We didn’t like it when Obama tried changing 
immigration laws via executive action, and obviously as conservatives we 
believe in the Constitution."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Markets, already been under pressure from concerns over rising interest rates and peak earnings growth, dipped yesterday on news about preparations for more China tariffs. 

Trump says it’s “a little pause” as investors wait to see results of the midterms.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s final campaign push ahead of midterms all but gives up on maintaining GOP control of the U.S. House and instead concentrates on turnout for competitive Senate and governor’s races.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump will do 11 more rallies before midterm elections.
Oct. 31: Florida
Nov. 1: Missouri
Nov. 2: West Virginia and Indiana
Nov. 3: Montana and Florida
Nov. 4: Georgia and Tennessee 
Nov. 5:  Ohio, Indiana and Missouri.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: In the aftermath of Khashoggi's murder, the U.S. is raising pressure on Saudi Arabia to resolve the Qatar crisis, sources tell me and @alaashahine.

Trump admin also wants Saudis to take steps on its widely criticized war in Yemen.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump's going to Indiana twice before the elections: Indianapolis on Friday and Fort Wayne on Monday, I'm told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Scooplet: Trump met today with State Dept spokeswoman Heather Nauert, a possible candidate for UN ambassador to replace Nikki Haley. (Others Trump considered, at least at one point: US ambassador to France Jamie McCourt, US amb to Germany Ric Grenell, former WH aide Dina Powell.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump on Fox News tonight, Laura Ingraham says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if Trump will deliver speech on immigration later this week, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says she will keep us posted.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump will travel to Pennsylvania on Tuesday to grieve with Jewish community in wake of mass killing at Pittsburgh synagogue, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Sarah Huckabee Sanders doing an official press briefing for first time since Oct. 3.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: US preparing new China tariffs in early December tariffs if talks next month between presidents Trump and Xi at G20 don’t ease the trade war, sources tell me and @jendeben.

An early December announcement would mean the effective date may coincide with Chinese New Year.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s legal team has prepared written responses to several dozen questions from Mueller but they say they won’t submit them until after the elections--and only if they reach a broader agreement with Mueller on terms for the questioning, @spettypi reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Troop deployment to the Southwest border will be the topic of a press conference with Homeland Security and Department of Defense officials at 4 p.m. today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump revives his characterization of the news media as the “Enemy of the People.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump hasn't conceded House to Dems, Kellyanne Conway said on Fox. 
"He wouldn't do that," she said. "He's going to barnstorm the country."

In August, POTUS: "As long as I campaign and/or support Senate and House candidates...we will have a giant Red Wave!"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump campaign releases new "vote Republican" TV ad with poignant violins and talk of a bright future. Why isn't Trump in the ad, @johndickerson asked Trump's campaign manager. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PsBQNfI-Dxw …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
News: This will be Angela Merkel’s last term as German chancellor.

She will quit as head of her Christian Democratic party after almost 2 decades. She intends to stay on as chancellor and step down when her term ends in 2021, @ArneDelfs reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Duterte is replacing all officials in the customs bureau in the Philippines with military officers.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: “Tyrone could fly. But that was never enough for him — he wanted us all to fly with him. So he lifted up everyone he touched,” @JesseLehrich.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump referred to the mail bombs sent to Dems as terrorism. 

"As you know, the suspect has been captured--great job--and is now in federal custody," he said at the North Carolina rally. 

"These terrorist actions must be prosecuted and punished to the full extent of the law."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says a "big tough guy" back stage got emotional over Trump. "He's almost got -- and most of them do have -- this one is too proud to cry."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Maxine Waters," Trump says at North Carolina rally. "I'm going to be nice tonight so I won't say it."

"I want them to say he was so nice tonight."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"You may go down as the most truthful president in the history of our country," 
@MarkHarrisNC9 says, quoting a Fox commentator who argued Trump is fulfilling his campaign promises.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "That was a lot of water, I was here," Trump says of Hurricane Florence and North Carolina.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: An internal memo from Bill Stepien, WH political affairs director, suggests Trump’s team is making preparations to explain away a GOP loss of the House and position Trump to claim credit if the party holds onto control of the Senate or expands its margin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says his supporters are some of the most wonderful people on the face of God's earth, defending against criticism that his rhetoric may have had anything to do with encouraging the mail bomber.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Political violence must never ever be allowed in America and I'll do everything in my power to stop it," Trump says at North Carolina rally, reading from teleprompter. "The media has a major role to play, whether they want to or not."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "It's tremendously big and tremendously wet, tremendous amounts of water."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: As GOP tries to retain control of Congress, Trump will do least 10 rallies in six days next week, I'm told. 

He'll be traveling to Missouri, West Virginia, Montana, Indiana, Ohio, Georgia, Tennessee and Florida twice.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if he’ll be in touch with Obamas and other targets of the mail bombs: “If they wanted me to but I think we’ll probably pass,” Trump told us on south lawn.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “There's no blame. There's no anything. You look at what happened to Steve Scalise, that was a supporter of another party,” Trump said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I did not see my face on the van. I heard he was a person who preferred me over others but I did not see that,” Trump told us on south lawn before leaving White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: FBI Director Chris Wray confirms 13 IEDs were sent to various individuals, each with roughly 6 inches of PVC pipe, a small clock, wiring, and potential explosive material. They're still analyzing but "these are not hoax devices."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Jamie McCourt is meeting with Trump and Pompeo today at the White House, I'm told. 

McCourt, U.S. ambassador to France and Monaco, is a possible candidate for the UN ambassador role to replace Nikki Haley.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We must never let political violence to take root in America," Trump says. 
He says he is committed to doing everything as president to stop it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I Am Donald Trump & I Approve This Message," says one sticker on the apparent van of the mail bomber suspect.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump to give comments on the bombing investigation, minutes after DOJ announced arrest.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Authorities have a person in custody in connection with the mailing of potential explosive devices to high-profile Dems, per Justice Dept spokeswoman Sarah Isgur Flores.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Full story on Scaramucci's explanation that Trump is "an intentional liar" to egg on the left, which is "very different from just being a liar-liar."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Grassley has said this at multiple events in Iowa lately -- that the GOP needs a GOP gov in case she needs to appoint a new senator. Which has made people say: Is there something you're trying to tell us about your health or intentions?
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Second tweet of the day insisting he uses secure lines when he calls people to chat.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump at 2p today will deliver remarks on drug pricing. 

What he'll say: He'll criticize foreign governments that pay less than the U.S. for some widely used drugs, @annaedney reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"He's an intentional liar, It's very different than just being a liar-liar," Scaramucci says. 

Trump speaks mistruths to "incite certain people," including Dems and left-leaning journalists, he says.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2018-10-25/scaramucci-on-why-blue-collar-americans-love-trump-video …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scaramucci on @BloombergTV: 

"President is an orange bowling ball and he's going to bowl a strike on those guys," he says of Dem presidential hopefuls. 

"Trump has this like Twitter insect light and he vaporizes everybody" by getting inside their heads.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2018-10-25/scaramucci-on-why-blue-collar-americans-love-trump-video …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Difference between comments made and actions taken. The president is certainly not responsible for sending suspicious packages to someone, no more than Bernie Sanders was responsible for a supporter of his shooting up a Republican baseball field practice last year," @PressSec.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked when Gina Haspel will fill in Trump on what she's learned about Khashoggi's killing, Sarah Huckabee Sanders told us: "He'll meet with the CIA director later this morning at his intelligence briefing." 

That's at 11:30a.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"...soooo wrong!"

Trump claims he uses only "Government Phones."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kremlin reacts “with humor” to NYT report on Russia eavesdropping on Trump conversations on unsecured phones.

“In general, we already treat such publications with humor,” spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
FBI says “potentially destructive devices” addressed to:
1. George Soros, Dem backer
2. Hillary Clinton 
3. President Obama
4. ex-CIA Dir John Brennan, care of CNN
5. ex-AG Eric Holder, but rerouted to “return address” of ex-DNC chair Debbie Wasserman Schultz
6. Rep Maxine Waters
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump told Wisconsin rally crowd he asks wealthy nations to foot more of the bill for their defense.

“I say, ‘Mr. Prime Minister,’ I say, ‘Mr. President,’ I say, ‘Mr. King,’ ‘Mr. Dictator,’ ‘Mr. Whoever The Hell We're Protecting,’ you've got to start paying for this protection.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“One of the generals walked in, ‘Sir, would you sign this?’ I started signing ‘Donallllld,’ and I said, by the way, what is it I am signing?

“You know I sign a lot of papers. Scary. You’re signing so many papers,” Trump said in WI. 

Suggesting he worries he doesn’t always know.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
An official at Turkey's presidential palace told Bloomberg today Turkey has no interest in pushing for new Saudi leadership. 

“Turkey wants Saudi to fess up to a crime, and if the crime leads to MBS, that's his problem, the official said,” @BenjaminHarvey reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: CNN report that a suspicious package was sent to the WH is false, Secret Service says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We condemn the attempted violent attacks recently made against President Obama, President Clinton, Secretary Clinton, and other public figures. These terrorizing acts are despicable,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in statement.

“These cowards” will be held accountable, she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Secret Service says packages with potential explosive devices—one addressed to Hillary Clinton, one to President Obama—were intercepted in routine mail screenings. 

A “full scope criminal investigation” with federal, state, and local resources underway to find sender, per USSS.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: China’s Xi Jinping getting worldwide attention for big infrastructure project—$15 billion bridge, the longest sea crossing at 34 miles, from mainland to Hong Kong.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s traveling to Indianapolis on Saturday for the FFA convention.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The sell-off in U.S. equities put the S&P 500 Index on track for its 12th loss in 14 days.

The Stoxx Europe 600 Index slid to the lowest level since December 2016 and Asian equities teetered on the verge of a bear market, per @VildanaHajric.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: First lady’s spokeswoman isn’t sitting by quietly.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The Toyota Center, a stadium with a capacity of 18,000, was nearly full when Trump started, but crowd began trickling out after the one-hour mark.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The details of that day when Chief Kelly grabbed Corey Lewandowski and tried to have him thrown out of the West Wing back in February, via @maggieNYT and @katierogers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Next time a hurricane hits, "do me a favor, don't take your boat out. Just get out of town for a while," he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump complains about the cost of Hurricane Harvey. 

"Did we help you with that lousy hurricane?" He says it was a brutal storm that kept dumping more water. "It was taunting us." 

"And I'm paying for this thing! I'm saying, 'Is it ever going to go away?'"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump bashes Maxine Waters, then adds: "She's going to be in charge of your finances." 

(Waters is ranking member of the House Financial Services Committee.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump insults Democrats who say MS-13 gang members are "people--they're people."
Man in crowd behind me yells: "Animals!"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: This will be the election of the caravan, Kavanaugh, tax cuts, law and order, and common sense, Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says a globalist is a person who wants "the globe to do well" but who frankly doesn't care about our country too much. 

"You know what, I'm a nationalist."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: If you want an investigation of Hillary Clinton, we'll have to nominate her to the US Supreme Court, Trump says, to a roar of cheers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I am talking to a lot of your people and they are going to form a wall--a different kind of a wall until we get the other one built. We need a wall built fast," Trump says in Texas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Build the wall!" the Trump rally crowd says. 
Cruz answers: "We're getting there." 
 #HoustonRally
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After Lara and Eric Trump spoke, guys came and affixed a medallion with the presidential seal to the lectern. 

And they added teleprompters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump answered Susan Page’s assertion about the bone saw by asking by asking if she knows for sure a such a tool was used to dismember Khashoggi, as the Turks have said. 

“Do you know there was a bone saw?” Trump asked.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump still believes Khashoggi’s death was “a plot gone awry,” he told @SusanPage and @djusatoday in 20-minute interview on AF1 on way to Texas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Glossy campaign signs here at Trump rally in Houston say “JOBS vs MOBS” and “GET OUT and VOTE.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As Trump arrived in Texas to help his old foe Ted Cruz keep his seat, he patted Cruz on shoulder twice then invited him to ride in Beast with him. 

Cruz nodded and then tried to climb in on POTUS side of the car.

Secret Service agent ordered him away — other door, senator.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if he regrets implicating Ted Cruz’s dad in JFK’s assassination, Trump said: “I don't regret anything.”

"It all worked out nicely,” he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says they’re doing “a resolution” sometime in the next week on the tax cut he mentioned Saturday.

"We're giving a middle income tax reduction of about 10 percent,” he told press at White House before leaving for Texas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s off to Texas. 

Brooke Rollins from the Office of Innovation is on board (she’s from Texas), as well as Derek Lyons, John DeStefano, Dan Scavino, Stephen Miller, Jordan Karem. 

Ted Cruz isn’t on AF1, he’s already down in Texas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump campaign says there were over 100,000 online requests for tickets for Texas rally so they have organized a tailgate before the rally.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: “I am not satisfied” with answers so far on Khashoggi’s death. 

Investigators coming back tonight or tomorrow.

“We're going to get to the bottom of it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“He’s not Lyin’ Ted anymore,” Trump says of Ted Cruz. 

He’s “Texas Ted.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, after some vicious campaign attacks on Ted Cruz and his wife Heidi during 2016 race, says he and Ted get along very well.

"I like him.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, as he leaves White House for some Texas campaigning, says people reporting over a hundred thousand people lined up two days ago.

He says Beto O’Rourke is highly overrated and did badly in debates.

per @asebenius.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: An Obamacare computer system was hacked earlier this month, compromising the sensitive personal data of ~75,000 people, Trump admin revealed Friday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence in Iowa says the caravan of migrants is full of vulnerability people and “all of them are being exploited by leftist groups” and human traffickers who have “no regard for human life.”

“We’ve got to build that wall!” he says, as Iowa US Rep. David Young stands next to him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Mnuchin’s still going to Saudi Arabia— not for the investment summit, but for the anti-terrorism finance meeting with security officials, @damianpaletta and @jdawsey1 report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Reaction from WH: Frustration from Chief Kelly isn’t new and he gets really defensive about the work his ex staff at Homeland Security are doing, including DHS head Nielsen.

Those around him are always wondering what the final straw will be. But he’s not quitting right now.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Hillary Clinton has been rethinking her grouchy relationship with journalists, @anniekarni reports.

After Trump snapped at @CeciliaVega, Clinton phoned her.

And Clinton’s longtime aide makes a case for why her name should be in mix as 2020 candidate.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders gives a statement on Bloomberg scoop about shouting match between Kelly and Bolton:

“While we are passionate about solving the issue of illegal immigration, we are not angry at one another.”

She goes on to blame Dems for not helping address immigration.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NYT after interview in Oval: “Mr. Trump was uncharacteristically guarded and disciplined during the brief conversation with The Times, declining repeated requests to discuss the chain of events that led to Mr. Khashoggi’s disappearance or the crown prince’s role.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
PRESS: Can you comment on a shouting match between General Kelly and Ambassador Bolton?

TRUMP: “That I have not heard about.”

(He is definitely aware of the fight, I’m told.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: “Certainly looks that way to me” that Khashoggi is dead, Trump tells reporters as he boards AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump shook hands with many in crowd of about 50 tourists/guests outside White House but didn’t come over to the rope line where reporters were. He’s off on a three-state campaign tour.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is aware of the shouting match between just outside the Oval between two of his closest advisers, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Scoop: John Kelly and John Bolton engaged in a profanity-laced argument outside the Oval Office today, I'm told. The shouting match was so intense others worried one of the two men might immediately resign. Neither is resigning, I'm told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump campaign moves his Monday rally in Texas to a bigger venue.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
We’ll get to see response from Saudis on Khashoggi investigation, Pompeo told us.

“ALL OF US, will get a chance to make a determination with respect to the credibility and the work that went into that.”

Assured it’ll “be accurate, fair, transparent.”
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-18/pompeo-expects-complete-picture-of-khashoggi-fate-from-saudis …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Emmet Flood is White House counsel, effective this morning, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says. Flood will be WH counsel til Pat Cipollone comes on board, then Flood goes back to being special counsel to the president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Mnuchin will NOT be participating in the Davos in the desert event, the Future Investment Initiative summit, in Saudi Arabia, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pompeo said Saudis are doing an investigation. 

“They assured me that they will conduct a complete and thorough investigation.”

Turkey is, too. After that U.S. will make own determination, he sald.

(We obviously had far more questions but Pompeo strode away after 3 minutes.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
POMPEO tells us he briefed president on his meetings on Khashoggi.

In a 3-minute briefing outside White House, sec of state said:

"There are lots of stories out there about what has happened" and he told Trump the U.S. ought to give the Saudis a few more days to investigate.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump threatens to close the southern border and cut off money to countries immigrants are fleeing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says his admin has asked the Turkish government for audio or video recordings of Khashoggi’s death in the Saudi Arabian consulate in Istanbul, and that he expects to learn what happened to the journalist by the end of the week.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-17/trump-says-he-wants-turkish-khashoggi-recording-if-it-exists …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he’ll ask all cabinet depts to cut budgets by 5% next year, after deficit swelled to highest level since 2012.

“We’re going to be asking for a 5 percent cut from every secretary today,” he said on this October day, 20 days before midterms.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Yes,” Melania told us in Egypt, when asked if she’s ever told him to put his phone down.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if anyone has tried to take his phone away to stop him from tweeting (“horseface” seemed implied here), Trump: “No.”

It’s how people hear from me, he says, after days of high amounts of news interviews and press gaggles.

“I don't call it tweeting. I call it social media.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said in a Fox Business appearance just now that he hopes King Salman and MBS didn’t know about “it,” referring to Khashoggi’s disappearance/death.

“That’s a big factor in my eyes,” he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump on Fox Business says “we need Saudi Arabia” to fight terrorism.

Asked if the U.S. will walk away from Saudi Arabia, “I do not want to do that,” Trump answered.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pompeo told reporters that some sanctions on Turkey could be lifted, per @nwadhams.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump also told Associated Press: 

—On “horseface” tweet, “You can take it any way you want.”

—Cohen was “lying” when he testified Trump directed him to break law

—On climate change, “I have a natural instinct for science”

—On Saudis, you’re innocent until proven guilty.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This headline?

“Trump tells AP he’s not to blame if Republicans lose House.”

AP asked: If GOP loses House, do you believe you bear some responsibility for that?

Trump: “No, I think I’m helping people. Look, I’m 48 and 1 in the primaries...”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Mueller is close to issuing findings on 2 aspects of his inquiry: whether there were clear incidents of collusion between Russia and Trump’s 2016 campaign, and if president took actions that constitute obstruction of justice.

@cstrohm @gregfarrel
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: USSS: “Secret Service is aware of the video posted on Twitter today by @errolbarnett. The circumstances surrounding the incident are under review. Pending receipt of additional facts, details and full circumstances ... appropriate action will be taken if necessary.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pompeo on “accountability” after meeting w King Salman and crown prince:

“My assessment from these meetings is that there is serious commitment to determine all the facts and ensure accountability, including accountability for Saudi Arabia’s senior leaders or senior officials.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"My biggest threat is the Fed," Trump told Fox Business's @trish_regan in interview today. "Because the Fed is raising rates too fast." 

Trump said he doesn't speak to Jerome Powell because the Federal Reserve is an independent agency, "but I’m not happy with what he’s doing."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump insults Stormy Daniels, calling the adult film actress who claimed to have had an affair with him “Horseface” after a judge dismissed a defamation suit she filed against him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I’m on his team. We have never talked about me leaving. And as you can see right here, we’re on our way. We just continue doing our job,” Mattis told reporters on way to Vietnam. 

He has “never registered for any political party,” he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
On his $1 million to charity pledge, Trump says he’ll only give the money if Elizabeth Warren takes a DNA test kit from Trump. 

“I'll only do it if I can test her personally,” he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he knows about CNN’s news (that the Saudis are preparing a report to reverse course and admit a role in Khashoggi’s death) but no one knows if it’s an official report.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked again about climate change, Trump said: “There is something there. Man-made or not, there is something there.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
In statement, Bolton calls his chief of staff a friend. 

“Fred Fleitz is a longtime friend and advisor. He’s been a valuable member of the National Security Council team. I wish him the best with his next endeavor.” 

Fleitz is leaving White House to work for a think tank.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Boston Globe on Elizabeth Warren: 

“If her great-great-great-grandmother was Native American, that puts her at 1/32nd American Indian. But the report includes the possibility that she’s just 1/1024th Native American if the ancestor is 10 generations back.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ivanka and Jared celebrated their son Joseph’s 5th birthday at Chuck E. Cheese’s, the pizza and arcade games chain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I did say this is very important, the world is watching, the world is talking. And this is important to get to the bottom of it,” Trump told reporters on south lawn before his departure for Florida and Georgia, referring to his conversation with King Salman about Khashoggi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
ROGUE KILLERS:

“We are going to leave nothing uncovered. With that being said, the king firmly denied any knowledge of it. He didn't really know, maybe, I don't want to get into his mind but it sounded to me like maybe these could have been rogue killers. Who knows?“ Trump said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“You better read it again,” Trump said this morning on his statement this summer about $1 million to charity and an Elizabeth Warren DNA test. 

Trump in July: “A million dollars to your favorite charity paid for by Trump if you take the test and it shows you’re an Indian.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I hope she’s running for president,” Trump says of Elizabeth Warren.

Standing on White House south lawn, he launches into campaign spin for 2020, saying he doesn’t think Warren would be difficult to beat — she’d turn US into “Venezuela.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
King Salman “denied any knowledge of it,” Trump says at WH departure, referring to Khashoggi.

“His was a flat denial,” Trump said. “All I can do is report what he told me.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Pompeo is leaving “literally within an hour or so” for Saudi Arabia, Trump says as he leaves the White House for Florida and Georgia in the wake of Hurricane Michael.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he just talked to Saudi Arabia’s King Salman about the disappearance of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

And he’s dispatching Pomeo to meet with Salman.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kellyanne Conway, in gaggle on WH driveway, says of Elizabeth Warren’s DNA test:

“I know that everybody likes to pick their junk science or sound science depending on the conclusion.” 

"It's odd. I just find Democrats are talking about 2020 and my boss is talking about 2018."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Elizabeth Warren: “My mother was born in eastern Oklahoma. It had been Indian Territory until just a few years earlier. ... My daddy’s parents, the Herrings, were bitterly opposed to their marrying because my mother’s family, the Reeds, was part Native American.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: A DNA test found “strong evidence” Elizabeth Warren has a Native American in her family tree six to 10 generations ago.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: A photo of Trump’s workspace — the private dining room off the Oval. TV remote, candy, newspapers, folders of reading material.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I know all these things, I’m not a baby,” Trump says of Kim Jong Un’s history. 
Leslie Stahl: You said you love him.
“That’s just a figure of speech.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Saudi Arabia is running out of time to explain to Trump admin what happened to journalist Jamal Khashoggi within its consulate in Turkey.

Pompeo and Bolton told Saudi ambassador to return to U.S. with answers—by Tuesday.

Story by me, @jeneps, @nwadhams
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“There’s a litany of possibilities here. I don’t want to go into those details,” Larry Kudlow said, referring to punishment for Saudi Arabia over Khashoggi’s disappearance. 

Trump wants a swift investigation. “I  think he’s talking about *this week,*” Kudlow said. @ThisWeekABC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kudlow Thursday wouldn’t answer questions about Khashoggi.

But he’s top admin aide on Sunday TV and he was *very* firm on @ThisWeekABC: 

“BELIEVE what the president says when he says we will take very tough action if the allegations of Saudi interference prove to be the case.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Well I don't know. He hasn’t told me that. I have a very good relationship with him. I had lunch with him two days ago. ... It could be that he is. 

“I think he’s sort of a Democrat if you want to know the truth,” Trump to 60 Minutes when asked if Mattis plans to leave admin.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Without naming Khashoggi, Saudi official news agency pushes back on Trump “punishment” comment.

“Official source” says “kingdom rejects any threats.”

Kingdom is “steadfast, glorious as ever, no matter whatever the pressures and circumstances might be.”
https://www.spa.gov.sa/viewfullstory.php?lang=en&newsid=1827989#1827989 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump’s campaigning out West next week:

-Montana on Thursday, Oct. 18
-Arizona on Friday, Oct. 19
-Nevada on Saturday, Oct. 2

He’s stumping for Senate candidates.

Trump has campaigned for 17 House candidates since late August.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“They deny it. They deny it every way you can imagine,” Trump says on “60 Minutes” on Saudis’ role in journalist Jamal Khashoggi’s disappearance. 

“We're going to get to the bottom of it and there will be severe punishment.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We remain deeply concerned about the continued detention of other United States citizens in Turkey and around the world, and urge the resolution of all these cases in a transparent and fair manner,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in a statement on the release of Pastor Brunson.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pastor Brunson has cleared Turkish airspace and will stop in Germany before arriving in DC around noon
tomorrow, @justinsink reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Florida sucks at hurricane preparation, FEMA’s Brock Long says.

@cflav
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Don Jr’s girlfriend, ex-Fox News anchor Kimberly Guilfoyle, is listed as cohost on nearly all of his fundraising events lately.

Guilfoyle, vice chair of America First Action pac, has drawn enough reaction from audiences that she intends to branch off and do more on her own.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After Dina Powell spoke with Trump at least three times this week about the UN ambassador job, she is firmly off the president’s short list now. 

Search for Nikki Haley’s replacement continues. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-11/powell-is-said-to-tell-goldman-allies-she-leans-toward-staying …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Plans are for Pastor Brunson to fly to a third country, possibly Germany, before returning to the U.S., I’m told.

It’s not clear whether or when the U.S. will drop sanctions imposed on Turkish officials in response to his detention.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A Turkish court set free Andrew Brunson, an American pastor, after holding him in prison for almost two years, removing a key source of tension between Turkey and U.S.

No deal was cut between Trump administration and Turkey.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Robert De Niro seems impressed with @BetoORourke. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-12/after-kanye-praises-trump-de-niro-talks-of-finding-anti-trump …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Don Jr.’s taking time away from Trump Tower to hit trail. 

He did 5 events last week for Ted Cruz that raised some $460,000. 

Next week, he joins Kid Rock for a Senate candidate in Michigan.

Since June, he’s helped raised $$ at 40 events.

@spettypi
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Robert De Niro says Kanye’s appearance at White House was “a shame.” And it’s time to find a replacement for Trump.

Who would be best, I asked.

“This Beto O’Rourke seems interesting,” De Niro told me, referring to Ted Cruz’s US Senate challenger.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-12/after-kanye-praises-trump-de-niro-talks-of-finding-anti-trump …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“It’s a shame” what Kanye West did today at the White House, Robert De Niro told me in interview at a DC party tonight, hours after West’s wild soliloquy and argument that wearing a red MAGA hat can make you “feel like Superman.”

Story to come.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump admin is hopeful that Turkey will set free an imprisoned American pastor when he appears in court tomorrow but hasn’t secured a deal for his release, sources say.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kanye’s hydrogen-powered Air Force One doesn’t exist quite yet.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-11/kanye-west-s-hydrogen-powered-air-force-one-doesn-t-exist-yet …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: After taking the stage in the Oval Office and speed-talking through the points he wanted to make to a national audience, Kanye West is now on stage again -- on top of a table at an Apple store not far from the White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if he rejects people saying Trump is racist, Kanye West said answer’s “complex.”

“So when I said, 'I like Trump,' to like, someone that's liberal, they'll say like, 'Oh but he's racist.' You think racism can control me? Oh, that don't stop me. That's an invisible wall."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, Ivanka and Jared listened as Kanye West used words we don’t often hear in Oval. 

He said he looks up to Trump and guys who are "no bullshit,” and teased Trump about having “crazy motherfucker" supporting him. 

Trump: "That was quite something." 
West: "It from the soul.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump has made it clear that he’s interested in the idea of appointing Dina Powell as UN ambassador to replace Nikki Haley. 

She has told colleagues at Goldman Sachs she's leaning toward staying at Goldman. 

Story with @sridinats.

text: Trump's current lawyers have gotten written questions from Mueller, CNN reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen is taking a dive to the left, heading even further from his old boss: he's registering as a Democrat.

text:
KANYE said he wants changes at Ford Motor Co. 

He wants "highest design, the dopest cars, the most amazing. I don't really say dope, I don't say negative words and try to flip them. We just say positive lovely divine universal words. So the fly-est, freshest, most amazing car."

text: Scooplet: White House is hiring President Richard Nixon's grandson to help with economic team, sources tell @jendeben and me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
KANYE WEST: 

"I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder. ... I'm going to go ahead, drop some bombs for you: 98 percentile IQ test. 

"The other ones 98 percentile: Tesla, Freud. 

But a neuro-psychologist said "I actually wasn't bipolar, I had sleep deprivation," he said in Oval."

text: My initial report on our wild ride with Kanye West in the Oval Office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kanye West, after a long and passionate speech in Oval Office, spoken partly in rhyme, told is he doesn't answer questions in sound bites.

"You are tasting a fine wine that has multiple notes in it,” he said.

Trump seemed to love it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Wildest Oval Office event I’ve ever seen.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: KANYE IN OVAL
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:

“Was that easy, Chuck?” Trump said in Roosevelt Room at music bill signing, referring to Kavanaugh.

“No,” Grassley retorted, to laughter. “It was not easy.”

Moore said he’s 85.

Hatch-Goodlatte Music Modernization Act ensures “artists who released records prior to 1972 are paid royalties from digital services, and streamlining the process for those services to obtain music-licensing rights,” WH says.

text: TRUMP, when a reporter asks about the Federal Reserve, says of Fed chair Jerome Powell: "I'm not going to fire him."

"We intend to get to the bottom of it," he said. "A thing like that shouldn't happen."

Trump says every year 8 millions of tons of garbage dumped into oceans by countries including China and Japan, then it floats toward U.S. 
"We are charged with removing it which is a very unfair situation."

-Caprese salad with balsamic glaze

Asked the appropriateness of Trump calling out the Federal Reserve, Kudlow told us: “The president says a lot of things and has a lot of fun.”

Adds: “Frankly I think people should listen to what the president is saying. But the Fed is independent. We've always said that.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Wall is being built but it's being built in chunks that I don't like," Trump on Fox. "A lot of people, and they're friends of mine, they don't want to do anything before the election because they think we're going to do well, but right after the election we're doing something."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
When Fox noted Oct. 10 wasn't a great day for investors, Trump said: "You know, the Federal Reserve is getting a little bit too cute, that's all. That's ridiculous what they're doing." 

He said: "When I took over this economy, this economy was ready to crash. We were at 1% GDP."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We're probably getting closer than you might think" to finding out what happened to Khashoggi, Trump said on Fox. 
"You don't have American citizens but that in this case doesn't matter. ... I don't like it with respect to reporters. It is a terrible, terrible precedent."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump implies that he knows Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi is dead. "He went in and it doesn't look like he came out" of consulate. It "doesn't look like he's around," he said on Fox News.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I said just yesterday we're going to get involved in Chicago, it's ridiculous what's happening in Chicago. There's no reason for it. We'll try and work with the mayor, if that's possible. I don't think he wants anybody's involvement, but we'll give it a shot," Trump says on Fox.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I have a lot of African American support and a lot has developed over the last little while with Kanye coming out," Trump said on Fox News, "and Jim Brown's been there for a long time."

Trump says Brown came out for Trump "when it was much less fashionable."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Yes, I am," Trump says on Fox & Friends when asked if he's running for re-election.

text: "I could say that I'm the most bullied person in the world," Melania Trump says.

text:
Trump’s trying to obey the “rules of MeToo” so he can’t use certain expressions, he says tonight.

“Pennsylvania was always the person that got away,” he says of the GOP’s quest for victory there.

Earlier he referred to US presidents as “he or she.”

text:
Trump says people thank him for sticking with Kavanaugh.
“I never even thought of it, folks. Never even thought of it,” he says of abandoning his nominee.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Today marked the worst market sell-off since February, which analysts attributed in part to trade tensions with China.

White House statement: "The fundamentals and future of the U.S. economy remain incredibly strong." 

Trump: “The Fed has gone crazy.”

text:
The Federal Reserve has “gone crazy,” Trump says, per @spettypi.

White House puts out calm statement on the economy, then Trump goes off on the Fed to reporters on tarmac in Pennsylvania.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "There is, to the best of my knowledge, no chaos in this building. We’ve gotten rid of a few bad actors, but everyone works very, very well together," Chief of Staff John Kelly told @Olivianuzzi during an impromptu Oval interview yesterday with Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Rosenstein clapped when Kudlow said the economy “could not be better.” 

per @ToluseO
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We are watching Hurricane Michael,” Trump said at WH just now. “Winds are going up to 200 miles an hour—you don’t hear about that.”

“This is going to be a big one.”

text: Deputy AG Rod Rosenstein was there for this bill signing, standing at the back of the room. He left afterward, without answering reporters’ questions, per @ToluseO.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
John Bolton and Jared Kushner spoke to Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman yesterday about Khashoggi, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says. 

Pompeo did a follow up call with the crown prince to reiterate the US’s request for information and need for transparency, she says.
