text: Trump’s ex political strategist says the midterms will be a referendum on Trump, and Rs can still hang on to a slender House majority with the GOP base energized by the bitter confirmation fight over Kavanaugh.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“We are certainly looking at Dina" Powell for UN ambassador, but others too, Trump says in Oval. 
Looking at people already with us and already vetted, he says. 
He says he wants replacement to spend time with Nikki Haley before she leaves. Says Haley may go into private sector.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump says he has spoken to Saudi officials "at the highest level" in recent days about missing Saudi reporter Jamal Khashoggi.

“And more than once,” he tells press in Oval Office.

Khashoggi’s fiancée may come to White House soon, Trump says, per @ToluseO.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I told my people, ‘Get the damn NFL problem solved.’ It took them about two minutes. ... Now the players will be paid more money and they still hate me. They still hate Trump. ... That’s why guys like Jim Brown and Kanye like me.” — Trump in Iowa
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump jokes that he’s ready to wrap up this Council Bluffs rally. 

“I thought I was coming to Iowa and there’s more people from Nebraska!”

(And now he’s hustling through his teleprompter speech.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Samsung, LG—I order a lot of them!” says Trump, a TV fan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“They get it!” Trump says of Kanye West and ex-NFL player Jim Brown, who are coming to lunch Thursday at the White House. 

Trump notes he argued during the campaign that black voters should give him a shot.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “He may be the world's most conservative human being,” Trump says of Iowa U.S. Rep. Steve King.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This MAGA crowd in Council Bluffs, Iowa is dominated by Nebraskans.

“GO BIG RED,” they chanted. 

Trump just realized it. I’ll tell my staff, ‘Great going folks.’” 

(Trump came to help drum up votes for two Iowa Rs in tight races — Kim Reynolds and David Young.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We’re going with E15 year round, ok?" Trump says in Iowa, to a roar from the audience. “Promises made, promises kept."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump in Council Bluffs says it was a historic week because of Kavanaugh and gives a shout out to “an Iowa legend” and “very tough cookie” Chuck Grassley.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump invited the press pool aboard AF1 on flight to Iowa to his personal office for a half-hour chat. 

Most off record. But he put one Obama insult on record when we asked about China.

“The Obama administration was impotent about the South China Sea.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP said he’s going to get the Texas pipelines approved immediately — “expedited approval,” he told us on AF1.

(Because the oil interests aren’t happy with Trump helping corn interests.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP says his summit with Kim Jong Un will have to wait.

“It’ll be after the midterms,” he told press on AF1. “I just can’t leave (the country) right now.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump did a “decision memo” on directing EPA to take action on E15 fuel.

I asked him for his timeline for EPA to change the regulation. 

“It’s all going to go very quickly,” he told me on AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump says he’s considering 5 people for UN ambassador. Dina Powell is one of the five.

Grenell isn’t one of the 5.
“Ric Grenell is absolutely some one i would consider but” he’s doing so well in Germany,” Trump told us on AF1. “Rather keep Ric where he is.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s on his way to Iowa with Rep. David Young, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Stephen Miller, Chris Liddell, Dan Scavino, and trip director Nick Luna.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Dina is certainly a person I would consider" for UN ambassador, Trump tells press on south lawn before leaving for Iowa rally, referring to Dina Powell.

Ivanka would be great, he said, but there’s a “nepotism" issue. “I'm not sure there's anybody more competent,” he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump didn’t tell the senators when he wants EPA to finish drafting this regulation, which will make it easier to sell more ethanol in vehicle fuel. 

But the action gives Iowa Gov Kim Reynolds and Rep David Young evidence they helped get the policy change across the finish line.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump just announced that “we will have E15 year round,” Grassley says.

Iowa’s Joni Ernst and David Young, and Nebraska’s Deb Fischer and South Dakota’s John Thune there at White House for it, too.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Some WH aides less than happy that Haley didn’t wait a month to announce she’s leaving at end of year. 

Instead she picked the morning after Trump’s ceremonial swearing-in for Kavanaugh, they note. 

But several advisers told me they doubt Haley’s announcement affects election.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Jared Kushner has been “a hidden genius” — with work “well done” on Nafta renegotiations and Middle East peace work, Nikki Haley said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump said in Oval Office he will consult Nikki Haley and his chief of staff about who her successor should be.

Haley has made it a “glamorous position,” Trump said. 

Pompeo and Bolton likely to be strong influences in the decision for her replacement, aides tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence joins praise of Haley. Her sudden departure caught @VP and other top officials by surprise, I’m told. 

“We will always be grateful for Ambassador Haley’s courage, intellect, character, and unfailing grace and we wish her and her family every blessing in the years ahead.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Nikki Haley and Dina Powell just went boating together, per a photo Haley tweeted Saturday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he’ll name a successor to Nikki Haley in 2-3 weeks, or sooner.

Among names being circulated: former WH national security aide Dina Powell.

Powell resigned in January to be close to her family, who remained in NYC during her tenure. UN ambassador is based in NYC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Exactly.
I have no indication Nikki Haley resigned because of discontent over Kavanaugh’s confirmation, but the timing hints that — and White House aides are aware of that.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
HALEY: “No, I’m not running in 2020.”

She says she will campaign for TRUMP in 2020.

”It has been the honor of a lifetime” to be UN ambassador, she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP says Haley “has been very special to me” and “is a fantastic person.” 

Hate to lose her, he says. 

She can come back in any capacity, he says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Nikki Haley is leaving at the end of the year, Trump says. She wants to “take a break.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Nikki Haley’s news caught everyone off guard—from Chief of Staff John Kelly to Vice President Pence, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Many in White House in the dark on WHY exactly she’s doing this, and they’re asking themselves why *now,* just before the midterm elections.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House officials confirm to me it’s TRUE: Nikki Haley has resigned as UN ambassador.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump before leaving WH for Iowa will order yearround sale of 15% ethanol gas—victory for corn advocates. 

David Young, Ernst, Grassley at WH for that. 

Young on AF1 with Trump to MAGA rally. Young and another Iowa R in tough reelection, Kim Reynolds, to appear on stage
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has invited Iowa congressional Rs to the White House for the E-15 gas announcement and to his MAGA rally tonight in Council Bluffs, I’m told. 

Joni Ernst may stay in DC for votes, and not head to Iowa. 

Steve King will be on the sidelines at the MAGA rally.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kanye West is coming to the White House Thursday, Sarah Huckabee Sanders confirms.

West will have lunch with Trump and meet with Jared Kushner. 

Topics: “manufacturing resurgence in America,” prison reform, preventing gang violence, reducing violence in Chicago, @PressSec says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Not by accident, *girls* greeted the first lady at each of her stops — Ghana, Malawi, Kenya, Egypt — this past week, as the US fretted about Kavanaugh.

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania posed for a photo shoot on a overlook by the pyramids as dramatic music (orchestra with a thundering base beat) played and a local dance troupe, like you might see in the Cairo Opera House, performed. 

The dancers were a surprise, her aides said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Very tight security here in Cairo for FLOTUS. Pres Trump impressed upon el-Sisi when they talked at UNGA that Egypt should take good care of her. 
Melania was swarmed with security agents at all her stops. Egyptian security even climbed high on Khufu pyramid to keep a look-out.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania toured Pyramid of Khufu, biggest of 3 great pyramids of Giza. 

She went inside, just for 5 minutes, not all the way to tomb.

(The shaft has no hieroglyphics or decoration. You walk upright for 40 ft then crouch. Leads to sarcophagus.
It’s really hot in there, I’m told.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked her best accomplishment on this 4-country Africa trip, Melania Trump told us: “That we care.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked at the Sphinx in Egypt if she believes Christine Blasey Ford, MELANIA Trump says: 
“We need to help all the victims no matter what kind of abuse they had. I am against any kind of abuse of violence.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about perception she tries to influence Trump:,
“Well, I don’t always agree what he tweets. and i tell him that. i give him my honest opinion. and honest advice. sometimes he listens sometimes he doesn’t. ... it’s very important for me that i express what i think.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: MELANIA on POTUS’s “shithole” remark: “I never heard him saying those comments and that was anonymous source and I would leave it at that.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Melania Trump, asked at Sphinx about Brett Kavanaugh: “i think he’s qualified for the supreme court. i’m glad that dr ford was heard. i’m glad that judge kavanaugh was heard. and that the fbi investigation was done. it’s completed.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania is taking questions from reporters — a rarity. 

She answered our questions for about a minute at the slave castle in Ghana, did a private interview with ABC News, and spoke to us off-record on Air Force One. 

She also made very brief public comments at four events here.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump at times seems to out-sphinx the Sphinx, with cryptic behavior that triggers widespread speculation. 

She is about to go see the Sphinx of Giza — the ultimate enigma, a monolithic statue whose origins and meaning are unknown.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Local officials in Egypt told me they hope FLOTUS visit is an engine for tourism. 

Tourism is down about 7 million people a year since the peak just before the revolution in 2011 — because visitors worried about instability, lack of law and order, petty crime, sexual harassment.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump having her first meeting with a head of state on her Africa trip — the president of Egypt, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi. 

She’s at el-Sisi’s main receiving palace, Ittihadiya, for tea with the president and first lady.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania with (apparent) statement clothing again today — here’s Kate Bennett’s interpretation of her menswear look.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Watch as baby elephants come racing toward Melania Trump—and their morning bottles of milk.

The orphans, at David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust, eat grewia, a natural vegetation, and drink a special milk made of human baby formula, coconut and other natural fats.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After feeding orphan elephants, Melania visited abused, parentless and abandoned kids at the Nest Children’s Home in Nairobi. 

These children are overlooked, branded outcasts, founder Irene Baumgartner said. “As you have chosen to come here, I think this is a very big step.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This is ash from ivory burns — a conservationist effort meant to discourage the ivory trade. The most recent burn was in 2016.

“It is sad to see this,” Melania Trump told her guide.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Eland, zebras, giraffe, egrets, hartebeest, cape buffalo, hippos (who played hide and seek in a pond), and white rhinos were out and about for our mini safari in Kenya. Melania Trump used binoculars to get a better look, and occasionally snapped some photos.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump’s vehicle stopped to check out a giraffe in the distance at Nairobi National Park, which is not far from the city of Nairobi and its 4 million people.

But the cameras are trained on her.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania stroked one elephants ears, prompted by the wildlife trust’s manager, Angela Sheldrick. But she backed away, startled, when the elephant shook its head. “He’s saying you’re tickling me,” Sheldrick said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
At a baby elephant feeding at a wildlife park near Nairobi, the first lady laughed more than reporters could recall witnessing. 
She fed one baby its bottle, letting him wrap his trunk around it to hold it himself. When he dropped it, she was startled then burst out laughing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
What do you wear when you go on safari with the first lady? Safari fashion at Nairobi National Park. 

Melania wore a white blouse and khaki riding pants tucked into tall leather boots.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Inside his helicopter after landing at White House after Minnesota rally, Trump was gesturing with his hands in a pretty animated way, per @cjnorwoodwrites. When he walked past reporters, he looked visibly irritated, she said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dirt-floor school, soccer balls and zebras in the yard—recap of Melania Trump’s day.

She was in Malawi, a Jane Eyre of Africa — poor, obscure and little. But not plain.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-10-04/melania-trump-in-malawi-dirt-floor-school-zebras-on-the-lawn …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Third country of the day — Melania Trump arrives in Kenya.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: After about five hours in Malawi, FLOTUS is off to Kenya.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Zebras in the front yard of the Malawi equivalent of the White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
US Ambassador Virginia Palmer, in her remarks cited lack of electricity (only 10% have power), and HIV epidemic and malaria problems in Malawi.

Malawi, poor as it is, was 1st to adopt antiretroviral therapy for pregnant mothers to prevent HIV transmission to the child, she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
On day 4 of Africa trip, Melania made her 1st public mention of President Trump. 

“I’m sure it can be difficult to be away from the States for an extended period of time,” she told embassy staff. “My husband and I appreciate all that you do.”

She’s made very few remarks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A white woman on the roadside held up a handmade sign as the first lady’s motorcade passed that said “Melania Me Too.” 
And two other white people had a “welcome to Malawi # notashithole!” sign.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
If the kids answer correctly, the teachers at Chipala Primary in Lilongwe say: “You are the bestie.” 

And then the students stands up, hands on waist, and sway their hips saying: “I am the bestie.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As Trump tweeted about the Kavanaugh controversy motivating US voters, the first lady was handing out books and soccer balls to kids in hot, dirt-floor Malawi classrooms.

Signs in the tiny library said “be best” and “ndine opambana” in Chichewa.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump, in her third set of brief remarks on this Africa trip, said she wanted to be in Lilongwe to see a successful program that the US is providing children. 

“Thank you for educating them to be best and grow up into educated adults for generations to come,” she said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania’s sitting in on reading lessons at the Chipala school, where there are about 100 kids per teacher, working in indoor and outdoor classrooms. Their names are written on cardboard necklaces.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: People in Malawi happy to see Melania Trump, waving and smiling.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump’s visiting Chipala Primary School, which aides say has 8,564 kids and 77 teachers—a ratio of 111 to 1.

She’s handing over textbooks in English and native Chichewa as part of a USAID program in place since 2015 and has distributed 9.6 million books to 5,600 schools.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump was greeted by Malawi’s first lady Gertrude Mutharika in Lilongwe. 

FLOTUS’s staff says she wants to highlight children’s issues here, in particular keeping girls in school.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania waves goodbye to Ghana as she boards plane for Malawi, leg two of four-country Africa trip.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Gold award for investigative journalism: “‘Brexit’s Big Short’ by Cam Simpson, Gavin Finch and Kit Chellel of Bloomberg News exposed how a handful of hedge funds netted hundreds of millions of dollars in the largest major currency crash in the modern financial system.”

Congrats.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The omanhene (king) of the 
Oguaa traditional area, Osabarima Kwesi Atta, said today he hopes the first lady’s visit draws the people of Ghana and the United States closer.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s tweet this morning didn’t flag any errors, either — he tried to knock it down by calling it old news and by criticizing the NYT.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
News of Melania Trump’s solo Africa journey hasn’t gotten big coverage in Ghana press. 

Today’s business paper ignored it; two govt-owned papers put it on  front page, with the stories on pg 16. 

Trump doesn’t dominate the news here in Ghana—they’re into local and Europe news.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Unlike in the capital city of Accra yesterday, where people on the streets seemed oblivious to or uninterested in Melania Trump as her motorcade passed, small crowds gathered in Cape Coast (a former capital city) to snap her photo and post signs welcoming her.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“This is a very special place, I will never forget,” Melania Trump told US reporters at Cape Coast Castle. 

She said she was moved by the stories. 

“The dungeon is really something that people should see and experience. And what happened so many years ago is really a tragedy.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: This is known as “the door of no return” — where European traders at Cape Coast Castle loaded African slaves onto ships, the museum educator explains to Melania Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania took time during her brief stop at Emintsimadze Palace to meet these 2 students, who regional king invited—a break with tradition.

She took pics with them, one who is deaf, one blind. 

Diplomatic aides said it may have been 1st time disabled people allowed in palace.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania Trump is listening to the history of Cape Coast Castle, a former slave trading compound on the coast of Ghana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Until Melania’s visit, it was taboo to allow a disabled person inside Emintsimadze Palace, or close to royalty, diplomatic aides told us.

The king felt that was wrong, so he went to a school for deaf to invite kids for 1st lady’s event.

In yellow: one deaf guest, one blind.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Aides on Melania’s behalf gave the king a pink basket of drinks, a traditional offering.

It’s a sign of respect to not speak directly to king (seated, in white). A linguist (holding staff) conveys messages, ensuring only words that reach king’s ears are flattering and pleasant.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump’s 1st stop of the day — the 2nd day of her weeklong Africa trip — is the Emintsimadze Palace to ask permission from the regional king to visit his land. 

“AWKWAABA” (“welcome” in the Fante language) a banner says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Melania Trump is following in footsteps of President Obama today, touring Cape Coast Castle, a slave trading outpost that dates to 1600s. 

“It reminds us,” Obama said 8 years ago, “of the capacity of human beings to commit great evil.”

Palace hall renamed Obama Hall 2009 visit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Morning run, Ghana.  

Many people awake and working at 4:45 a.m. in fishing port of Elmina, along Gulf of Guinea.

Town is known for Elmina Castle, built by the Portuguese in 1482 as a trading post for slaves, gold, ivory. 

Melania Trump visits a nearby slave castle today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: That baby in Accra was fascinated with the press corps, and even more fascinated with Melania, who cooed at him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: At a small open-air clinic at the Ridge Hospital in Accra, Melania Trump handed out pouches for babies to be weighed in, blankets and teddy bears. All the local mothers in eye-catching dresses.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: People stood on sidewalks in Accra, Ghana, as Melania Trump’s motorcade traveled by, but there was little visible reaction—few waving hands, and no homemade signs (in support or protest).
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Melania Trump arrives in Ghana on the first leg of her four-country Africa swing, greeted my drummers, flowers and reporters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: An uncharacteristic smile and wave to the press from FLOTUS as she heads off to Ghana, Malawi, Kenya and Egypt.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The first lady’s off on her first big solo international tour — a four-country, week-long tour of Africa. 

Me, @dsupervilleap, @jeffmason1, @KateBennett_DC, @albamonica, @katierogers are tagging along.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Justice Department sues California, the home state of major tech companies.

California passed a new net neutrality law after the Trump admin rolled back Obama admin rules on how internet service providers such as Comcast and AT&T should handle data traffic on their networks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Supreme Court starts new term today amid Kavanaugh controversy.

1st up among 42 cases: the gopher frog and reach of the Endangered Species Act. 

Later: executing people with mental disability, Google class action, iphone apps case.

⁦@GregStohr⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: Canada got protection from U.S. auto tariffs threatened by Trump, @josh_wingrove reports. 

Canadian auto exports up to a certain threshold will not be impacted by any U.S. tariffs on automobiles.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Watch for officials to call the new Nafta deal the USMCA — the United States Mexico Canada Agreement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: DEAL IS DONE—a trilateral trade agreement has been reached between U.S., Canada and Mexico, sources tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: CANADA confirms Nafta deal imminent, but no joint statement with U.S. crafted yet, @josh_wingrove reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Expect a Nafta announcement tonight. Canada and U.S. negotiators are just doing finishing touches. Trump has been fully briefed and is ON BOARD with the deal, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: U.S. officials have been keeping Trump in the loop on every step of the Canada negotiations since Friday, but there was no plan as of 6 p.m. to go to the White House to brief him in person on the deal, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST on NAFTA: Trump admin is growing confident trade deal with Canada is close, and a trilateral deal may be published by midnight deadline, sources tell me @josh_wingrove @jendeben.

Lighthizer and Kushner at USTR office right now hashing over details by phone with Canada.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kellyanne Conway this morning revealed something about her own past. “I'm a victim of sexual assault," she said.

"This is the first time I've ever heard you talk about something personal like that, and I'm really sorry," Jake Tapper told her.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Back at the White House tonight, a reporter called out a Trump as he walked from the helicopter to the residence: “How could you love a brutal dictator like Kim Jong Un?”

Trump didn’t respond.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump knew what the reaction would be and he said it anyway.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says the WH isn’t limiting the scope of the extra FBI checks into Kavanaugh’s background amid sexual misconduct allegations.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump on Kim Jong Un: “I was really being tough, and so was he. We were going back and forth. Then we fell in love. OK? No, really. He wrote me beautiful letters. And they’re great letters. We fell in love. ... But they’ll say ‘Donald Trump says they fell in love, how horrible.’”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "He wrote me beautiful letters. They're great letters. We fell in love," Trump says of Kim Jong Un.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "The stupid days are over folks," Trump says, referring to dealing with trade deficits with China.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "Who the hell wouldn't vote for me from law enforcement?" Trump says at West Virginia MAGA rally.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: First time I've heard Trump take a swing at Cory Booker, a possible Democratic presidential contender.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump bashed Elizabeth Warren earlier tonight, and now he goes after Corey Booker. 
"He ran Newark into the ground," he says in WV. 

"The only thing I worry about is that some total unknown that nobody's ever heard of comes along" he says, of potential presidential challengers.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "When you see 'Democratic Party'? It's wrong... They should probably change the name, if you think about it," Trump says in West Virginia. "The real name is the Democrat party."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The Democratic Party is so far left, "Pocahontas is considered a conservative," Trump says at West Virginia MAGA rally. "These people, they've gone crazy. Loco."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The media "really do they stoke the fires of resentment and chaos," Trump says in West Virginia. "They are truly the enemy of the people."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I love polls. Only when they're good. When they're not good, I don't talk about them," Trump says, back on the campaign trail, in West Virginia.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I’d like to find out who leaked the papers. Was it Senate Feinsten? Certainly her body language was not very good,” Trump said at WH departure, per @TammyThueringer
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump departs for a rally in West Virginia, less than six weeks before the Nov. 6 elections that will determine control of US Senate and House. 

West Virginia Democrat Joe Manchin’s Senate seat figures heavily into the outcome.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump tells press as he leaves White House for airport that having an FBI investigion is a blessing in disguise, and adds that Kavanaugh is a very well respected judge.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A person who knew both Kavanaugh and Ford in high school tells me:

“This FBI mini investigation is going to uncover some fairly unpleasant things about the witnesses. I hope that stuff stays private.”

Friends from back then aren’t talking with one another about it — too toxic.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: U.S. and Canadian negotiators likely to wrap up a Nafta deal this weekend. They’re working to avoid a fight that imperils $500 billion in annual trade, sources tell me, @josh_wingrove and @jendeben.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The reason for this morning’s delayed departure from White House to golf course was that Trump was on a call with King Salman of Saudi Arabia.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s off to his club in Virginia, getting some golfing in before his West Virginia campaign rally tonight.

He left the White House later than scheduled this morning, though. Taking care of some undisclosed business before spending time outdoors on this cool September day.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
New York Times on the left, Wall Street Journal on the right. 

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/27/opinion/why-brett-kavanaugh-wasnt-believable.html …

https://www.wsj.com/articles/confirm-brett-kavanaugh-1538089143 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh appears headed toward approval by Senate Judiciary Committee after pivotal GOP Senator Jeff Flake said he’ll vote to confirm the nominee, @LauraLitvan reports.

Whether he will be confirmed by full Senate remains uncertain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Jeff Flake, a crucial GOP vote, who was uncommitted last night, is now a “yes” for Kavanaugh.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Jeff Flake was one senator Bush talked with—and the former president urged a “yes” vote, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I'd never seen my friend and colleague Lindsey Graham so agitated,” Dem Chris Coons said today after the GOP senator’s hot-tempered comments, per @annaedge4.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: MCCONNELL: FULL SENATE TO VOTE ON KAVANAUGH IN COMING DAYS
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump voices firm support for his embattled Supreme Court nominee.

And cites Kavanaugh’s “search and destroy” comment — a line White House aides thought was one of Kavanaugh’s strongest.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: LATEST: Based on what Trump has seen so far, it’s unlikely he will press Kavanaugh to withdraw, sources close to the president say.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Trump is so far standing behind Kavanaugh’s nomination, I'm told. He thought Kavanaugh’s angry, emotional opening statement was strong. Within the White House, the consensus is that the Supreme Court nominee showed passion and honesty.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Positive reaction from a key conservative influencer.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The left is biting back amid this tearful testimony, as Kavanaugh says he was the victim of a "grotesque and coordinated character assassination."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kavanaugh’s emotion breaks through. As he talks about his father, his voice goes hoarse and he pauses to regain his composure.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“You’ll never get me to quit. Never,” Kavanaugh says, his voice angry and very loud. 

He says he’s never sexually assaulted anyone. 

“Sexual assault is horrific.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Unlike the president, First Lady Melania Trump is *not* watching the hearing. "We have been in meetings about Africa all day," her spokeswoman says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump spoke with Rod Rosenstein a few minutes ago and they plan to meet next week. 

"They do not want to do anything to interfere with the hearing," Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is back at the White House after seven days away. 

No comment to reporters on South Lawn who wanted to know his reaction to Christine Blasey Ford’s testimony, and whether he’s still meeting with the deputy AG today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Christine Blasey Ford says journalists caused her to go public.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q. With what degree of certainty to you believe Brett Kavanaugh assaulted you?
FORD: "100 percent."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump hasn't spoken to Rod Rosenstein today by phone, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is watching the hearing and Christine Blasey Ford on delay aboard Air Force One, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.

The president hasn't talked to Kavanaugh in the last couple of days, she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
WH aides say deputy AG Rod Rosenstein comes here regularly for meetings with people other than the president — the reason he’s here right now isn’t to wait to meet with Trump.

(Trump’s in flight from NYC to DC at the moment.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q Not a case of mistaken identity? 
FORD: “Absolutely not.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is traveling home from New York City, on board the presidential helicopter during her opening statements. He arrived at JFK airport and boarded Air Force One at the start of the question-and-answer portion of her testimony.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The shaky, hoarse voice of Christine Blasey Ford is echoing around the White House, on speaker on numerous televisions. Reporters and staff are hushed, listening to her explain her accusations against Brett Kavanaugh.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Two men said have separately told Judiciary Committee that they think they assaulted Christine Ford in 1982, not Kavanaugh.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump: "I was accused by 4 or 5 women who got paid a lot of money to make up stories about me. We caught them and the mainstream media refused to put it on television...They took money in order to say bad things." 

"You can check with Fox, because they covered it very strongly.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump took questions from 17 reporters during his hour and 20 minute solo press conference in New York, including CNN, NPR, NYT, CBS Radio, PBS, Reuters, CNBC, Fox News, Fox Business, ABC, NBC, OANN, plus members of the foreign press.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: And Canada says Trudeau didn't ask for a meeting.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW White House statement: “In under six hours today, over 60 men women who attended Georgetown Prep or sister schools that knew Brett Kavanaugh well during his time in high school signed a letter to directly refute the allegations released earlier today by Michael Avenatti.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about “secret” letter from Kim Jong Un, Pompeo this a.m. portrayed it as just like past ones.

“The messages...have been very consistent. They are that he is intent on denuclearizing,” Pompeo on CBS. 

Trump brandishes it, calls it “extraordinary.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"China is going and attacking the farm belt,” Trump says at UN meeting with Japan. “With ads and with statements—that don't look like ads, they look like editorial.”

“I don’t like it when they attack our farmers and I don’t like it when they put out false messages.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"They're bringing people out of the woods,” Trump says, at meeting with Japan’s prime minister, when reporters ask about Kavanaugh.

"The Democrats have been playing this game,” he says. "I think people are wise to it.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Confirming what Bloomberg reported earlier today, Trump says in UN meeting with Japan’s Shinzo Abe:

“We’ve agreed today to start trade negotiations” between US and Japan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump tweets the photos I shot in my car in Iowa on Sunday and tweeted.

My pictures show the four-page advertisement — disguised as a news section — that China paid for in the Des Moines Register criticizing Trump’s trade moves.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
But important part isn’t the lawyer, it’s “person who claims she’s been harmed,” Grassley tells @StevenTDennis. 

He says each time there has been accusations made, they’ve tried to follow up, and Senate Judiciary staff “are on it immediately,” reaching out to Julie Swetnick.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Grassley says he doesn’t know much about Michael Avenatti, one of the lawyers going after Kavanaugh.

“It seems to me he wants to protect people that are involved in pornography and that he's running for president,” Grassley tells @StevenTDennis.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Statement from Kavanaugh on Julie Swetnick: 

“This is ridiculous and from the Twilight Zone. I don’t know who this is and this never happened.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump didn’t like Kavanaugh’s interview with Fox News, Fox Business reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Schumer: “Judge Kavanaugh should withdraw from consideration.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kavanaugh in testimony tomorrow will say:
"I never had any sexual or physical encounter of any kind with Dr. Ford. I am not questioning that Dr. Ford may have been sexually assaulted by some person in some place at some time. But I have never done that to her or to anyone.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: FLOTUS at UN reveals the four countries in Africa she’ll visit in early October on her first solo international trip: Ghana, Malawi, Kenya and Egypt.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Julie Swetnick said she was a victim of one of those incidents in the early 1980s and that Kavanaugh and his friend Mark Judge had been present—though she did not say whether they had sex with her, @LauraLitvan reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: A new accuser against Kavanaugh says he took part in efforts during high school to get girls intoxicated so that a group of boys could have sex with them.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s remarks about not wanting China to “meddle” to elections came 3 days after China placed 4-page ad — disguised as a news section — in Iowa’s largest paper.

The ad attacks Trump’s trade war with Beijing — and he isn’t pleased about it, advisers say.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s NOT HAPPY China tried to influence voters with paid ad in Iowa newspaper bashing his trade moves, I’m told. 

At UN: “They do not want me or us to win because I am the first president ever to challenge China on trade and we are winning on trade.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump rakes China for trying to “MEDDLE” in midterms.

He’s referring to the 4-page ad in the @DMRegister. 

“Regrettably, we've found that China has been attempting to interfere in our upcoming 2018 election, coming up in November, against my administration,” Trump said at UN.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Watch for Trump today to announce a framework for bilateral trade talks with JAPAN.

The negotiations are likely to focus on the trade in automobiles, sources tell me and @jendeben.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about a timeline for a Middle East peace plan, Trump said within the next four months.

“I would say over the next two to three to four months, something like that,” he said, per @jeneps, who is at the bilateral mtg with Netanyahu.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: “I like two state solution.”

“It has to be good for both parties,” Trump says at start of meeting with Netanyahu.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Netanyahu at UN meeting thanks Trump for “strong words, strong actions” on Iran.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says his understanding of Venezuela comes partly from spending time at his Doral golf course. 

“We have many Venezuelans living in the United States. Many of them live in the Doral area of Miami. I've gotten to know them very well,” he said on his way to UN meetings.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Asked if the second summit between Trump and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un will happen in October, Pompeo on CBS said “more likely sometime after that” — the “location and date have not been set yet.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“But most importantly, European businesses are voting with their checkbooks. 

“They are leaving Iran in droves. These sanctions will be effective, they are effective.

“And come Nov. 4, they’ll be even more effective,” Pompeo says in response to Rouhani’s comments at UN.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: In Iran, “the economy is collapsing” as a result of the pressure being placed on the republic, and because of the “terrible government” there, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says on CBS.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Nikki Haley sends a message to world leaders during the UN general assembly: The Cabinet isn’t talking about the 25th amendment or questioning Trump’s mental fitness right now. 

She says on Fox News that at least one world leader asked her about impeachment or removal.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if she’ll run for president after her roles as governor and UN ambassador, Nikki Haley says on Fox News she’s never thought once about that — for 2020. 

“I would never run against the president” because Trump is doing a “great job.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The Beast “can put out a smokescreen, fire tear gas, and lay down an oil slick to send vehicles chasing it out of control. Even the door handles can be electrified to shock those who might try to get inside.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Frosty: Trump and Trudeau didn’t speak before Trump sat down for lunch. 

Trudeau then approached, standing behind him without the president acknowledging him. 

Trudeau tapped him on shoulder and they shook hands. Trump didn’t rise.

Trump later stood for Mexico’s Pena Nieto.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As trade war over Trump’s tariffs escalates, China on Saturday called off planned trade talks.

Today, it tried to influence Iowans. 

Story by me and @mniquette.

https://www.bloombergquint.com/business/2018/09/23/china-looks-to-influence-iowa-in-trade-war-over-trump-tariffs#gs.e3Vnta4 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
China uses this advertising format regularly—“news” inserts have appeared in Nepal, Australia, U.S., etc. per @kashishds, @lillebuen, @DavidMDrucker and others.

Beijing seems to be talking straight to Trump with this Iowa ad on “China-U.S. economic interdependence.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
In 15 years of covering Iowa news, I cannot recall the Chinese making a play like this.

Certainly unprecedented for China to take out a four-page advertisement in the DMR.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The advertisement, labeled as paid for by the “China Daily, and official publication of the People’s Republic of China” is like a 4-page tweet from the Chinese government.

It calls the trade war with Trump the “fruit of a president’s folly.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
CHINA sends a message to Trump and Ambassador Branstad by taking over 4 pages of Des Moines Register.

Advertising supplement has “news” on:
—China buying soybeans from South America due to “trade row”
—Xi Jinping’s “fun days in Iowa”
—“Beijing can set an example for the world.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: On Thursday at 10a, Ford testifies first, then Kavanaugh, @LauraLitvan reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Both Kavanaugh and the woman who says he assaulted her in 1980s have tentatively agreed to testify at a public hearing Thursday, per ⁦@LauraLitvan⁩ and ⁦@aritbenie⁩.

More discussion today between lawyers and Senate Judiciary Cmte staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Dianne Feinstein, the top Dem on the Judiciary Committee:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House says the four people who are “denying any knowledge” are: Kavanaugh, Mark Judge, Patrick Smyth, Leyland Keyser.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House: “One week ago, Dr. Christine Ford claimed she was assaulted at a house party attended by 4 others. Since then all 4 of these individuals have provided statements to the Senate Judiciary Cmte denying any knowledge of the incident or even having attended such a party.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: Draft EO calls for federal agencies to “address online platform bias.”

If Trump signs it, it would represent a significant escalation of his antipathy toward Google, Facebook, Twitter.

Story by @BenBrodyDC and me.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-22/draft-order-for-trump-would-crack-down-on-google-facebook?srnd=politics-vp …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: White House has drafted an exec order calling for fed’l probes into business practices of social media companies such as Google and Facebook. 

It’s in preliminary stages. 

But part of growing concern over social media platforms’ anticompetitive behavior. 

w/ @BenBrodyDC
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Grassley grants Ford another extension.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Grassley on Kavanaugh accuser:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump is slated to unveil new policy for E-15 gas in coming weeks — likely in Iowa, where farmers, biofuel producers and politicians have been clamoring for the move.

It’s likely to expand the U.S. market for corn-based ethanol.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump admin’s set to allow year-round sales of gasoline with higher ethanol blends, sources tell me, @jendlouhyhc and @MarioDParker.

It’s a move that could bolster GOPers in Iowa and Midwest who are in tough election contests, and appease corn farmers battered by tariffs.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“BORIS: Do you think (Kavanaugh) will get confirmed in the end?

PRES. TRUMP: I do. I do.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Rod Rosenstein, deputy AG, last year suggested that he secretly record Trump to expose chaos in the admin, and he discussed recruiting cabinet members to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Trump from office, NYT reports.

Rosenstein says story is inaccurate.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kent Sorenson, one of the most sought-after GOP presidential endorsers in 2012, was at the center of one of Iowa’s biggest political scandals.

@TimAlberta picked him up from federal prison and got the inside story.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Bloomberg has confirmed ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen has sat for hours of interviews with team Mueller. 

At least one meeting was in Washington, DC, I'm told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I will be there," Kavanaugh says in a letter to Grassley, referring to testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee on Monday. "I continue to want a hearing as soon as possible, so that I can clear my name."

Committee staff interviewed him Sept. 17.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: WH still confident Kavanaugh will be confirmed.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump leaves White House for some campaigning — Nevada tonight, Missouri tomorrow — without comment to press.

Aides Johnny DeStefano, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Stephen Miller, Dan Scavino and Jordan Karem with him on Marine One.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump today signed a new cyber security strategy. 

"For any nation that's taking cyber activity against the United States, they should expect...we will respond offensively as well as defensively. Beyond that, I'm just not going to go at this point," Bolton told reporters.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has booked meetings next week with South Korea's Moon, Egypt's Sisi, France's Macron, Israel's Netanyahu, Japan's Abe and UK's May during the UN General Assembly gathering in NYC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says remains from North Korea identified as Army soldiers from North Carolina and Indiana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump will sign approps bill in Nevada tomorrow, @debrajsaunders confirms. 

Despite Trump's gripes about the lack of border security money "in this ridiculous Spending Bill."

https://www.reviewjournal.com/news/politics-and-government/nevada/trump-hopes-to-energize-gop-voters-at-las-vegas-rally/ …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Lighthizerism” is one of the economic philosophies guiding the Trump admin right now -- and it could last for years.

A crash course in Lighthizerism, by @sdonnan.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Carson's leading a 20-person delegation in Puerto Rico today to discuss recovery efforts, White House says in statement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence, at the Korean War veterans memorial event, makes brief mention of Kim Jong Un's "commitment to allow nuclear inspections, subject to final negotiations."

"As President Trump said, we welcome this good news. We look forward to further progress."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Expect to hear more of what's on Trump's mind tonight and Friday -- he has a rally tonight in Las Vegas, (7p in Nevada, 10p eastern) and a rally in Missouri tomorrow night (6:30p in Springfield, 7:30pm eastern).
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
70 heads of state at Global Business Forum in NYC on Sept. 26, including UK's May, Turkey's Erdoğan, Mexicao's Peña Nieto, France's Macron, Nigeria's Buhari, Spain's Sánchez, Rwanda's Kagame, Switzerland's Berset.

Also Bill Clinton, IBM's Ginni Rometty, Ford's Jim Hackett, etc.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Black members of the House Financial Services Committee questioned Fed chair Jerome Powell about racial inequities. It’s a common test for every chair, and Powell gave mostly by-the-book answers. 
But afterward, 5 of his first 10 meetings with Dems were with black House members.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s goes after OPEC before its meeting on Sunday. His complaint follows signals from Saudi Arabia that it's content to see prices climb above $80 a barrel. That’s been a red line for the White House in the past.

@ja_herron
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Anything I can do, you all know where to call me,” Trump tells emergency officers at an emergency management center in Conway, SC.

“Washington is with you, Trump is with you.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump stopped by some yards of North Carolina families whose homes were gutted by floodwater from the Neuse River in Hurricane Florence.

Majority smiled at him and thanked him for coming. One man, standing amid his trashed belongings, said it meant a lot to have motorcade visit.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“They don’t know whose boat that is,” Trump tells us, in the backyard of a house where a boat was washed ashore in flooding caused by Hurricane Florence. 

“What’s the law? Maybe it becomes theirs.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, touring the Riverside neighborhood in New Bern, NC, where homes were ravaged by flooding, turns to the press, points to a man with pet on a leash and says: “He named his dog after me.”

The dog’s name is “Don T,” the homeowner told me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s handing out styrofoam carryout boxes of hotdogs, chips, peas, applesauce to residents in New Bern, NC, an area hard hit by Florence flooding.

“Amazing operation,” he says. 

Some cars in line waited nearly an hour to get in.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump asks a North Carolina official how Lake Norman is doing. 

“I love that area. I can’t tell you why. But I love that area,” he says, at the start of trip to see Hurricane Florence damage. 

(One of his golf courses, Trump National Charlotte, is on Lake Norman.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump asks a North Carolina official how Lake Norman is doing. 

“I that area. I can’t tell you why. But I love that area,” he says, at the start of trip to see Hurricane Florence damage. 

(One of his golf courses, Trump National Charlotte, is on Lake Norman.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"We're getting all teed up for a lot of money to come down to the area. You’re going to need it. We have it. And we will be supplying it,” Trump says in North Carolina on trip to witness Hurricane Florence damage. 

"It’ll be a tough two weeks" but then it will get easier.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Warm greetings for FEMA director Brock Long from Trump and admin officials in North Carolina. 

Handshakes and hugs.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s first stop in NORTH CAROLINA is a briefing at Marine Corps Air Station Cherry Point with local officials. 

On board AF1 with him were 4 U.S. senators: NC’s Burr and Tillis, and SC’s Scott and Graham. 

Also McMahon, Nielsen, Mulvaney (who is from South Carolina).
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “If she shows up and makes a credible showing, that will be very interesting and we'll have to make a decision. But I can only say this, he's such an outstanding man that it would be very hard to imagine” the allegations are true, Trump told WH press of Ford and Kavanaugh.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump takes off for North Carolina hurricane zone.

Staff with him include Chief of Staff John Kelly, communications director Bill Shine, digital strategist Dan Scavino, Kelly’s aide Zach Fuentes.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump has demanded the “immediate declassification” of some materials about the Russia investigation, but the agencies will propose redactions to keep some info secret.

⁦@cstrohm⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says Manafort will have no problems as long as he tells the truth.

“I believe that he will tell the truth,” he told press at WH before leaving for North Carolina.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “If she shows up and makes an incredible showing, that would be very interesting,” Trump says of Christine Blasey Ford testifying about allegations of assault by Kavanaugh decades ago.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, leaving WH for trip to hurricane zone in North Carolina, praises Kavanaugh and criticizes Democrats. 

“They're hurting somebody’s life very badly.”

He says he wants accuser to testify. "I really would want to see what she has to say.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I don’t have an Attorney General. It’s very sad,” Trump told The Hill in an Oval interview, bashing Jeff Sessions as awol.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
A friend of the woman who recently accused Kavanaugh of assault in their high school years says he heard about these allegations in 2017, before Kavanaugh was a Supreme Court nominee. 

@juliasulek
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump admin is taking steps to understand risks posed by biological threats, building on lessons learned from past incidents, such as the 2001 anthrax attacks, the 2009 influenza pandemic, and the 2014 West Africa Ebola epidemic, White House says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Three Dem senators ask White House Counsel Don McGahn in letter about Kavanaugh allegations: “What details did you have about these allegations before they were public?”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump threatens “great and fast” retaliation if China targets U.S. agricultural products for counter-tariffs.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Grassley had proposed telephone interviews of Kavanaugh and high school classmates Christine Blasey Ford and Mark Judge, who Ford says was present during the alleged assault at a high school drinking party.

⁦@okayhenderson⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The Guardian has a copy of Stormy Daniels’ book and says “Full Disclosure” has salacious details of her time with Trump, and claims he offered to cast her on “The Apprentice” and cheat to allow her to survive through more episodes of the show.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“This is not a shot from the hip,” Wilbur Ross says of tariffs on $180B in products sold in U.S.

Went item by item trying to figure out what would punish China but be least disruptive in the U.S., he says.

Smart watches, bike helmets, child car seats, etc removed from list.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Wilbur Ross says consumers won’t feel the new tariffs on imported Chinese goods—cost will amount to a “tiny, tiny, tiny” fraction of inflation. 

"Because it's spread over 1,000s and 1,000s of products, nobody's going to actually notice it at the end of the day,” he said on CNBC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Wilbur Ross on CNBC says EU and Japan helping push China toward a level playing field on trade. 

"It may seem strange, but the imposition of these various tariffs has actually brought us closer together to those two major allies.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "I think Jamie (Dimon) would be a phenomenal president,” Trump’s ex economic adviser Gary Cohn says at Reuters event. “Spectacular.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I’ve said what I’m going to say on the Woodward book. I really have,” Gary Cohn says at Reuters event.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump’s new tariffs on just under $200 billion in goods imported from China kick in Sept. 24.

The rate will be 10% til end of year then 25%. 

As Bloomberg reported earlier today, admin decided to exempt some items, including Apple Watches, bluetooth devices.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: White House: “Judge Kavanaugh looks forward to a hearing where he can clear his name of this false allegation. He stands ready to testify tomorrow if the Senate is ready to hear him.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump admin is lowering the U.S. cap on refugee admissions to a historic low of 30,000 people for the coming fiscal year, @nwadhams reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump orders release of:
—some FISA court pages on Carter Page
—all FBI reports of interviews with Bruce Ohr prepared in connection with Russia investigation
—all text messages relating to the Russia investigation, without redaction, from Comey, McCabe, Strzok, Page, Ohr.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“It will I’m sure work out very well,” Trump says of Kavanaugh confirmation.

Asked if Kavanaugh, who denies the allegation, has offered to withdraw, Trump says: “What a ridiculous question that is.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The White House hasn’t asked the FBI to investigate the allegation Kavanaugh sexually assaulted a woman when they were in high school—a request required for the FBI to take further action.

@spettypi @cstrohm
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump today: “China's now paying us billions of dollars in tariffs and hopefully we'll be able to work something out. We'll be having an announcement tonight, after close of market and that will take place—pretty comprehensive statement. Kevin may speak and Larry may speak.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he has not spoken to Kavanaugh today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked if the vote on Kavanaugh should be delayed, Trump says it depends on the Senate process.

Trump wants him on the Supreme Court. 

"If it takes a little delay, it'll take a little delay,” he said, per @ToluseO.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “It will be a lot of money coming into the coffers of the United States,” Trump says of his China announcement later today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"Judge Kavanaugh is one of the finest people that I've ever known,” Trump says. “Never had even a little blemish on his record.”

Trump says the FBI reviewed him 6 times.

per @ToluseO
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP says he will announce his latest China tariffs plans after close of markets today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Apple Watch and AirPods headphone will be spared from the next round of tariffs the Trump admin is imposing on Chinese goods.

@SalehaMohsin @jendeben
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
KAVANAUGH: “This is a completely false allegation. I have never done anything like what the accuser describes—to her or to anyone. ...

“I am willing to talk to the Senate Judiciary Committee in any way the Committee deems appropriate to refute this false allegation.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s barreling ahead with vow to punish China for alleged unfair trade practices, despite Mnuchin inviting Beijing to restart trade talks. 

China’s signaling they’ll refuse to meet with Mnuchin if more tariffs imposed. 

Trump’s ok with that, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump admin’s latest round of tariffs on China goods will be 10%.

That’s less than half the 25% level admin initially considered. 

But US consumers could start feeling the cost of tariffs for everyday goods, and Beijing says it will retaliate.

@jendeben @SalehaMohsin
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kellyanne Conway to press at WH says accuser “should not be insulted, she should not be ignored, she should testify under oath and she should do it on Capitol Hill. But that’s up to the Senate Judiciary cmte...Judge Kavanaugh should also testify to these 36 yr old allegations."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Chair of Congressional Hispanic Caucus sends letter to Trump rejecting his invitation to attend a reception honoring Hispanic Heritage Month.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
What about Andrew Cuomo and Cynthia Nixon — who wins out of those two, Bloomberg’s John Micklethwait asked Trump on Aug. 30.

“Cuomo’s going to win,” Trump said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
He was at Trump Tower. He says he’s not a spy. Now he’s suing.

@dglovin @eelarson
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Florida's Republican governor, Rick Scott, who Trump urged to run for U.S. Senate, puts more distance between himself and the president.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Florence, a slow-moving beast, began raining on the Outer Banks this morning and will arrive near Wilmington, NC tomorrow, @WeatherSullivan reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Hurricane Florence may be the last straw for Princeville, founded in North Carolina in 1885 and the first town in the U.S. chartered by African Americans.

@cflav
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Paul Ryan tells reporters he has "no reason to dispute" the 3,000 death toll in Puerto Rico. He toured the island after the storm.
Casualties "mounted for a long time." 
"Those are just the facts of what happens when a horrible hurricane hits an isolated place like an island."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is reading WSJ, as well as watching Fox. 

WSJ accurately noted that Mnuchin invited China to talk, amid “a steady rise in political pressure on President Trump to ease up on trade fights—which have pinched consumers and prompted painful retaliation against U.S. exports.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Brief medical emergency at White House. Ambulance called for a tourist who took a tumble at the residence, per Sarah Huckabee Sanders.
It was an older man, and the press could see he was smiling as he talked to paramedics.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says Democrats rigged the hurricane death toll in Puerto Rico to make him look bad.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
How Trump went after a potential presidential threat who could pitch himself as a “a strong centrist, pro-business, pro-free enterprise" candidate:  

"Nervous mess" and "poor public speaker" and "doesn’t have the aptitude or smarts” but "otherwise he is wonderful."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump disputes Hurricane Maria death toll in Puerto Rico and defends his actions in dealing with the storm. He's at the White House, watching Fox News on a day his campaign canceled a campaign rally in Missouri so he could monitor Hurricane Florence's toll on the Carolinas.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says Jamie Dimon isn’t smart enough to run for his job, attacking JPMorgan Chase's CEO a day after the banker questioned the president’s intelligence.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump orders the government to begin preparations to sanction any foreign country that interferes with the U.S. congressional elections in November.

@asebenius @justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Bad things can happen when you’re talking about a storm this size,” Trump says of Hurricane Florence.

“It’s called mother nature. You never know. But we know. 

“Get out of the storm’s way. ... It’s probably not going to change path.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Putin says North Korea is taking important steps but Washington is failing to respond. 

“If North Korea does something toward denuclearization it expects reciprocal steps and not endless demands for full disarmament," he said at a forum in Vladivostok.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Putin rejects British allegations that the Russians behind the nerve-agent attack on an ex-spy in the U.K. are intelligence agents.

“We know who they are. We found them,” Putin says. “They are civilians, of course.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
There has never been a president this unpopular with an economy this strong, @RichMiller28 reports.

“The economy booms, but President Donald Trump’s numbers are a bust.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Louisiana’s AG says he’s “thrilled” by the Justice Department’s interest.

“Those are the kind of resources that we’re going need to break these companies up,” Jeff Landry said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEWS: AG Jeff Sessions is exploring a potential investigation of Google, Facebook and Twitter. 

He'll be briefed Sept. 25 by state attorneys general who are already examining the social media giants’ practices. 

Story by @cstrohm @damclaugh and me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q UPDATE ON TRADE TALKS?

Trump: “With Canada, they want to make a deal very much. Me, if we make it, that's good, if we don't make it, that's OK, too.

“...I think the deal with Canada is coming along very well and we've all been dealing in good faith."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Q REACTION TO PORTER AND COHN'S DENIALS TODAY?

"Well, we shouldn't be talking about that right now because it doesn't matter,” Trump said in Oval during hurricane briefing, “but I really appreciate their statement. Their statement was excellent.“
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP: "Places that are in the way and in the most jeopardy would be Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, that area. They haven't seen anything like what's coming at us in 25, 30 years. Maybe ever. It's tremendously big and tremendously wet. Tremendous amounts of water."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "It's tremendously big and tremendously wet,” Trump says in Oval Office during a briefing with the FEMA chief on Hurricane Florence.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "The suggestion that materials were 'stolen' from the president’s desk to prevent his signature misunderstands how the White House document review process works—and has worked for at least the last eight administrations," Rob Porter says in statement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: In a separate statement to Bloomberg and others, former WH staff secretary Rob Porter says: "Having now read Bob Woodward’s Fear, I am struck by the selective and often misleading portrait it paints of the president and his administration."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Woodward's "book does not accurately portray my experience at the White House. I am proud of my service in the Trump administration, and I continue to support the president," Gary Cohn told Axios. 

Key thing: He's not saying what Woodward got wrong.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders says the president will travel to Paris in November as previously announced. 

"We are still finalizing whether Ireland will be a stop on that trip," she says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump’s trip to Ireland in November has been canceled.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump commemorates the Sept. 11 attacks by visiting the Pennsylvania field where United’s Flight 93 crashed, remembering it as the moment the U.S. “fought back” against terrorism.

@justinsink
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump didn’t take any questions from the press as he and FLOTUS boarded AF1 on their way to Pennsylvania.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
DOJ should look into the anonymous admin official who wrote the op-ed — because if they’re in national security meetings and trying to undermine Trump and exec branch, that’s problematic, Sarah Huckabee Sanders said. 

“I's something that they should take a look at,” she said.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Kim Jong Un is requesting a second meeting with Trump, and U.S. diplomats are already working to set up the summit, Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.

text: Some strong reactions emerging.

Trump had intended to stump on Friday for Cindy Hyde-Smith, a Republican appointed to the US Senate in April.

MANAFORT is mulling a plea deal to avoid a second trial.

text:
What he means when he says that:

It’s something he wants the press to say publicly, to get the message out, but he truly doesn’t want it attributed to him because he doesn’t want to offend or cause trouble. (In this case with China.) 

In reporter lingo, he means on background.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
There was much chatter on Twitter speculating Trump would sue the NYT to ferret out the anonymous admin official. 

Asked if the govt will take legal action against the NYT for publishing the article, he said the admin is “looking at that right now.”

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-07/trump-says-sessions-should-investigate-times-op-ed-author …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about his desire for a shutdown to force Congress to spend more for border security funding, Trump said he would do it—if it weren’t for people telling him it would hurt Republicans In midterms.

per @spettypi on AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump on AF1 said he is open to using military funding for the southern border wall:

“We have two options: we have military and we have Homeland Security. I’d rather get it through politically, I’d rather get it through Congress.”

via @spettypi on AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP on the anecdote in the Woodward book about Gary Cohn taking paperwork off his desk to keep Trump from withdrawing the US from trade agreements:

“That phony story about Gary Cohn. If he did that, I would never speak to him again, I would never speak to him again.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP ON TRADE WAR: He says he's looking at putting tariffs on another $467 in China goods. 

Altogether, that would more than cover *the entire value of products* the U.S. imports from China.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump says he's been told Kim Jong Un has sent him another letter. He hasn't received it yet, but it's on the way.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
"I think it is national security," Trump said on AF1. 

Sessions should determine who the author of the op-ed is "because I really believe it is national security."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump said he is looking at legal action against the New York Times. And he thinks AG Jeff Sessions should investigate to find the anonymous op-ed writer, per @spettypi on board AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump spoke to reporters on Air Force One during his flight from Montana to North Dakota, per @spettypi, who is on board with him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump says tariffs on another $267 billion in China goods are ready to go, on short notice.

This is in addition to the tariffs on $200 billion on China goods the admin is preparing now, he says on AF1.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Brazilian presidential elections jolted after the leading presidential candidate stabbed during a street rally. 

@DLBiller @andradevini3
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has a “commitment” from McConnell and Ryan to force a budget showdown with Democrats over the border wall “right after the election,” he said in a Fox News interview tonight in Montana.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Admiral Jackson was subjected to horrible lies and smears,” Trump says in Montana, then adds that he himself is, too, but he’s getting used to it.

text:
Trump taped an interview with Fox News’ Pete Hegseth at campaign rally in Montana, as audience watched. 

Trump blasted Sen. Tester over the Dr. Ronny Jackson saga: "It should never have happened.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, in Montana, says anonymous admin official who did the NYT op-ed would have to be a fairly low-level staffer.

The White House is a well-oiled machine, he said in a Fox News interview. 

It may be a deep state person who has been there a long time, he said, per @spettypi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump just told Fox News in an interview in Montana that if it were up to him, he’d shut down the federal govt before the midterms over border wall funding.

But GOP lawmakers don't want him to, so he *likely* won’t. 

via @spettypi
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s off to Montana and the Dakotas for a two-day campaign swing, part of his pledge to spend 40 days on the road ahead of midterm elections. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-06/trump-hits-campaign-trail-as-prospect-of-midterm-defeat-looms …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Matches what I’m hearing about the two competitive congressional races in Iowa.

Republican Rod Blum’s seat in northeast Iowa looking more likely to go to Dem Abby Finkenauer.

GOP’s David Young race in a purple district against Dem Cindy Axne is a toss-up, but he could hold it.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “If a person is bold enough to accuse people of negative actions, they have a responsibility to publicly stand by their words and people have the right to be able to defend themselves,” FLOTUS says in statement raking the admin official who wrote the anonymous NYT op-ed.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Call the opinion desk” at the NYT, the White House says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Dir. Mulvaney did not write the op-ed,” a spokeswoman says of Trump budget director Mick Mulvaney.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“...the local Fox affiliate was on. ‘The victim,’ the anchor said, ‘is still rattled but at home and doing fine, we can exclusively report.’ 

“It was disembodying, listening to this person I had never spoken with speak about me. We can exclusively report.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Mnuchin denial.

“It is laughable to think this could come from the secretary,” Treasury secretary aide Tony Sayegh says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kirstjen Nielsen denial: “Secretary Nielsen is focused on leading the men and women of DHS and protecting the homeland—not writing anonymous and false opinion pieces for the New York Times. These types of political attacks are beneath the secretary and the department’s mission.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Mueller’s office has given Trump’s lawyers a proposal that lays out “a formula” for an interview with the president. 

“There are a few things wrong with it,” Giuliani tells @spettypi.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
DNI Dan Coats in statement this morning:

“Speculation that the NYT op-ed was written by me or my principal deputy is patently false. We did not.”

Says he has always insisted the intel community focus on providing Trump and policymakers “with the best intelligence possible.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kim Jong Un made clear his “unwavering trust” in Trump, a South Korean official said.

“Kim especially emphasized that he has never said anything bad about Trump to anyone including his close aides.”

And Kim mentions possible TIMETABLE: Trump’s 1st term.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-06/kim-calls-for-progress-on-denuclearization-north-korea-says …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pence didn’t pen the anonymous op-ed in the NYT, his comms director Jarrod Agen says.

And Agen rejects speculation that it was anyone in Pence’s office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Pompeo, in Delhi, was asked if he’s the anonymous admin official who wrote the op-ed in the NYT. 

He said no.

And the rest of his fiery answer:
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
According to South Korea, Kim Jong Un told them he’s willing to take stronger steps to denuclearize the Korean peninsula, but wants recognition for what he's already done.

And they say he wants official end of Korean war, and US troops wouldn't need to withdraw from peninsula.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Several sources now saying they have doubts the anonymous senior admin official works in the West Wing — more probably works elsewhere, in one of the departments. 

@KellyannePolls on Fox says “hundreds of folks that would qualify for that title alone.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The latest from the Korean peninsula: hopeful talk.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-09-06/kim-calls-for-progress-on-denuclearization-north-korea-says …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: There's a feeling of resentment inside WH that aides can't be sure who to trust, and a professional encounter with a colleague can turn into an exercise in threat-risk analysis. But there's also a desire by some to pull together and thwart those who want to exacerbate mistrust.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: This is all true. There were the initial outbursts in the WH when they read the anonymous staffer's words -- mostly a mix of irritation and betrayal; some disbelief that the person is actually anyone with a high rank. Much speculation now about who the writer might be.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: It's getting dark in the White House.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: "So when you tell me about some anonymous source within the administration, probably who's failing and probably here for all the wrong reasons? No." 

"Our poll numbers are great. ... Nobody is going to come close to beating me in 2020 because of what we've done."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: "This coward should do the right thing and resign," Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in a statement about the anonymous senior admin official's opinion piece in the NYT.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: If "the failing New York Times" has an anonymous editorial it's "gutless," Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The anonymous admin official is probably somebody who's failing and is "here for all the wrong reasons," Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP says “we have someone” who is saying they're part of the resistance.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: About an hour and a half after the NYT published an anonymous senior admin official trashing Trump, he's speaking at the White House to a gathering of sheriff's department officials from across the nation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
OBAMA this week will begin an aggressive challenge to Trump and his party’s grip on statehouses and Congress. 

@mniquette
author: JenniferJJacobs

author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NYT tweet suggests the anonymous senior admin official is a man -- "he." 

The official complains Trump "engages in repetitive rants, and his impulsiveness results in half-baked, ill-informed and occasionally reckless decisions." 

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/09/05/opinion/trump-white-house-anonymous-resistance.html …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is still shutdown-curious, as Bloomberg reported this a.m.

"If it happens, it happens,” he said in answer to a reporter’s question during his mtg with GOP congressional leaders. “If it’s about border security I’m willing to do what has to be done.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The new name for the Nafta trade deal will be a surprise, Trump says in Roosevelt Room with GOP congressional leaders. 

Trump says the deal may include two or three countries -- and we'll know if Canada is in “over the next two or three days - maybe even today."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kavanaugh: "I am not a skeptic of regulation at all. I am a skeptic of unauthorized regulation, of illegal regulation, of regulation that’s outside the bounds of what the laws passed by Congress have said."
