author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he’s finished negotiating a new trade deal with South Korea and may sign it at the UN General Assembly later this month.

“The deal is done,” he said in Cabinet Room with emir of Kuwait. “It’s been done for about two months. We’ll do a ceremonial signing" soon.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump just asked for the press pool to join him in the Cabinet Room for part of his meeting with the emir of Kuwait, sending reporters *running.* Meeting was slated to be closed to the press.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Kavanaugh has put in a “virtuoso“ performance at the Senate hearings, McConnell said. “None of the votes seem to have changed.”

McConnell's coming over to the White House shortly to discuss appropriations bills and other matters, he said, per @elwasson.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “That was never even contemplated, nor would it be contemplated," Trump, in Oval Office with emir of Kuwait, says of the report in Woodward's book that Trump in April 2017 said in a private conversation with Mattis that the U.S. should go in and kill Syria's Assad.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“The book means nothing. It’s a work of fiction,” Trump, in Oval Office with the emir of Kuwait, says of Bob Woodward's "Fear" book. @realBobWoodward

text: Trump in Oval Office with the emir of the Kuwait says he's a "very special friend of mine," and Kuwait "has been a great partner" as the two countries practice trade and fight terrorism together.

text:
Until the excerpts of the Woodward book went public, Trump was strategizing how to further his agenda — including how to get money for southern border wall.

In recent days, he’d been asking people around him how a government shutdown before the midterm elections would affect Rs.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Until then excerpts of Woodward book went public, Trump was strategizing how to further his agenda — including how to get money for southern border wall.

text:
New Commerce chief of staff is Michael J. Walsh. 

"Mike Walsh, our deputy general counsel, will succeed Wendy (Teramoto) in this important role. Mike is a capable and effective leader and the department will be well served," Wilbur Ross said in an email to staff.

“This book is nothing more than fabricated stories, many by former disgruntled employees, told to make the president look bad," Sarah Huckabee Sanders says.

text:

Says US still looking for diplomatic solution in Syria.

text:
Kavanaugh sounds civility note. 

“I have served with 17 other judges, each of them a colleague and a friend, on a court now led by our superb chief judge, Merrick Garland,” his prepared remarks say. 

If confirmed, “I would always strive to be a team player on the Team of Nine.”

author: JenniferJJacobs

Trump warns Assad and his Russian and Iranian allies against “recklessly” attacking Idlib, one of last remaining holdouts for rebels in Syria.

BACKSTORY: This reinforces what Bolton privately told Russians last month — U.S. is ready to respond forcefully.

RBG and Paul Ryan at an event in DC tonight.

Ginsburg gave him a big smile.

text:
Wendy Teramoto, an aide to Wilbur Ross for two decades, commuted from NYC to work at Commerce.

Home on weekends, she took the 3:25 a.m. train to Washington on Monday mornings so she could tuck in her 2 little kids on Sunday nights but be at office by 8a.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:

Wendy Teramoto, the Commerce sec’s chief of staff, leaves this fall, aides told me and @sdonnan.

Trump to skip 2 major summits in Asia in November.

He’s sending VP instead to ASEAN in Singapore and APEC in Papua New Guinea.

Talks to resume next week, sources tell Bloomberg.

text:
To the outside world, Donald Trump is in a bit of a bind.
But Trump isn't retreating -- he's inhabiting his own desired narrative. 
Read this:

text:
Trump’s “breakdown” comment was said teasingly, with a grin at Sarah Sanders — because she had more than one conversation with him this week about paying respects to McCain.

He clearly figured she wouldn’t like that he didn’t say McCain would’ve been better president than Obama.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump thinks Iran’s survival has been thrown into question as a result of his policies.

“When I came into here, it was a question of when would they take over the Middle East. Now it’s a question of will they survive,” he told me & ⁦@margarettalev⁩.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“Wonderful thing, TiVo.”

Trump told @margarettalev and me he rewound the TV footage when he 
he saw political novice Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez—and then knew immediately that she’d win.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump says Dems can’t impeach him because he’s “doing a great job.” 

If he’s impeached, he told me and @margarettalev in an interview, then every future president would be in danger of the same fate whenever the opposition gains control of Congress.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “No, I don’t think I did at all,” Trump said when @margarettalev asked him if he screwed up the White House’s tribute to John McCain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump insisted he properly honored McCain.

But he wouldn’t say if he thinks the GOP senator would’ve made a better president than Obama.

“She’s having a nervous breakdown,” he said in our interview, of Sarah Huckabee Sanders’ reaction when he wouldn’t say McCain.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I view it as an illegal investigation. 

“I’m not saying anything—I’m just telling you this: You read the great scholars, the great legal—there should have never been a special counsel,” Trump told @margarettalev and me, referring to Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s probe.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says Allen Weisselberg, the chief financial officer of Trump Organization, didn’t betray him when he agreed to cooperate with prosecutors in their investigation into Michael Cohen.

“100% he didn’t,” Trump told me and @margarettalev in interview.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump rejected EU’s offer to scrap tariffs on cars. 

“It’s not good enough,” he told me and @margarettalev.

He compared EU to China, where he’s engaged in an escalating trade war.

“The European Union is almost as bad as China, just smaller.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Trump said some people see an “antitrust situation” with Google, Facebook and Amazon.

But he said “I just can’t comment. I won’t comment on the breaking up, of whether it’s that (Google) or Amazon or Facebook.”

"Look the conservatives have been treated very unfairly."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEWS: Trump doesn’t regret picking Jerome Powell as Fed chair, but “we are not being accommodated,” he told ⁦@margarettalev⁩ and me in Oval interview. “I don’t like that.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Jeff Sessions is safe as AG until at least the midterms, Trump told me and @margarettalev in an Oval Office interview.

When I asked if Sessions is safe after that, Trump declined to say. He just wants Sessions to do a good job, he said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: SCOOP: Trump has told aides he wants to move ahead with a plan to impose tariffs on $200 billion in Chinese imports as soon as the public-comment period concludes next week, six sources tell me, @SalehaMohsin, @sdonnan and @amayeda.

has been saying his goodbyes, I’m told.

Grassley thinks it’s a very bad idea for the White House to lose its trusted counsel, Don McGahn.

White House Counsel Don McGahn will leave his job after the Senate votes on the confirmation of Brett Kavanaugh for the Supreme Court, Trump says.

Trudeau says the trade teams will engage “with a view to a successful conclusion of negotiations.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: After public pressure, Trump releases proclamation ordering US flags flown at half mast at White House, all public buildings and grounds, military posts, naval stations and naval vessels throughout the US and territories until sunset on day of McCain's interment Sunday.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump in statement says admin officials will attend McCain memorials--but the president himself won't attend any. 
-Pence will speak at ceremony on Friday at US Capitol
-John Kelly, Jim Mattis and John Bolton "will represent my administration at his services."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP ISSUES STATEMENT ON MCCAIN: "Despite our differences on policy and politics, I respect Senator John McCain’s service to our country and, in his honor, have signed a proclamation to fly the flag of the United States at half-staff until the day of his interment."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
FLAG AT WHITE HOUSE lowered again to half staff, presumably out of respect for McCain. 

But the three EEOB rooftop flags still full staff.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
It did indeed take a full minute today for the White House to connect Mexico's president by phone to the Situation Room then to a speaker phone on Trump's desk in the Oval Office. 

As we waited, watching awkwardly.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ivanka Trump calls McCain "an American patriot" and "true hero and a great statesman." 

She's speaking at an Organization of American States event in DC.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Jared Kushner, on a conference call with reporters, hinted that Trump may want to work with Mexico on border issues next. 

"The spirit of cooperation and trust...hopefully will just continue to get better and lead to an even better and more prosperous and safer relationship."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump is keeping focus on himself and achievements today.

“Great for our farmers, our workers,” he said of Mexico trade deal. 

"Our stock market just broke 26,000 for the 1st time ever in the history,”  he said in Cabinet Room with Kenyatta. “I said that was going to happen.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump refused for the fourth time today to answer our questions about his thoughts on John McCain.

The latest opportunity was in the Cabinet Room with Kenya’s president. WH comms staff yelled at us to leave the room to drown out our questions, but Trump heard us.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump didn’t look at me when I asked him in the Oval Office, “Sir, do you consider John McCain a hero?”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “We’re working on a major infrastructure project—a massive roadway” in Kenya, Trump said in Oval Office with President Kenyatta.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Lots of warmth between Trump and Mexico's Enrique Peña Nieto, who was on speaker phone in Oval Office for trade deal announcement. 

Peña Nieto offered a "toast, with tequila, of course" to celebrate. 

And Trump told him, at end of call: "A hug from you would be very nice."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP CRITICIZES CHINA, saying he rejects their request for more trade talks. 

"They want talk. It's just not the right time to talk right now, to be honest, with China. It's been too one-sided for too many years, for too many decades and so it's not the right time to talk."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says Mexico will buy more ag goods now. 

"Our farmers are going to be so happy. The farmers have stuck with me--I said we were going to do this. 

"And Mexico's promised to immediately purchasing as much farm product as they can. They're going to work on that very hard."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
IN THE OVAL for Trump’s remarks on Mexico trade deal:
-Mexico’s Ildefonso Guajardo and Jesus Seade
-US Ambassador to Canada Kelly Craft
-VP Pence
-Jared Kushner 
-John Bolton
-John Kelly
-Chris Liddell
-Peter Navarro 
-Larry Kudlow
-Bill Shine
-Sarah Huckabee Sanders
-Derek Lyons
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: TRUMP: "With Canada, frankly, the easiest thing we could do is tariff their cars coming in. It's a tremendous amount of money. ... But I think we'll give them a chance to, uh - probably have a separate deal. We could have a separate deal or we could put it into this deal."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Trump says he’s terminating NAFTA and entering a different deal with Mexico, and possibly Canada if they want to negotiate “fairly.” If not, he says he put tariffs on Canada’s cars.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump speaking shortly by phone with Mexico’s Pena Nieto.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Dem and GOP leaders want flags at ALL GOVERNMENT buildings at half staff until McCain's burial on Sunday. 

(The flags are, as of right now, at full mast at the White House and on the WH campus.)
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP will announce the Mexico deal at 11a. 

Admin officials prepping to go on TV to promote the deal, I'm told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: The U.S. has reached a trade deal with Mexico, three sources tell me. 

Trump has signed off.

No deal with Canada yet, though.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Flags are still lowered in McCain's honor at the U.S. Capitol and on the National Mall this morning. 

U.S. Code says: "The flag shall be flown at half-staff ... on the day of death and the following day for a member of Congress."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The flags were at half mast in John McCain’s honor for about 24 hours.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: And @margarettalev!
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: None of the flags at the White House or Eisenhower Executive Office Building are at half staff, just a day and a half after GOP Sen. John McCain’s death.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Schedule for memorials for McCain:

Wednesday - lies in state in Arizona Capitol

Thursday - service in AZ

Friday - lies in state US Capitol

Saturday - National Cathedral service 

Sunday - private burial at US Naval Academy.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump has been briefed “and we are monitoring the situation in Jacksonville, FL,” Sarah Huckabee Sanders says in a statement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: McCain will lie in state at the United States Capitol Rotunda, the GOP leaders say.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Like yesterday, Trump is golfing at his Virginia club. He arrived at Trump National in Sterling, VA at 10:57a today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
SCOOP: The U.S. and Mexico may wrap up as soon as *Monday* with negotiations for a trade pact.

If Trump signs off, watch for him to trumpet this week how the deals on automaking will help the U.S. 

Story by @EMPosts and me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: President George W Bush on McCain: “Some lives are so vivid, it is difficult to imagine them ended. Some voices are so vibrant, it is hard to think of them stilled. John McCain was a man of deep conviction and a patriot of the highest order.”
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is golfing today. He arrived at Trump National Golf Club in Sterling, Virginia at 10:58a, per @asebenius.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump doesn’t want to comment on GOP U.S. Sen. John McCain before he dies, WaPo reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
INSIDE BOLTON’S TALKS w RUSSIA: 

1. They failed to move closer on withdrawal of US troops from Syria. 

2. Warned each other of possible new chemical attack in Syria, and blame opposite parties for plotting it.

3. Couldn't agree on election meddling.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
More Trump insults for Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

“...he doesn’t understand what is happening underneath his command position.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump: “I did NOT know about the meeting” at Trump Tower campaign meeting between Don Jr, Manafort and Jared Kushner with a Russian lawyer to get Russian “dirt” on Hillary Clinton.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: US has told Russia it’s ready to respond with stronger military action against Syria than it has used in past — if Assad uses chemical weapons to try to recapture one of the last rebel-held areas. 

Story by @margarettalev @alaashahine and me
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-24/u-s-said-to-warn-russia-it-will-hit-assad-if-chemical-arms-used …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: There were three cakes last night, by the way, homemade by WH deputy press secretary Lindsay Walters — a cookie cake for Sarah Huckabee Sanders, a carrot cake for Stephen Miller and a chocolate cake for Larry Kudlow.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Amid media reports on potential legal jeopardy as Trump’s secret-keepers talk to prosecutors, he’s showing his team a different face: upbeat, witty, aides say. 

No crisis war room being stood up, no prep for questions related to his ex-lawyer implicating him in a federal crime.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump dropped by staff party on patio outside WH last night to celebrate birthdays of Larry Kudlow, Stephen Miller, Sarah Sanders.

In short remarks, made no direct mention of Cohen plea, Manafort conviction, Pecker immunity agreement, or any sense of crisis, per @margarettalev.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “Because there are tax implications to all these transactions, it even opens up Trump’s tax returns to state and federal prosecutors: The Holy Grail,” a lawyer who formerly prosecuted U.S. tax cases says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump made the decision today after a meeting with Pompeo; Pence; the new envoy to North Korea, Stephen Biegun and Chief of Staff John Kelly, sources told me and @margarettalev.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I don’t want to be president because you have to pay a lot of taxes,” the boy sitting at the table at the children’s hospital told Kellyanne Conway just before Trump and Melania walked in.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“You know we kept open the job for the first female president? So you can do that,” Kellyanne Conway tells a girl in play area at children’s hospital in Ohio.

“This young lady says she wants to be president someday,” Conway tells Trump.

“You’ll be ready, right?” Trump says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
POTUS and FLOTUS are talking with family of a baby born with Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome (NAS).

It’s *very* quiet in this neonatal unit — silent except the beeping of medical equipment.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump and first lady are in a NICU of the children’s hospital. Required: hushed voices and dim lights — as medical staff work with preemies and stressed out parents.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Air Force One arrives in Columbus, Ohio.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump didn’t answer shouted questions about whether he’s concerned about North Korea’s resistance to denuclearization, if he has reached out to John McCain, or if he may pardon Paul Manafort.

He didn’t hear us over the loud hum of the Air Force One engines.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Traveling with POTUS today on Air Force One to Ohio:
—Melania
—Alex Azar
—Kellyanne Conway
—Johnny DeStefano
—Jordan Karem
—Stephanie Grisham
—Dan Scavino.

Sen. Rob Portman will greet them in Ohio.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump will tour a neonatal intensive care unit at the children’s hospital in Columbus, OH to learn more about babies exposed to opioids in the womb, White House says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump’s just about to leave the White House for a trip to Ohio.
He is traveling to Columbus to:
—visit children at Nationwide Children’s Hospital with First Lady Melania Trump
—do a roundtable with supporters
—delivers remarks at the Ohio Republican Party State Dinner.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: There hasn’t been “sufficient progress” in denuclearizing Korean peninsula, Trump says, canceling the secretary of state’s visit a day after Pompeo announced new envoy to North Korea.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Washington, DC paying tribute to John McCain and wishing him peaceful final hours.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: No progress on U.S.-China trade war after two days of talks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Manhattan DA is looking at *possibly* pursuing charges against the Trump Org and 2 senior company officials in connection with Michael Cohen’s payment to Stormy, per @WRashbaum.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump wants death penalty for cases in which fentanyl dealers caused someone’s death because of drugs they sold, aides tell me. 

He hasn’t committed to other specifics yet, but wants a deal. And Mike Lee is *happy* about that.

Story w @StevenTDennis⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
The 2 days of trade talks with Chinese officials just wrapped up.

“We appreciated the Chinese delegation coming to the United States to participate in these meetings. The U.S. delegation will be briefing their principals on the discussions,” WH spokeswoman Lindsay Walters says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “This report refutes the latest false accusation by Senate Democrats and fully exonerates Judge Kavanaugh,” WH spokesman Raj Shah says in statement on the special master report on the Starr investigation.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Scoop: Trump wants the death penalty for convicted illegal dealers of the opioid fentany, he told AG Jeff Sessions and other aides at prison reform meeting today.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-23/trump-is-said-to-propose-death-penalty-for-fentanyl-dealers …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: ALSO: Trump wants the death penalty for fentanyl dealers, I’m told.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
This is accurate—this is being pushed to at least after the midterm election at Trump’s direction, I’m told. 

Trump not interested in decreasing sentences, aides tell me.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Interesting exchange between Trump and Cornyn on threat from China (as Treasury sec sat in room with them, not with the Chinese officials talking trade with mid-level US officials across the street).

Cornyn: China represents the foremost nat sec challenge. 

Trump: Not Russia?
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Sessions has arrived at the White House for discussion on prison reform.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Jeff Sessions with a strongly worded response to Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Grassley tells Bloomberg he’d be willing to make time for a hearing on a new AG if Jeff Sessions somehow winds up gone. 

Very different message from last year, when Grassley warned WH he didn't have time for another confirmation hearing in 2017, @StevenTDennis reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump confidante Lindsey Graham on JEFF SESSIONS:

“The president’s entitled to an attorney general he has faith in, somebody that’s qualified for the job.” 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-23/graham-says-he-expects-trump-to-oust-sessions-after-elections …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump, GOP senators and top cabinet officials amplify their message about protecting U.S. technology as Chinese officials are in DC for day two of resumed trade talks.

Interesting timing.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Ford Motor’s VP of international governmental affairs, Steve Biegun, is the new special envoy on North Korea, Pompeo says.

The sec of state and Biegun will go to North Korea next week for talks.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump complains about inability of his attorney general to "control" Justice Dept, saying Jeff Sessions doesn’t stop his staff from pursuing members of their political party. 

“...they seem to go after a lot of Republicans," Trump said in Fox interview.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Before the Manafort case went to the jury, the judge considered a mistrial because one juror complained that others on the panel had improperly discussed the case.

⁦@davidvoreacos⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump wades into South Africa’s racially charged debate about land reform—seizing land without paying for it in a bid to address inequalities built up during apartheid and colonial rule.

Trump wants Pompeo to “closely study” the farm seizures.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I guess it says something like high crimes and all. I don't know how you can impeach somebody who's done a great job. I'll tell you what, if I ever got impeached, I think the market would crash,” Trump said in Fox News interview.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says he has “always had controversy in my life" but has always succeeded.

“I don't know if he was a fixer. I don't know where that came from,” he said on Fox News, referring to Michael Cohen. “They made it seem like I didn't live without him" but that’s not true.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump suggests Cohen is among people who “make things up” to secure a deal with prosecutors. 

"It's called flipping and it almost ought to be illegal,” he said on Fox.
"They make up things and now they go from 10 years to they're a national hero. ... He made a very good deal."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Elizabeth Warren releases 10 years of her tax returns.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Lawyer for Christhian Rivera trying to muddy the waters? 

Lawyer didn’t prove in court docs Rivera was here legally — just cites Rivera’s employer, who said Tues he was vetted via E-Verify. But Weds, employer retracted statement and said did NOT use E-Verify, per @JasonClayworth
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Lawyer for suspect in Mollie Tibbetts killing says he was working in the US legally.

ICE officials say he’s “an illegal alien from Mexico” and US Citizenship & Immigration Services officials say they have “found no record in our systems indicating he has any immigration status."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump campaign rally in Evansville, Indiana on Aug. 30.

10th rally in Indiana since Trump embarked on the quest for the presidency in June 2015, campaign says.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
McGahn expects to be questioned by federal prosecutors in New York about his knowledge of the hush-money payments Michael Cohen made. 

But McGahn wasn’t asked about the payments in any of his three interviews with Special Counsel Robert Mueller.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Trump didn’t consult his campaign lawyer Don McGahn about hush-money payments in the days before the election, source tells @spettypi.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-22/mcgahn-is-said-not-to-have-known-of-trump-s-hush-money-payments …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
FOX:  Know about the payments Cohen made to silence women? 

TRUMP: “Later on I knew, later on. ... They weren't taken out of campaign finance. ... They didn't come out of the campaign.

“They came from me.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
I asked Michael Cohen lawyer Lanny Davis if he thinks Trump and Cohen may talk soon.

“Never,” Davis said.

No one from the White House has reached out, and Cohen considers the relationship irreversibly finished.

“Done,” Davis said.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: NEW: Chinese officials are meeting with U.S. officials at Treasury today and tomorrow, reviving trade negotiations after a months-long standstill.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “It looks to me like abuse of power which is essential for impeachment,” Michael Cohen lawyer Lanny Davis says on Bloomberg TV.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Grassley recommends Trump read “How the President Steps on His Own Good News.”

https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-president-steps-on-his-own-good-news-1534771725 …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Extraordinary falling out between Trump and Cohen, who has been one of Trump’s most fiercely loyal aides since long before Trump was sworn in.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
As Trump traveled for re-election campaign rally, those close to him reassured him and shared ways to deal with fallout from double-barreled bad news on Cohen and Manafort felonies.

What Trump was most interested in: Hearing how it’s all playing.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-21/trump-s-terrible-day-sees-cohen-plead-guilty-manafort-convicted …
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Aides were aware this was a very bad day and relieved Trump had distractions:
—travel companions. Alex Mooney, Shelley Moore Capito, Cory Gardner talked to him on legislative issues, Schumer gripes.
—roundtable, photo line, rally in WV. So he was busy w people happy to see him.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump didn’t yell, rant or lose his cool over news Cohen had implicated him in a crime or that Manafort guilty on 8 counts. 

He didn’t criticize either ex-aide, I’m told. No talk of pardons. 

But he was somber. There was no joking around on AF1 like there sometimes is.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Cristhian Rivera, the 24-year-old immigrant who was charged with murder in the death of 20-year-old Mollie Tibbetts, worked at an Iowa dairy company owned by the family of Craig Lang, a Republican who ran for state agriculture secretary.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Suspect in killing of college student Mollie Tibbetts was employed by a well-known Iowa Republican, AP reports.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Cohen “is more than happy to tell the special counsel all that he knows.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump during campaign rally in West Virginia tonight also referenced this Iowa case (the suspect charged with killing 20-year-old college student is in U.S. illegally).

He called U.S. immigration laws “a disgrace.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump says Congress hounding him about getting trade deal done with China (the senators hounded Pence at lunch today). 

It takes time, Trump says. 

"It's got to gestate. ... It's like when you're cooking a chicken. Turkey--for Thanksgiving. My mother made the best turkey."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
NEW: Ex-Trump aide Steve Bannon tells me: 

"Today clarifies that November is a referendum on impeachment -- an up or down vote. 

"Every Trump supporter needs to get with the program."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump topics so far at campaign rally, hours after news of his former aides' serious criminal problems: 
-won "by 42 points" in West Virginia
-ESPN
-economy
-Gov. Jim Justice's big size. "I won't talk about the weight."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: "This is the beginning of the end for Donald Trump," Omarosa says on MSNBC, referring to Michael Cohen news.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Watch for Trump to mention tonight at his campaign rally this 20-year-old Iowa woman and the suspect charged with her death who entered the U.S. illegally.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: MARKET DIP: Investors reacted negatively to ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen's guilty plea, erasing gain for the day.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Cohen's lawyer Lanny Davis in his statement identifies the unnamed federal candidate, @dglovin notes. 

HE IMPLICATES DONALD TRUMP IN A CRIME.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Michael Cohen's lawyer, Lanny Davis: 

"If those payments were a crime for Michael Cohen, then why wouldn't they be a crime for Donald Trump?"
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump outside counsel GIULIANI: "There is no allegation of any wrongdoing against the president in the government's charges against Mr. Cohen. It is clear that as the prosecutor noted Mr. Cohen's actions reflect a pattern of lies and dishonesty over a significant period of time.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Sarah Huckabee Sanders offers the White House's statement: 

"On Paul Manafort: Refer you to the president's comments just now from West Virginia. On Michael Cohen: Refer you to the president's outside counsel."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
TRUMP: "IT DOESN'T INVOLVE ME." 

He says Paul Manafort's "a good man" who worked for Bob Dole and Ronald Reagan and the trial is "a very sad thing." 

"It had nothing to do with Russian collusion so we continue the witch hunt.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump just landed in West Virginia for re-election rally.

Fox News was on TV screens on Air Force One--so those aboard watched anchors call Cohen news potentially damaging for president.

Also that suspect in death of Iowa college student Mollie Tibbetts is an illegal immigrant.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
After pleading guilty, Michael Cohen released on $500k bond, cosigned by wife. Sentencing is Dec. 12. 

Deputy US Atty Khuzami says Cohen disregarded his training as a lawyer--he paid to silence 2 women and sought reimbursement with invoices submitted to the candidates's company.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Longtime Trump aide Michael Cohen says in court that at a federal candidate’s direction (Trump’s), he paid someone $130,000 to keep quiet (Stormy Daniels), which was later repaid by the candidate (Trump).

View of White House rose garden right now, outside very quiet Oval Office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
PARDON? Manafort, 69, faces long prison term for each count, raising question of whether Trump will take politically fraught step to pardon him or commute sentence.

Without Trump intervention, Manafort’s only hope for leniency = cooperate with Mueller.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
SURREAL TRUMPWORLD DAY:
4:21p - Trump longtime lawyer Michael Cohen pleads guilty to 8 counts
4:23p - Verdicts roll in on Trump campaign chair Paul Manafort - guilty on 8 counts
4:25p - Trump boards AF1 and ignores shouted questions from press on tarmac about Cohen and Manafort.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Michael Cohen tells federal court he evaded substantial taxes on his income.

Sentencing guideline calls for 46 to 63 months in prison.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
BREAKING: Manafort GUILTY on all five tax fraud counts. 

Guilty on three others. 

Mistrial on 10 counts.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: And don’t forget about OMAROSA.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: As Trump boarded Air Force One with aides Stephen Miller and Johnny DeStefano, NEWS BROKE that his longtime lawyer Michael COHEN charged with unlawful campaign contribution and other counts and jury reached verdict on 8 counts against his onetime campaign chairman Paul MANAFORT.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: VERDICT on 8 of the 18 counts against Manafort
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The Manafort jury sends judge yet another note.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump telephoned Ric Grenell today, I’m told, after the news the U.S. deported former Nazi guard Jakiw Palij.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Stormy Daniels' lawyer, Michael Avenatti, says today's developments "will permit us to have the stay lifted in the civil case and should also permit us to proceed with an expedited deposition of Trump under oath."
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Now through September, Trump will do 15 fundraisers and 8 rallies in 16 states -- in South Dakota, North Dakota, Montana, Kentucky, Tennessee, aides say.

In August, he did 16 events in 8 states. 

The RNC has raised $227 million this cycle.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: BREAKING: Federal court hearing set for Tuesday at 4p for Michael Cohen.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is disregarding concerns he could be a liability to GOP candidates on the ballot this fall and will travel across the country, spending more than 40 days on the campaign trail before midterm elections.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Kellyanne Conway, after an appearance on Fox from the briefing room on a rainy Tuesday, didn’t answer questions from press corps on Microsoft/Russians or Michael Cohen.
author: JenniferJJacobs
JenniferJJacobs

text:
Jurors in the Paul Manafort fraud trial are in 4th day of deliberations today, reviewing 388 documents and the testimony of 27 witnesses.

@davidvoreacos
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
McGahn didn’t implicate Trump in legal wrongdoing in special counsel interviews, his attorney tells president’s legal team. 

@CarolLeonnig
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “It was something that Barack Obama and George W. Bush wanted to do and couldn't quite get it done,” Trump spokesman Hogan Gidley says on Fox Business, referring to the deportation of the suspected Nazi guard.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: U.S. deports a 95-year old Nazi guard.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump denies a report in the New Yorker that advisers urged him to deny Barack Obama access to intelligence briefings -- a benefit extended to other former presidents.

⁦@tdopp⁩
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “This will be my first time traveling to Africa and I am excited to educate myself on the issues facing children throughout the continent, while also learning about its rich culture and history,” Melania Trump says in a statement.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: The immigration official who Trump cited for speaking “perfect English” was US Border Patrol agent Adrian Anzaldua.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I don’t have party lines,” Trump says, saying he votes for what’s right.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump gets big applause and cheers from the immigration officers in the East Room when he says:

“We will end the policy of ‘catch and release.’”

and:

“We will secure our borders.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
It’s not the speechwriter’s fault. 

I’m standing next to the teleprompter Trump is reading from in the East Room and it says “CBP.”

But Trump has said “CBC” over and over.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
It’s not the speechwriter’s fault. 

I’m standing next to the teleprompter Trump is reading from in the East Room and it says CPB. 

But Trump has said “CBC” over and over.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“You’re not nervous are you?” Trump says, calling a Hispanic-looking immigration official to the podium. 

“Speaks perfect English,” Trump says of the agent, who arrested someone for trying to illegally smuggle 78 immigrants into the US.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “That’s like saying, ‘I want to get rid of the Marines.’ ... I just think it’s unconscionable and frankly I think it’s downright unpatriotic and treasonous,” Georgia Sen. David Perdue says at White House event to salute immigration officers, of critics calling for abolishing ICE.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump nominates the Fed’s chairman, but the agency is independent and historically frustrated presidents by raising interest rates without regard for politics.

Bloomberg scoop:

“They should have given (Brunson) back a long time ago."

text:
Manafort happens to be a “good person,” Trump tells the press this morning before flying to Hamptons.
"I think it's very sad what they've done to Paul Manafort.”

text:
“They have a wonderful Christian pastor,” Trump tells press on south lawn, referring to Turkey. 
"They made up this phony charge that he's a spy,” Trump said. “He’s not a spy.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I think that Bruce Ohr is a disgrace. I suspect I'll be taking it away very quickly,” Trump says, referring to ex-US associate deputy attorney general. 

Ohr’s wife is Nellie Ohr, who worked as a contractor for Fusion GPS, the company known for the anti-Trump dossier.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“There's no silence, if anything I'm giving him a bigger voice,” Trump tells press on south lawn, referring to stripping Brennan of his security clearance.

Read piece by Bloomberg’s @EliLake: “Trump Is Not Trying to Silence Brennan”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Trump tells press on south lawn he’d love to see twice-a-year reporting for businesses. 

It was PepsiCo CEO who gave him the idea for businesses to report their earnings less frequently.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
“I don't talk about that,” Trump said when asked if he would pardon Paul Manafort.

Trump spoke briefly to press on south lawn at WH before departing for the weekend—he’s in the Hamptons, then golfing at his private club at Bedminster, NJ.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: Trump is mulling idea of ending quarterly reporting for businesses.

A friend called him and told him what Sarah had said, he says.

And there were multiple discussions with top officials, WH aides say.

text: For at least the last couple weeks, Trump has discussed Brennan’s security clearance with multiple top officials INCLUDING Dan Coats, the director of national intelligence, multiple WH sources tell me.

No meetings have happened since Turkey’s ambassador asked to meet with Bolton on Monday, and **none are scheduled.**
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
LATEST: Trump consulted with Vice President Mike Pence, Chief of Staff John Kelly and National Security Adviser John Bolton in deciding to revoke security clearance for former CIA Director John Brennan, I’m told.

Also: the White House general counsel’s office.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “If we're saying the only way I can speak is to be in adulation mode of this president, I’m sorry,” James Clapper, whose security clearance now is being reviewed by Trump admin, says on CNN.

text:
BREAKING: Trump revokes ex-CIA Director John Brennan’s security clearance, accusing him of “erratic conduct and behavior.”

Brennan led the CIA under Obama from 2013 to 2017 and has been an outspoken critic of Trump.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: When I asked Corey Lewandowski if he knew the last time Trump had bought groceries or gas, he shared anecdotes about Trump pulling out his AmEx to pay for dinner at the most expensive steakhouse in Iowa, and Trump driving his Rolls Royce to his country club in Bedminster, NJ.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text: “I don’t know if they’re enforceable,” Corey Lewandowski, referring to Trump’s NDAs, said at the @csmonitor breakfast today.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Corey Lewandowski said the first time he met Paul Manafort was in March 2016 at a dinner for four at Mar-a-Lago with Hope Hicks and Trump.

It was a Saturday. 

“By Monday it had leaked,” he said. “It was amazing.”

@csmonitor breakfast
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Lewandowski says he hasn’t spoken to Trump about the Manafort trial over the last 10 days.

And he’s never spoken with Trump “about a pardon at all.”

“I don’t see right now a scenario” where Trump is looking to pardon Manafort —because verdict soon. 

He added: “I pay my taxes.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Asked about his ties to T-Mobile, Corey Lewandowski said: “I don’t get paid by T-Mobile.”

“I have no idea if the federal government is going to approve or not approve mergers,” he said at the Christian Science Monitor breakfast this morning.
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Corey Lewandowski was asked multiple questions about lobbying connections. He’s not a registered lobbyist.

“I write books. I’m an author.”

But he “would be happy to help companies understand how the federal bureaucracy works and the mindset of individuals who work there.”
author: JenniferJJacobs

text:
Corey Lewandowski says he never heard Trump “use any type of racist words” when he was campaign aide. 

He and Trump “never had a conversation” about any rumored recording of Trump using n-word. 

Never discussed any “potential liability,” either, he said at @csmonitor breakfast.

She said somebody taping in the Situation Room, a place is filled with classified information, is the concern.

text:
Trump calls Omarosa a “dog” — one of his favorite insults if he wants to be particularly demeaning.

He has used it for James Clapper and Sally Yates (choked “like dogs” in Senate testimony), Glenn Beck (“fired like a dog!”), Marco Rubio (“sweating like a dog”) and many others.

GOP has wanted to shut it down since it opened.
